speaker: Saint
text: The Sage’s Hamlet? Yes, I’ve heard of it. It’s said to be hidden away at the heart of the Lost Treescape, past the fortress built at the woods’ edge by Jedah of the Duma Faithful. One of his men guards the path there— a loathsome creature called Dolth.

speaker: Priestess
text: The sage Halcyon was once a high priest of Duma himself, but he was driven out by Jedah. Jedah was always jealous of the loyal followers who flocked to Halcyon, so he worked diligently to seal him away from the outside world.

speaker: Flustered Cleric
text: Oh, I’ve really gone and done it now... Here I am, entrusted with the silver platter, and I drop it in the waterway! That platter is one of Mila’s most cherished artifacts. I can’t go back without it—she’ll be furious! She might even...smite me. But how do I begin to...?

speaker: Flustered Cleric
text: Oh, what a relief! I was sure there was some major smiting on the way... Here, this is for your troubles. Please accept it! I insist!

speaker: Flustered Cleric
text: If you do happen to see the silver platter, please let me know.

speaker: Flustered Cleric
text: That’s Mila’s silver platter! The one I dropped in the waterway! Please, that platter is a ritual artifact much beloved by the Earth Mother. May I please have it back? I beg it of you!

speaker: Flustered Cleric
text: No! You must reconsider!

speaker: Flustered Cleric
text: Mila’s silver platter lies at the water’s bottom! Oh, what to do, what to do...

speaker: Bewildered Woman
text: I made the pilgrimage here in search of medicine to treat my ailing daughter. But with the temple in this state, it seems my long trip was in vain. I’ve waited days for an audience with Mila, but still haven’t been granted one. All I need is a medicinal syrup made of mana herbs. If I had that, I could likely cure my daughter the theraputic way. And if Mila won’t intercede, finding that syrup may be my only hope.

speaker: Bewildered Woman
text: When I think of my daughter writhing in pain while I waste time here... I must find some way to get the medicinal syrup. I must!

speaker: Bewildered Woman
text: Is this...a medicinal syrup? And one made from mana herbs?! Oh, thank you! Thank you! My daughter will live! Oh, I can’t begin to express my relief... Please, let me repay you. This is all I have, but you must take it.

speaker: Bewildered Woman
text: No, I understand. It must be more valuable than a mere child’s life...

speaker: Nomah
text: Ah, Celica! I’m glad to see you safe, child.

speaker: Celica
text: Nomah? What in the world are you doing here?

speaker: Nomah
text: Not to put too fine a point on it, but I was worried about you. I followed you as far as this temple, but this place is just so LARGE! I’m embarrassed to say I got a bit lost, little one. Heh heh heh!

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, dear. Well, I’m glad to see you in good spirits nonetheless.

speaker: Nomah
text: perhaps we’d both enjoy more peace of mind if we stayed together. Might I travel with you from here on?

speaker: Nomah
text: I see. Well, I would hate to be the cause of worry, little one. I thought I had some action left in me still, but you know best.

speaker: Nomah
text: Ah! Hello again. Decided you couldn’t quite rest easy without me at your side, eh?

speaker: Celica
text: This place gives me chills... Small wonder it’s got a charming name like Dead Man’s Mire.

speaker: Saber
text: I can handle dead men. It’s this humidity that’s killin’ me! Let’s clear a path and get going already.

speaker: Celica
text: No arguments here.

speaker: Jedah
text: Anthiese...

speaker: Celica
text: Huh?

speaker: Saber
text: What is it, lass?

speaker: Celica
text: I thought I heard someone calling my name...

speaker: Saber
text: You sure? I didn’t hear anything.

speaker: Celica
text: Perhaps this place is simply preying on my imagination.

speaker: Garcia
text: Heh heh heh... Yessss, come to me. I’m gonna lay you to sleep at the bottom of this beautiful swamp.

speaker: Garcia
text: No! I was meant for...so much...

speaker: Saber
text: Curse these bones... I can’t stand fightin’ with mud squishin’ in my boots! We need to get out of this place yesterday. Whaddya say, lass?

speaker: Celica
text: Yes, let’s...

speaker: Jedah
text: Anthiese... This way... Come to me... if you wish to save Mila...and the boy...

speaker: Celica
text: *gasp* What?! Just who ARE you?

speaker: Saber
text: Celica? Where the hell are you going?!

speaker: Jedah
text: Keh heh heh... Welcome, Anthiese, crown princess of Zofia. Bearer of the Brand, and one marked by fate.

speaker: Celica
text: Who are you?

speaker: Jedah
text: My name is Jedah. First disciple to the great and glorious Duma.

speaker: Celica
text: You... You’re the one holding Mila!

speaker: Jedah
text: Oh, indeed I am! However, if you wish for her release, I propose a bargain.

speaker: Celica
text: What kind of bargain?

speaker: Jedah
text: Mila is well and good, but what I truly desire...is you. If you will offer up your soul to Lord Duma, I will cede Mila. She will be free to return to Zofia.

speaker: Celica
text: What kind of a bargain is that?! Why is my soul of any value to you?

speaker: Jedah
text: Have you never thought it strange, Princess Anthiese? Rigel and Zofia are twin nations founded on the backs of divine dragons. And yet, dire changes currently befall them both. Duma seeks power vast enough to destroy all balance in the world. Meanwhile, Mila’s intemperate bounty drives the Zofians to depravity.

speaker: Celica
text: Mila provides for her children!

speaker: Jedah
text: Her soul, as Duma’s, is host to the madness shared by all dragonkind. Duma will grow stronger till that power brings his ruin—and Rigel’s alongside it. It is no different from how Zofia now rots in Mila’s absence.

speaker: Celica
text: Her absence by your hand! And what is this madness you speak of? Do you truly claim that Mila and Duma are fated to destroy themselves?

speaker: Jedah
text: I do. Which is exactly why your soul is required. It is rare and precious—born of Zofian royal blood and marked by the Brand. Such a soul could set Duma’s path to rights and ensure his survival. And with Mila restored to her place, both our peoples might be saved. As for the boy, Alm—if you do this, he could lay down his arms.

speaker: Celica
text: *gasp*

speaker: Jedah
text: Well? What say you? I think it is a most generous offer, myself...

speaker: Celica
text: ...Perhaps you’re right. In fact, it may be TOO generous. How can I possibly believe a thing that you’ve told me?

speaker: Jedah
text: I have spoken only truth, Princess. But you needn’t give your answer now. I will await your reply atop Duma Tower. Keh heh heh...

speaker: Saber
text: There you are!

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, Saber...

speaker: Saber
text: The hell happened back there? It ain’t like you to just charge off.

speaker: Celica
text: I’m sorry. ...I’m so sorry.

speaker: Saber
text: Hmm? What’s going on, lass? You look pale.

speaker: Celica
text: ...Nothing. Come. We need to hurry.

speaker: Saber
text: Celica...

speaker: Boey
text: What’s this? Another graveyard? ...Of course it is.

speaker: Mae
text: Ugh, seriously? How are you not used to this by now? If you’ve seen one ghoul-ridden deathscape, you’ve seen ’em all!

speaker: Boey
text: I suppose you have...something of a point. Fine. Let’s press on.

speaker: Mae
text: Actually, looks like this place is full of necrodragons. So that’s new!

speaker: Boey
text: Eeeyaaaaugh!

speaker: Dolth
text: Heh heh heh. Welcome, child of fate. Once your soul is offered up to Lord Duma, our aims will be realized. Surely there is no call for needless struggle. This way, Your Highness...

speaker: Mae
text: Guess what, pal? I don’t care what kind of whacko nonsense you’re spouting— I won’t let you lay a finger on Celica!

speaker: Dolth
text: Hmph. The buzzing of ignorant flies is so very vexing. Perhaps the jaws of my necrodragons will silence your interruptions!

speaker: Dolth
text: Such stubborn children... It appears a lesson in pain is in order.

speaker: Dolth
text: Impossible...

speaker: Dolth
text: Wait... Anthiese!

speaker: Boey
text: He’s still alive?!

speaker: Dolth
text: How long will you place the lives of your friends at risk, Your Highness? You’re more clever than that.

speaker: Celica
text: That’s not...

speaker: Dolth
text: Come to Duma’s side!

speaker: Saber
text: What’s wrong with you, lass? Run!

speaker: Mae
text: Don’t be a crazy person, Celica! You can’t let him take you!

speaker: Dolth
text: Silence!

speaker: Mae
text: Aaah!

speaker: Celica
text: Stop! Leave them alone! Please! I’ll do whatever you ask!

speaker: Boey
text: Milady, no!

speaker: Dolth
text: You’ve made a wise decision, Your Highness. Now come, Anthiese...

speaker: Celica
text: Don’t go! Celica, you can’t... CELICA!

speaker: Dolth
text: Gwaaagh!

speaker: Celica
text: What...?

speaker: Celica
text: You!

speaker: Celica
text: Aaah!

speaker: Boey
text: Hey! What do you think you’re doing?!

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Would you so easily cast your life aside?

speaker: Celica
text: I... That’s not— My choices are not your matter, sir.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Not my matter?

speaker: Celica
text: You have aided me more than once, and I am grateful for it. But who are you to presume to know better how I might spend my life?! What could you possibly know about me?!

speaker: Mae
text: Celica... What’s going on? It’s not like you to act out like this...

speaker: Celica
text: Nothing is going on, Mae. Please just leave me alone. None of you can possibly know what I’m feeling.

speaker: Mae
text: Celica, that’s not fair!

speaker: Masked Knight
text: That’s not true, Celica. I know. ...As only a brother can.

speaker: Celica
text: ...What?

speaker: Conrad
text: It’s been a long time, huh, Sis?

speaker: Celica
text: You... But that’s... Conrad?! I don’t know how, but... Is it really you?! I was certain you were dead!

speaker: Conrad
text: I managed to escape the night they burned the villa. Some of the attendants led me to safety. From there, I fled straight to Rigel. My mother’s home. Desaix’s reach is long, but even he couldn’t follow me into the empire.

speaker: Celica
text: I should hate you for letting me mourn all this time, and yet...I’m so happy... But how did you come to possess my circlet?

speaker: Conrad
text: It was entrusted to me. I had orders to pass it on to you once you grew into your role.

speaker: Celica
text: Entrusted by who?

speaker: Conrad
text: Sorry, but I swore an oath never to reveal that information. Once I received it, however, I learned you’d left the island. I was so worried about you, I decided to follow and make sure you were safe. I never wanted to lie to you, but... Well, you weren’t the only one in hiding.

speaker: Celica
text: Heh. So that’s why you wore the mask?

speaker: Conrad
text: Well, it IS rather dashing, isn’t it?

speaker: Mae
text: Hah! You think THAT thing is—

speaker: Boey
text: Mae! He’s Celica’s older brother. You know, royalty?

speaker: Mae
text: Oh, right. Sorry. But man, he sure is a lot less moody once that mask comes off, huh? He’s like a completely different guy!

speaker: Boey
text: Almost as if he pretends to be someone else while in disguise. ...Imagine that.

speaker: Mae
text: Oh yeah... Hee hee! Yeah, that was dumb.

speaker: Conrad
text: I actually hadn’t intended to reveal myself at all. Halcyon—who looked after me at the Sage’s Hamlet—made me swear not to. I’ll have to work on my apology before I go back there... He’s right, though. The most dangerous thing I could be is not dead. But after watching you... I couldn’t listen to you speak as if you were all alone in the world. It drove a knife right through my heart.

speaker: Celica
text: Conrad... I’m so sorry.

speaker: Conrad
text: Please don’t apologize. I understand. I watched you come this far, after all. I saw you bear the weight of the world by yourself as Zofia’s crown princess. But from this point on, I’d like to share that burden with you. I’ll be at your side and protect you with my life. But you have to promise me something first... Don’t ever try to throw your life away like that again.

speaker: Celica
text: You’re right. I’m sorry, Conrad...

speaker: Conrad
text: This marks the entrance to the Lost Treescape. The Sage’s Hamlet—where Halcyon lives—lies within.

speaker: Celica
text: I’ve heard it said a curious power is at work in these woods. And that the trees themselves conspire to hide the path to the hamlet. I’m grateful we have you to lead the way. So then, Brother—which way do we head first?

speaker: Conrad
text: Er, yeah... See, this was actually my first time leaving the woods alone. And I’m not exactly sure how to... you know. Get back? But hey, adventure! We’ll just find the path together!

speaker: Celica
text: Y-yes, adventure. ...Shall we get started, then?

speaker: Celica
text: This wood is thick and dark, and plays havoc with one’s sense of direction. The tall stone pillars stand as sentinels, keeping watch over our intrusion.

speaker: Celica
text: Er, Sage Halcyon? Sir? I’m—

speaker: Halcyon
text: Ah! Celica, child of fate. I’m glad you’ve come,

speaker: Celica
text: Child of fate... You’re not the first to call me that. But I have no idea where my fate lies. Please, Halcyon. Grant me guidance. Tell me what fate holds for me. I’m so lost... I don’t know what to do!

speaker: Halcyon
text: I know you have suffered much along the path here, Celica. But I fear I ken no more of anyone’s fate than you do. What I do ken, however, is this: Two things exist to guide you. One is the Brand you bear. The other is your soul’s pair with the selfsame mark.

speaker: Celica
text: The selfsame... Do you mean Alm?

speaker: Halcyon
text: Indeed. Why were you born with the Brand? And why are there two of you? These are the questions you must consider. And always remember that you are not alone.

speaker: Celica
text: ...Right. Thank you, Sage Halcyon.

speaker: Halcyon
text: Of course, child. But while I cannot read the future, my magic may yet assist you. If there is anything you wish for, tell me.

speaker: Celica
text: I...I wish nothing for myself. But I am worried for Alm. Please, if such a thing is possible, use your powers to help him.

speaker: Halcyon
text: The other child of fate? Yours is a generous heart. Very well...

speaker: Celica
text: Ah! What just happened?

speaker: Halcyon
text: I sent my powers on to Alm. With them, he will be able to draw on new strength beyond himself. He need only will for it.

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, thank you, Halcyon!

speaker: Halcyon
text: Tell me, Celica. Do you wish to see Alm?

speaker: Celica
text: What? Well, of course I do, but... I doubt Alm is eager to see me. I said terrible things to him when we last parted.

speaker: Halcyon
text: Heh heh. The fire of youth at work. All the more reason to meet and speak again, no? I can send you to him if you desire it. Not your physical form, but a projection of your mind. Enough to speak, at least.

speaker: Celica
text: Is that really possible?

speaker: Halcyon
text: It is. Close your eyes, child. ......

speaker: Celica
text: Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: Hmm? I heard my name...

speaker: Celica
text: Alm, it’s me. It’s Celica!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica? How are you here? Actually, where are you? Come out already!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm! I can’t believe I actually have this chance...

speaker: Alm
text: Celica! Is this...just an illusion? Is it really you?

speaker: Celica
text: Yes, it’s me. Sage Halcyon’s magic is allowing me to speak with you. Oh, I’ve missed you so much!

speaker: Alm
text: I’m happy to see you, too.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm, listen, I... *sob* I...

speaker: Alm
text: Whoa, what’s wrong? ...Celica? Did something happen? Are things not going as well as you’d hoped? Augh, I wish you were here in person! I don’t know what to... Please don’t cry.

speaker: Celica
text: Y-you’re not angry? I said such terrible things to you back at the castle.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? Wait, that’s been bothering you? I mean, sure, I was sad you didn’t seem to see my side of things. But I’d never get mad at you.

speaker: Celica
text: Why not?

speaker: Alm
text: ...Why not? You sure do like putting me on the spot. Didn’t we have a similar conversation years ago?

speaker: Celica
text: Ha! *sniff* I suppose we did. You were always so nice to me, while I— While I’m always thinking only of myself. I’m sorry, Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: Celica? What’s wrong?

speaker: Celica
text: I’ve finally remembered why I left the island in the first place. I’m going to see Duma.

speaker: Alm
text: What? No! Celica, the Duma Faithful are— It’s too dangerous! There’s no telling what they’ll do to you!

speaker: Celica
text: Even so, I have to go. Mila wasn’t in her temple, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? What does that mean?

speaker: Celica
text: Emperor Rudolf attacked. She’s being held captive in Duma Tower. That must be the reason why Zofia’s land has gone barren.

speaker: Alm
text: No... The emperor?

speaker: Celica
text: And that’s why I must go— I have to free Mila. I’m the only one who can.

speaker: Alm
text: Wait, Celica... I finally figured it out, but... you’re actually... You’re the princess of Zofia, aren’t you? Princess Anthiese.

speaker: Celica
text: ...I am. Heh. I guess my secret’s out.

speaker: Alm
text: Ugh, now I’m cringing at what I said to you before. Talk about thoughtless! Forgive me, Celica. But don’t worry—I promise I’ll get your kingdom back. So please promise me in turn that you won’t—

speaker: Celica
text: It’s kind of you, Alm. But I have to. Just winning this war isn’t enough.

speaker: Alm
text: What? I don’t understand.

speaker: Celica
text: It’ll be clear to you soon. I’ll do everything I can here. Please just...be safe.

speaker: Alm
text: Celica? Wait, Celica! Celica!

speaker: Halcyon
text: Duma Tower is just ahead. Be well prepared before you go.

speaker: Cleric
text: This place is called the Sage’s Hamlet. The great sage Halcyon’s magic shields us from evil. If you wish to speak with him, you’ll find him at his home.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Halcyon was once a priest of the Duma Faithful. There he struggled against Jedah, who sought to rule by force and terror. But in the end, he was driven out... This place has been his hermitage ever since.

speaker: Young Man
text: This whole area has been tainted. The legacy of Dolth and Garcia’s wicked experiments. I had always thought Emperor Rudolf a wise man, but only a fool would suffer the abuses of the Duma Faithful to grow so bold. If I’m honest, I’m cheering for Zofia’s Deliverance in all this.

speaker: Man
text: Do you all really mean to fight Jedah? I urge you to reconsider. He’s a terrifying man. If you must fight him, there’s only one way. Four... Eight... Twelve... Nraagh! I-it hurts...! J-Jedah’s...curse...!

speaker: Woman
text: Conrad’s mother was of Rigelian noble birth. She was forced to wed the king of Zofia in order to procure food for Rigel... Can you imagine such a fate? My blood boils to even think of it!

speaker: Hermit
text: I’ve spent my life here brewing nectar, drink of the gods. Duma and Mila both have partaken of my humble creations. Know you how nectar is made? ...No? Then let me enlighten you! Steep one gargoyle ear in medicinal syrup to form the base. Pour in bonewalker oil and mix well, then allow it to ferment while agitating. Season the result with Duma moss, and the work is done. Voila! Nectar! A libation fit to make the grandest gods salivate! You’re drooling over the prospect as well, no doubt. Bring me the ingredients, and I might be convinced to make you a batch. That’s medicinal syrup, Duma moss, a gargoyle ear, and bonewalker oil!

speaker: Hermit
text: Medicinal syrup, Duma moss, a gargoyle ear, and bonewalker oil... Excellent! You’ve all the ingredients required to make nectar! However, the fermentation process takes three days. Return to me then. But do return, for a taste of heaven itself awaits you!

speaker: Hermit
text: You don’t desire a taste of nectar? ...How odd. Are you sure you are well?

speaker: Hermit
text: You haven’t the ingredients. I need medicinal syrup, bonewalker oil, a gargoyle ear, and Duma moss. If you wish to taste nectar, you must procure those items.

speaker: Hermit
text: I need medicinal syrup, bonewalker oil, a gargoyle ear, and Duma moss. If you wish to taste nectar, you must procure those items.

speaker: Hermit
text: Ah, there you are. I’ve been waiting. You’re dying from anticipation, no doubt. But here! Your nectar awaits!

speaker: Hermit
text: If you ever desire another taste, return once more with the ingredients.

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: I’ve been poring over these resources in my studies to create new medicines. One book tells of a foreign land’s theory of food as medicine. It prescribes liver for those with ailing livers, brains for headaches, and so on. I found the idea most fascinating. Consider the gargoyle—it hears the faintest sound of its prey, then strikes! Imagine what a medicine brewed from its ears could do for a person. Which brings me to a request... Could I impose upon you to procure three gargoyle ears? Please! My research needs you!

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Have you managed to find three gargoyle ears?

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: What splendid specimens! Please, take this for your time.

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: I’ll begin work on formulating that new medicine immediately. Things are about to get busy around here!

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: But what use could you have for... Mmm. Perhaps I don’t want to know.

speaker: Jamil
text: You persist in your ignorance of Duma’s teachings at your own peril!

speaker: Jamil
text: Duma’s blessings...be upon us...

speaker: Conrad
text: Something wrong? The closer we get to Duma Tower, the quieter you become.

speaker: Celica
text: What? No I don’t! ...Er, do I? I suppose I’m just getting a bit nervous as we draw near.

speaker: Conrad
text: And...that’s really it? You’re not hiding anything?

speaker: Celica
text: Conrad, you’re worrying over nothing.

speaker: Conrad
text: Well, all right, if you say so.

speaker: Jedah
text: Keh heh heh. I’m so pleased you’ve come, Anthiese.

speaker: Celica
text: Enough talk, Jedah! I’ve come to judge the truth of your claims. I will meet with Mila first. Any decision I reach will come after.

speaker: Jedah
text: As you will. But my bargain was with you alone. The rest will die for trespassing upon this holy place.

speaker: Celica
text: What? But my life is the only one you need!

speaker: Jedah
text: This is true. But I’ve no fondness for interruptions, and they’ve proven the meddling sort. I trust you will forgive me for being cautious.

speaker: Celica
text: Gods, he’s completely mad... Everyone, be careful!

speaker: Jedah
text: I’ve no use for any of you save Anthiese. Now begone!

speaker: Jedah
text: Keh heh heh... Your struggling is most precious. But I’ll not end your meager little lives quite yet. Anthiese! You will ascend Duma Tower and join me at its pinnacle! ...Unless you wish to lose your precious Alm, that is.

speaker: Sonya
text: Jedah!

speaker: Jedah
text: Well, if it isn’t Sonya.

speaker: Sonya
text: You’ve no idea how long I’ve waited for this day. You stole the lives of my sisters and cursed them to become witches! I will avenge them with your blood!

speaker: Sonya
text: Their souls were offered to Duma freely, and both received endless bliss in turn. Only a fool would refuse to see a truth so plain. You are a burden to your wise sisters, and I shall relieve them of it now!

speaker: Celica
text: I’m so sorry. I never thought it would play out that way.

speaker: Saber
text: You’re SORRY?! What in the name of hell just happened here? You KNOW that dog Jedah? And what’s this “bargain” he was talking about?

speaker: Celica
text: I... I can’t say. I know that’s not what you want to hear, but—

speaker: Saber
text: Just...stop. You’ve been full of secrets from the start, and I knew you had your reasons. But I thought you’d at least give me a little bit of trust at this point.

speaker: Celica
text: I do trust you, Saber! I trust all of you with my very life! But this is something...different.

speaker: Saber
text: Dammit, lass! That’s—

speaker: Celica
text: I’m sorry, Saber. But right now, we have to get to Duma Tower. Mila is there, and it’s imperative that I speak with her. Once I do that, I swear I’ll tell you everything. Until then, I have to ask that you place your trust in me one more time.

speaker: Saber
text: ...Ah, hell. You know I trust you. But you better start talking as soon as you’re done with Mila—got it?

speaker: Celica
text: I will. I promise.

speaker: Celica
text: The tower is massive... Oppressive. Like Duma's power given form. What lies beyond the quest for ever-greater power? Perhaps that answer lies at the tower's peak.

speaker: Jedah
text: Impressive. I did not expect all of you to make it here.

speaker: Celica
text: Enough talk. I will see Mila now. Where is she?

speaker: Jedah
text: Keh heh heh... Such impatience is unseemly, Your Highness. And at any rate, I’m afraid Mila isn’t here. She’s underground—on Lord Duma's altar.

speaker: Celica
text: I don’t understand.

speaker: Jedah
text: I can grant you sight, if you so desire. Gaze now upon your precious Earth Mother!

speaker: Celica
text: Oh no! What have you done?!

speaker: Mae
text: Sh-she's been turned to stone!

speaker: Conrad
text: Look there! Piercing her brow! Is that...Falchion?

speaker: Jedah
text: You have a keen eye, boy. It is indeed the divine blade. You will likely doubt me when I say this, but that was Mila's doing. The moment Emperor Rudolf sealed her power, Mila sealed away Falchion. Do not ask me her motive in this, for I understand it not. But no force in this world now remains which can harm Lord Duma. She's left her children to their fates! Kyaaaaaa ha ha ha ha!

speaker: Celica
text: No... This isn't possible!

speaker: Celica
text: Mila, I don’t understand. Why would you do this? Have you truly forsaken us?!

speaker: Jedah
text: Heh heh heh, Your lamentations are wasted, child. If you truly wish for her release, you know what must be done. You must offer up your soul to Lord Duma.

speaker: Boey
text: Did he just say what I think he said?

speaker: Mae
text: Offer her...soul? Oh gods! Celica, no! He wants to turn you into a witch! That is a REALLY bad idea!

speaker: Celica
text: *sigh* There's no other choice. Without the divine dragons' power, all of Valentia's people are lost, and the only thing that can save the dragons is the soul of a Brand-bearer.

speaker: Saber
text: So... that's what you couldn't tell us.

speaker: Celica
text: [sadly] *sigh*

speaker: Conrad
text: Anthiese, you made me a promise, remember? You promised not to throw your life away again.

speaker: Celica
text: I'm sorry, Conrad. I'm sorry, everyone. Please forgive me... I can't tell you how much it means to me that we’ve come so far together.

speaker: Conrad
text: Anthiese!

speaker: Jedah
text: You lot are no longer necessary. Begone to wherever you will.

speaker: Boey
text: Huh?!

speaker: Mae
text: *screams*

speaker: Celica
text: NO!

speaker: Jedah
text: Calm yourself, Your Highness. I've merely sent them below. As for your preparations, I fear they will take some time yet. You can while away the hours here watching the boy suffer.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm? No!

speaker: Clive
text: A word, Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Clive! Did we receive a reply to our petition?

speaker: Clive
text: Unfortunately, no. The empire’s silence is likely its answer. I believe it wise to resign ourselves. Emperor Rudolf has no intention of treating for peace. He means to continue his march on Zofian soil.

speaker: Alm
text: Damn...

speaker: Clive
text: Our men are approaching their limit. And Rigel's climate is far colder than what they knew in Zofia. Further delaying here will only sap their strength and morale.

speaker: Alm
text: All right, Clive. I trust your judgment. Let’s get ready to march.

speaker: Clive
text: Understood. I’ll pass word to the others and prepare them to cross into the empire.

speaker: Alm
text: ...... What’s all of this leading to?

speaker: Gray
text: Hey, Alm! I heard the news—guess the time’s finally come, eh?

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah. We’re headed into Rigel. We’ll need to be more careful than ever past this point.

speaker: Gray
text: Hey, careful is my middle name! ...No, really. I had it legally changed. ...Not even a chuckle? Really? Come on, what’s with the glowering? We’ve got this. Hell, I’VE got this! We’re not the same scraggly runts we were when we left Ram, you know? I’ll forge a new legend in battle! Heh, Clair'll probably throw herself at me. If Tobin comes crying about suddenly wanting to leave, don’t get mad, okay?

speaker: Alm
text: Heh heh. That...would be a problem. I need Tobin right where he is. Thanks, Gray. For everything. I’m counting on you.

speaker: Gray
text: 'Course. Still, I don’t see why the wind here’s gotta be so damned cold.

speaker: Alm
text: Is it really that bad?

speaker: Gray
text: You’re not freezing your tenders off? I’m impressed.

speaker: Alm
text: It’s not that it doesn’t feel cold. It's more like...I know this feeling. Like the air here’s familiar.

speaker: Gray
text: Never mind. Come on, let’s go.

speaker: Sluice Keeper
text: This sluice gate was built roughly one hundred years ago. One marvels at our ancestors for crafting something so complex. Sadly, none have operated the sluice in so long that the machinery is rusting. I’d like to do fix the problem before the entire works become unusable. But alas, I’ve run out of the special oil I need to perform the maintenance. Do you think you could help?

speaker: Sluice Keeper
text: Perhaps you’ve seen Terrors called bonewalkers? Those with heads aflame? The reason their heads burn is because of a special oil stored in their skulls. That same oil works wonders on machinery. Takes the rust right out! Once you’ve gone bonewalker oil, there’s no going back. ...Heh. So if it’s not a hassle, could you hunt some bonewalkers and gather their oil?

speaker: Sluice Keeper
text: Have you obtained the bonewalker oil?

speaker: Sluice Keeper
text: Ah! This is bonewalker oil, all right. I can use this to polish the sluice parts until they sparkle! Thanks for going through the trouble. Here’s a little reward.

speaker: Sluice Keeper
text: As you can see, the sluice machinery is massive! You can never have too much bonewalker oil around here. Drop by whenever you acquire some.

speaker: Sluice Keeper
text: Wait, you want the oil for yourself? But it’s useless! Terrible for the skin!

speaker: Girl
text: Hey, do you like cute things? ‘Cause I LOVE cute things!

speaker: Girl
text: Mamma Mila! That’s adorable! Are you sure I can have it? Thanks soooo much! Oh, and you can have this ’cause you’re nice.

speaker: Girl
text: Eeeew, gross! I don’t want THAT!

speaker: Girl
text: That is not even slightly cute. Puh-lease!

speaker: Girl
text: Don’t try to fool me just ’cause I’m an adorable little girl!

speaker: Girl
text: That’s not quite what I had in mind.

speaker: Girl
text: You haven’t shown me even one iota of cute yet. Why did I even ask?! *siiiiiigh*

speaker: Lukas
text: Alm? We’re ready to march. According to our intelligence, Rigel’s forces await in the forest ahead. General Berkut is commanding them personally.

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut... I guess they’re serious about holding the border.

speaker: Lukas
text: Indeed. Yet we’ve no choice but to cross it.

speaker: Alm
text: ...Right.

speaker: Berkut
text: You kept me waiting, Alm. I was starting to wonder if you’d actually come.

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut!

speaker: Berkut
text: That’s quite the little army you’ve assembled. I’m almost impressed. For a ragtag group of gathered scraps, the Deliverance actually looks the part.

speaker: Berkut
text: Still, it seems you’ve all let a few meager successes go to your heads. Who are you to dare threaten Rigel’s borders? Lowborn fool. Do you truly fancy yourself the next king of Zofia?! You must learn your place!

speaker: Clive
text: You’ve got it all wrong, Berkut.

speaker: Fernand
text: Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: I've been at Alm’s side from the outset, watching all that he has done. He’s a brave warrior, and a good man worthy of the crown. He’s made such clear to me time and again.. The right of kings is not decided by blood or station. It lies in what a man believes. What keeps him up at night. It lies in a man’s actions!

speaker: Fernand
text: Enough already! You would throw away your pride as a Zofian noble and bow to a commoner?! I see now that the Clive I once knew is well and truly dead. Now it falls on me to bury him!

speaker: Soldier
text: We’re all ready, sir.

speaker: Alm
text: Understood.

speaker: Soldier
text: What is it, sir?

speaker: Alm
text: Sorry. I’m ready.

speaker: Alm
text: Warriors, it’s time! Time to defeat Emperor Rudolf, and bring this bloody war to an end! Now then—who will defend Zofia?!

speaker: Soldiers
text: We will defend her!

speaker: Alm
text: Then charge!

speaker: Fernand
text: My lord!

speaker: Berkut
text: Follow me! These worms have no right to crawl onto our soil!

speaker: Berkut
text: Only death awaits those who would profane Rigel’s soil. Consider it a mercy your bones will rest here, in sight of your homeland!

speaker: Berkut
text: Nrgh... No... Am I to lose again? AGAIN?!

speaker: Fernand
text: Your existence is a black mark on the honor of Zofia. It ends today!

speaker: Fernand
text: Gyaugh! How...how can I lose to such rabble...?

speaker: Berkut
text: Nnngh... Damn you.

speaker: Alm
text: You’re plenty strong, Berkut. No one would deny that. But that’s why I must end this here.

speaker: Berkut
text: I can’t believe it’s come to this...

speaker: Alm
text: What’s—

speaker: Tobin
text: Nnnh... Waaaaaugh! Wh-what’s happening, Alm?!

speaker: Alm
text: Tobin! Everyone! Are you all right?

speaker: Ally Soldier
text: [screaming] H-Help me! Please!

speaker: Alm
text: By the gods... Are those...hands sprouting from the earth? Is this some kind of magic?!

speaker: Lukas
text: No, at least not as we know it. Our own magic doesn’t seem to have any effect. This is something else entirely... Waugh!

speaker: Alm
text: Lukas! I’ve got to do something before-- Berkut, what have you done?!

speaker: Berkut
text: So this is Duma's power? It’s...it’s hideous...

speaker: Alm
text: You did this?

speaker: Berkut
text: You’ve no need to know any more. You’ll die here with the rest.

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut, wait! WAIT! ...Rragh! I won’t let it end here. Not before I see you again, Celica!

speaker: Alm
text: ...Huh?

speaker: Tobin
text: Whoa. What was that light?

speaker: Alm
text: Celica’s charm? Then maybe... Celica, can you hear me? Please, I’m begging you, help me! Help us all!

speaker: Berkut
text: What? Impossible! Duma’s spell is broken?! How did you do this?!

speaker: Alm
text: I don’t know. I just said a prayer to someone I love.

speaker: Berkut
text: Bah! Spare me your treacly platitudes! I was meant for greatness! But you, you’re just a...just a...

speaker: Fernand
text: Lord Berkut! The spell is broken, but they haven’t the strength to give chase. You must use this time to escape!

speaker: Berkut
text: You would have me retreat in the face of these dogs?!

speaker: Fernand
text: I would ask that you live! His Excellency the Emperor will understand. Now go! Quickly!

speaker: Berkut
text: Rragh!

speaker: Fernand
text: Did that power truly come from Duma? There is no pride in resorting to such unholy means. What is it the Empire—no, the Duma Faithful—are trying to accomplish?

speaker: Tobin
text: They’re gone, Alm. Should we go after them?

speaker: Alm
text: No. Pursuing them in our current condition is only asking for further losses.

speaker: Tobin
text: Well, what you did just now was pretty incredible. But, uh... What DID you do, exactly?

speaker: Alm
text: Honestly, Tobin, I panicked. I said a frantic prayer to the charm Celica gave me and then... it must have been her. She saved us.

speaker: Tobin
text: Huh... Guess I owe somebody a big thank-you next time we bump into her.

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah, Tobin. I think we all do.

speaker: Berkut
text: DAMN HIM! Why?! Why can’t I beat him?! To be humiliated so by a commoner! And TWICE, no less!

speaker: Rinea
text: My lord, please! You must try to calm down. You are safe. That’s all I need to be—

speaker: Berkut
text: SILENCE, woman! What could you possibly know?!

speaker: Rinea
text: *gasp* Berkut...

speaker: Berkut
text: From childhood, all that’s ever been asked of me is strength. It is my duty as one born to stand above others! To rule! I’ve been taught that all my life! By my father, my mother! How am I to remain calm in the face of defeat at the hands of peasants?! I even debased myself by making use of that deviant’s powers! And it’s still not enough?
Call to me...

speaker: Berkut
text: Hngh?!
You who thirst for power... Call to me...

speaker: Berkut
text: Who is... Identify yourself!

speaker: Rinea
text: Berkut? What’s the matter? You’re frightening me...

speaker: Berkut
text: You don’t hear it? What was that voice...?

speaker: Alm
text: Where do these woods lead, exactly?

speaker: Clive
text: To Fear Mountain. Home to Nuibaba of the Duma Faithful. Most would cross the Rigel Plains to the west to reach the imperial palace, so there’s no NEED to take this route, should we wish for safer passage...

speaker: Lukas
text: I propose that we advance regardless.

speaker: Alm
text: Why is that, Lukas?

speaker: Lukas
text: I’ve heard grim reports of this arcanist Nuibaba. She’s of a kind with General Jerome, who controls the Rigel Plains. They’re tyrants both, and their subjects suffer terribly under their yoke. But if a pack of good-hearted invaders such as us were to take them out? Well, we might find ourselves with new support among the Rigelian masses...

speaker: Alm
text: Interesting...

speaker: Lukas
text: Granted, we run the risk of losing men we can’t afford to be without, so I’m not insisting we do this. I only offer the suggestion.

speaker: Alm
text: I'll think on it, Lukas. Thank you.

speaker: Xaizor
text: My name is Xaizor, and I’m afraid your path ends here. While I bear you no grudge, my master’s orders are absolute.

speaker: Xaizor
text: I can serve you...no longer... Forgive me...Emperor...Rudolf...

speaker: Clive
text: So, Alm? Have you made up your mind as to where we’re headed?

speaker: Alm
text: Yes, I think so.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: Huh?

speaker: Clive
text: What is it, Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: This is going to sound crazy, but I thought I heard...Celica.

speaker: Clive
text: Celica? The priestess girl from the castle? I’m sorry to say, I heard nothing...

speaker: Celica
text: Alm... I need you, Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: It IS her! Where are you, Celica?!

speaker: Clive
text: Huh? What’s... Alm, wait!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica! Where are you, Celica?!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm... I’m so glad you’ve come...

speaker: Alm
text: Celica?! What is this...? An illusion?

speaker: Celica
text: Yes... Alm, I’m being held prisoner in Nuibaba’s abode.

speaker: Alm
text: What? Are you hurt?!

speaker: Celica
text: Help me, Alm... I have faith... I know you’ll come... I’m waiting for you... I’ve always been waiting...

speaker: Alm
text: Wait! Celica, don’t go! Dammit! Was that really her?

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Eee hee hee... What next, child of fate? You slipped my grasp at the border, but now you run straight to my snare. Despite the bungling of that useless Berkut... Tsk, no matter. All will be mine soon enough. I’ll not let the likes of Jedah claim a bearer of the Brand. The power of such a soul could grant me life eternal! Eee hee... Eeeeee hee hee hee!

speaker: Marla
text: Oh, dear. Such naughty children, lashing out at Lord Duma so! You’ve earned quite the punishment...

speaker: Alm
text: Another witch? Listen to me—you’re being controlled! You have to fight this!

speaker: Lukas
text: I'm sorry, Alm. You can’t help her. Only death can break Duma’s hold over those who have offered up their souls.

speaker: Alm
text: No...

speaker: Marla
text: Hee hee...

speaker: Marla
text: Hee... I’ll sing you a lullaby... It’s time for all the good little children to go to sleep.

speaker: Marla
text: Oh dear... Such...stubborn children... You should...listen to...your...

speaker: Alm
text: I can feel an uncomfortably warm breeze pushing back at me, attended by a low rumbling. The voices of the dead, perhaps, calling from the land beyond, hungry again for life. Valentia knows no deeper pit than this, the guts of Fear Mountain.

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Eee hee hee... Welcome, warriors of the Deliverance. My doors stand open to receive you.

speaker: Alm
text: Are you Nuibaba? Where’s Celica?!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: You poor fool. There’s no one here by that name. I merely used a vision of whomever you held fast in your heart to draw you in.

speaker: Alm
text: So it WAS a trap!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Eeeee hee hee hee! Oh, and how clumsily you’ve fallen into it! The specter of love ever draws fools such as you like butterflies to nectar. And yet, the real feast is yet to come... when I dine upon your souls!

speaker: Alm
text: *groans* Get ready, everyone!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Come forth, Medusa! Honor the pact you’ve sworn to me!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Come close... Let me share with you death’s embrace!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Ahhh... It cannot be... I won’t be...

speaker: Cleric
text: Nuibaba gathered young and comely girls from all across Rigel. She made sacrifices of them—fed them to monsters to preserve her own youth.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Ooo! You’ve met Lord Berkut? You’re so lucky. He’s amaaaaazing. Every woman in Rigel wishes they could be his. *sigh* Alas, it’s an impossible dream, now that he’s to wed Rinea...

speaker: Alm
text: Are you all right? Nuibaba has been dealt with, in case you’re wondering.

speaker: Tatiana
text: She’s gone? You mean it? Oh, thank you! I’ve been searching for my Zeke, but coming here was clearly a mistake. If you don’t mind my asking, who are you, exactly?

speaker: Alm
text: We’re the Deliverance.

speaker: Tatiana
text: Then it’s true... Zofia really HAS invaded! S-Stay back! Zeke, HELP!

speaker: Alm
text: Um, we just got finished saving you. You realize that, right? And we sure didn’t come all this way just to start harming innocent Rigelians. So long as we don’t meet on the field of battle, you’re no enemy of mine.

speaker: Tatiana
text: I’m...not? Sorry, my heart was racing a little faster than my brain there. But I can see you’re a man of his word. Please forgive me!

speaker: Alm
text: Er, it’s all right. I know you’ve been through a lot. And technically, we DID invade, so...

speaker: Tatiana
text: Well, you still seem more honorable than the troops lording over the village. ... *gasp* Oh no!

speaker: Alm
text: Huh?

speaker: Tatiana
text: [To Clive] Are you the leader of this "Deliverance"? Of course you are. You must be. Just look at you! In that case, I need your help. My lover, Zeke, is in peril!

speaker: Clive
text: Forgive me, milady, but I fear you stand corrected. I am not the leader of the Deliverance.

speaker: Tatiana
text: But you’re so tall and dashing! I thought for sure... Hmm... [To Lukas] It’s YOU, isn’t it? Yes, it must be! Witness the focused air about you!

speaker: Lukas
text: Heh. Wrong again, I fear. Alm here commands us.

speaker: Tatiana
text: What?

speaker: Alm
text: Uh, hey there.

speaker: Tatiana
text: Ack! F-forgive me! It’s just that you’re so young and... young.

speaker: Alm
text: Don’t worry about it. Tell us more about this “Zeke” person.

speaker: Tatiana
text: Ah yes! Zeke! Ezekiel! You’re on your way to Rigel Castle, right? Then you’re certain to meet Zeke on the Rigel Plains along the way. When that happens, don’t kill him! Don’t you DARE! His superior officer, Jerome, is a no-good, rotten lout. He and Nuibaba have brought immense suffering upon the locals. Zeke tried to stand up to Jerome and his wicked ways, but once I was taken captive, my love had no choice but to obey. If you tell Zeke I’m free, however, I know he’ll fight for what’s right.

speaker: Alm
text: All right, but this Zeke—er, Ezekiel— is a Rigelian solider, isn’t he? If he attacks us, we’ll have no choice but to answer in kind.

speaker: Tatiana
text: Aw, he won’t attack you. He’s a sweetie pie! Heck, he’s going to be over the moon about how you all saved me! In fact, I’m sure he’ll even come to your aid. He’s just that kind of man. *sigh*

speaker: Alm
text: You’re oddly...convincing. I actually believe you.

speaker: Tatiana
text: Of course you do! Just remember, no killing my sweet Zeke. Got it? I know you’ll get him out of his predicament. I just know it. Hey, wait a second... Why don’t I go WITH you? I just miss my love so much!

speaker: Tatiana
text: All right. Perhaps it’s for the best. I’ll just wait here for my love to return. It wouldn’t do him any good for me to wander off and get captured again.

speaker: Tatiana
text: Hmm? Yes? So you want my company? Is that it?

speaker: Merchant
text: Oh, thank you for saving me! I’m but a humble merchant from a small village in the forest. On the way back from selling my wares, Tatarrah captured me and sent me here. I never thought I’d live to see the outside world again. But because of you, I’ll be able to see my family once more. My wife must be so worried! I had best be off. If you ever make it to our village in the forest, please stop by and say hello!

speaker: Soldier
text: Jerome, sir? My report. The Deliverance forces will reach these plains momentarily.

speaker: Jerome
text: Hmph. So the peasants made it here after all. Bring me Ezekiel!

speaker: Zeke
text: I’m here, sir. You have need of me?

speaker: Jerome
text: The Zofian rabble will be upon us in due time. Prepare to intercept them. ...And mind your allegiances wisely. If I smell even a whiff of betrayal, you know what will happen.

speaker: Tatiana
text: Ah, Zeke! It’s you!

speaker: Zeke
text: Tatiana? But how?!

speaker: Tatiana
text: It means you don’t have to heed another word Jerome says!

speaker: Zeke
text: Thank you, Tatiana. Now you have saved me as well. [to his soldiers] Men, set your sights on the target! We march on Jerome’s army! Prepare to attack!

speaker: Alm
text: You must be General Ezekiel.

speaker: Zeke
text: How do you know my name?

speaker: Alm
text: Tatiana told me about you.

speaker: Zeke
text: You know Tatiana as well?

speaker: Alm
text: We rescued her from Nuibaba. You should have no further cause to follow Jerome’s orders.

speaker: Zeke
text: I am reluctant to trust in these times. Yet, how else would you know all this? You have my thanks for saving her. Allow me to show my appreciation in deed as well as word. [to his soldiers] Men, set your sights on the target! We march on Jerome’s army! Prepare to attack!

speaker: Jerome
text: You dare?! I didn’t think you fool enough to betray me, Ezekiel. You know what fate awaits the girl now that—

speaker: Zeke
text: She’s free. And now so am I. You’ve ground the people here under heel and threatened my love. Prepare to answer for your crimes!

speaker: Zeke
text: Forgive me—it is not my wish to fight with you. I pray you’ll bear me no grudge in turn.

speaker: Zeke
text: Forgive me, Tatiana... Ah... Then you’re... Good. That’s...

speaker: Jerome
text: You upstarts have brought death upon yourselves!

speaker: Jerome
text: H-how is this... I am a blue blood... A general! I’ll not lose to...such—

speaker: Zeke
text: You must be Alm. Let me thank you again for helping Tatiana.

speaker: Alm
text: We’re happy to help, General. I heard you were opposed to this war. Will you lend us your strength? Not a man among us wishes this conflict to last any longer than it must.

speaker: Zeke
text: ...... I’m afraid I cannot offer you an answer here and now. There’s a village a ways ahead. I’ll await you there. Until then.

speaker: Alm
text: Ah...

speaker: Man
text: Oh, look who’s here! Welcome! You don’t have to feel uncomfortable. I don’t care what land you hail from! You got rid of that rotten Jerome, and that makes you a hero around here. He and Nuibaba from up Fear Mountain have caused us nothing but suffering. And who came to our aid? Not the emperor, nor the Duma Faithful! The only one who fought for us was General Ezekiel. Doesn’t matter who he was or where he’s from—he’s a good and noble man.

speaker: Man
text: Keep walking, you dastards! You’ll find no welcome here! You killed General Ezekiel, you...you monsters! He only sided with those scum because they took his woman hostage! In truth, he fought this whole time to shield us from Jerome and his tyranny.

speaker: Young Man
text: I got no love for Zofia, but I s’pose I owe you a word’a thanks anyway. ...Eh? Why do I hate Zofia? ‘Cause I pour m’blood and sweat into workin’ this here barren land, is why! You Zofians have Mila’s blessin’ or bounty or whatever blasted thing it is. You eat yer fill without workin’ a day! Life’s just one big party for you lot... Makes me sick, it does. Pah!

speaker: Young Man
text: ...Hmph. What are you lot doin’ here? Emperor Rudolf’s a good man. A hero. Not that you lazy pigs over in Zofia’d know anything about it.

speaker: Old-Timer
text: Are you all headed to Rigel Castle? I see, I see... Perhaps that’s best for His Excellency as well. But the mountain ahead is cursed with a blight of fell beasts. Necrodragons spawn there without end, or so the travelers say. Even if you’ve the luck to elude them, eruptions often bury the path in stone.

speaker: Old-Timer
text: Hrmph... So you beat Jerome. A petty tyrant. Who cares for such deeds?! You’ll still never cross Mount Dragonsblight! Your proud little band will march right down a necrodragon’s gullet.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Ezekiel says he has no memory of his past. Tatiana found him washed up ashore one day, badly wounded. She was nursing him back to health, when... Well, you’ve seen his face. Wasn’t a fortnight before she was in love. Don’t suppose I can blame her.

speaker: Young Woman
text: I always loved Ezekiel, I did, though I never had the courage to tell him... Fie on you all! I hope you rot in the belly of a necrodragon!

speaker: Blacksmith
text: Have you ever seen a dracoshield before? They soften physical blows, mitigate magic, and can even heal you! It just so happens my family has forged these shields for generations. My grandfather even presented one to the emperor himself. You can’t make them without dragon scales, though. No sir! You need no less than four dragon scales to make a proper dracoshield. If you happen to find four and want to try the shield of shields, come see me. I’ll make you the finest dracoshield you ever did see!

speaker: Blacksmith
text: Great galloping gargoyles! You found enough dragon scales! Sounds like someone wants me to make a dracoshield right here and now. Well, bad news—super ultimate dracoshields don’t just HAPPEN. You can come pick yours up at a later date.

speaker: Blacksmith
text: ...Huh? You don’t want a dracoshield? What’s wrong with you?!

speaker: Blacksmith
text: Sorry, but it looks like you failed to scale. You haven’t got enough. I need four dragon scales. Come back when you’ve got ’em.

speaker: Blacksmith
text: Sorry, but your dracoshield isn’t ready yet. Don’t be pushy, now! Come back another day and we’ll see if I’ve finished it.

speaker: Blacksmith
text: A-HA! There you are! I’ve got your brand new dracoshield right here! Ready? ...Ta-daaah!

speaker: Blacksmith
text: If you manage to scrounge up four dragon scales, bring ’em here. I’ll make you the finest dracoshield you ever did see!

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Are you familiar with a delicacy called ambrosia? It’s valuable stuff. Some even go so far as to call it the food of the gods. Some say Sage’s Hamlet in Rigel is the only place it’s made. But I’ve studied the subject for years now, and I can say beyond a doubt... that I’ve discovered the secret recipe for ambrosia and can make it right now! ...Mmmm? How about that? Is your stomach growling yet? I’m just missing a few ingredients: yogurt, Duma moss, and an orange. Bring me those three things, and I will whip up some legendary ambrosia.

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Ah, you’ve brought what I need. Now watch as I cook up some food fit for the gods themselves!

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Really? Are you sure? This stuff is the food of the gods, I tell you! Well, it’s your choice, I suppose. Don’t come crying to me later.

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Alas, it seems you don’t have all of the ingredients yet. I need yogurt, Duma moss, and an orange. Got it?

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: I only need three ingredients: yogurt, Duma moss, and an orange. Bring me those three things, and I will whip up some legendary ambrosia.

speaker: Zeke
text: We meet again, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: General Ezekiel. Have you given any more consideration to what we spoke of before?

speaker: Zeke
text: ...... Now that I have turned my lance on Jerome, Rigel will not have me. But neither can I offer that lance to you. I still have no recolection of who I am or from whence I came.

speaker: Alm
text: You've lost your memory?

speaker: Zeke
text: I have. All I know is that I washed up on the shores of Rigel grievously wounded. I was thrown in prison and accused of being a spy or worse. But Emperor Rudolf saved me. He gave me a name and took me in. He raised me as a father would his own son. And yes, I may have betrayed him... But never would I help you do him harm.

speaker: Alm
text: I didn't know. I’m sorry. Forgive me for asking so much of you.

speaker: Zeke
text: You are not in the wrong. *gasp* Alm! By the gods!

speaker: Alm
text: Wh-what’s wrong?

speaker: Zeke
text: Where did you get that mark on your left hand?

speaker: Alm
text: What, this? I don’t know, actually. I've just always had it.

speaker: Zeke
text: Is that so? Some time ago, Emperor Rudolf gave me what I thought was odd advice. He said that if I met a man with a mark on his left hand, I was to follow him. "For that man is chosen," he said. "He shall save all of Rigel." "And with it, all of Valentia."

speaker: Alm
text: That's...very strange.

speaker: Zeke
text: I agree. But now that I have met you, I must heed my emperor’s words. I am yours to command, my lord.

speaker: Zeke
text: I see. I would do as my emperor commanded, but if you are not of the same mind...

speaker: Zeke
text: Allow me to join my strength with yours. The emperor wished for this.

speaker: Gray
text: What's wrong, Alm? You get some bad pottage in the mess tent again?

speaker: Alm
text: Hmm? Oh... I was just wondering what this mark on my left hand really means.

speaker: Gray
text: No surprise, what with Zeke's speech about saving Valentia and all. "He shall save all of Rigel. And with it, all of Valentia." Heh. No pressure there!

speaker: Alm
text: No kidding...

speaker: Gray
text: Wait, you don’t actually BELIEVE what he said, do you?

speaker: Alm
text: What? No. No, I don’t harbor any delusions of grandeur. But it's true that we're fighting to save Zofia, at the very least. So I got to wondering if that wasn’t part of helping all Valentia.

speaker: Gray
text: Huh. Yeah, I guess that makes sense... in a messed-up kind of way. Celica has one of those too, right? That mark?

speaker: Alm
text: She... Yes. She does.

speaker: Gray
text: So maybe you guys are destined to save the world together or...whatever. I mean, It has to be fate or something that the you two of you met, right?

speaker: Alm
text: Fate? I don't know about that, Gray. It's a coincidence for sure, but...

speaker: Gray
text: Kidding! I was kidding! ...Sheesh, man. You're really starting to worry me here. If you don't laugh it off, it makes me sound like a lunatic for saying it.

speaker: Alm
text: Heh. Sorry. You’re right. I’m not sure about the rest of it, but me and Celica meeting really could be fate. ...I'd like to believe it is, at any rate.

speaker: Clair
text: Heavens, what is that infernal noise?

speaker: Alm
text: It sounds like... Earthquake! Everyone, take cover!

speaker: Alm
text: I don't believe it... That last quake cleared out some of the rocks—the road’s passable again.

speaker: Clair
text: Goodness! What a stroke of serendipity. Come now, Alm. Let’s hurry across before the next tremor hits.

speaker: Alm
text: Right...

speaker: Clair
text: Hmm? Is something the matter?

speaker: Alm
text: It feels strange, is all. A little TOO convenient. It's almost like I can feel someone's intent behind it.

speaker: Clair
text: An intentional rockslide? Really, Alm, you worry too much. Now chop chop! One mustn't dawdle. I'll await you on the far side.

speaker: Alm
text: ...... I don't like this at all. I hope you’re all right, Celica...

speaker: Hestia
text: Why do you refuse Duma’s truth? It is incomprehensible...

speaker: Hestia
text: Why...? I’ve done...nothing wrong...

speaker: Magnus
text: Honor demands I allow you to pass no further!

speaker: Magnus
text: I am bested. You fight...well...

speaker: Alm
text: What a strange place this is: a secret shrine, closed off and hidden away from the eyes of man. What a strange place this is: a secret shrine, closed off and hidden away from the eyes of man. Why was it made? And to what end?

speaker: Clive
text: This fortress is the last thing standing between us and Rigel Castle. Good news for us, but to them, it’s their last line of defense. And men always fight hardest when their backs are to the wall. Let’s take every precaution we can.

speaker: Alm
text: Right. We only get one chance. We’ll make it count.

speaker: Slayde
text: Bwa ha ha ha ha! Marvelous! Welcome, ladies and gentlemen of the Deliverance!

speaker: Alm
text: Slayde?!

speaker: Slayde
text: Indeed! And I am dearly glad to see you again, boy. You really are full of surprises. To think a mere farmboy like you would become leader of the Deliverance. Or that you would now stand poised to claim the Rigelian Empire as well! It’s the stuff of legends, this is. Simply astonishing!

speaker: Alm
text: Why are you here? Last I checked, you served Desaix.

speaker: Slayde
text: True...but that was in a former life, when I was still a knight of Zofia.

speaker: Alm
text: What?

speaker: Slayde
text: You lot ran me out of the castle thanks to that clod Desaix’s incompetence. So...I defected to Rigel! Turncoat or no, they paid good coin for a noble’s intelligence on the enemy. They were SO grateful, in fact, they appointed me to captain this fortress!

speaker: Clive
text: You lack even a modicum of shame, Slayde! How dare you call yourself a noble after trading away your pride!

speaker: Slayde
text: Pride? Ha! Pride has never filled a man’s belly or warmed him in the snow. And while we’re speaking, Clive, let me tell you this: I’ve always despised you. You and your pathetic platitudes! Pride this... Honor that... Only a naif believes that righteousness will keep a man drawing breath!

speaker: Clive
text: Which of us is truly naive, Slayde? You’re focused on naught but survival, yet...survival to what end? With no core belief to steel your spine, you turn tail at every shadow. Men broken by life’s unfairness who cast all principle aside will never triumph. You, Slayde, will never know victory. We will NOT lose to the likes of you.

speaker: Alm
text: Clive...

speaker: Slayde
text: Nrgh... Silence... SILENCE! This is merely the desperate barking of a cur faced down by a lion! Well? Don’t stand there! Attack! Paint the halls red with Zofian blood! Silence their lies, even if it means cutting the tongues from their mouths!

speaker: Slayde
text: Impudent whelps... You’ll regret this!

speaker: Slayde
text: Nrgh! Damn you... DAMN YOUUU!

speaker: Mueller
text: I cannot allow you any closer to His Excellency the emperor. Prepare yourself!

speaker: Mueller
text: Your Excellency... Forgive me...

speaker: Rudolf
text: ...Then the fortress has fallen.

speaker: Massena
text: It has, Your Excellency. I fear it’s a matter of minutes until the Deliverance reaches the castle doors.

speaker: Rudolf
text: Very well. We shall greet them with a sea of blades. I leave the rest to you, Massena.

speaker: Massena
text: As your will commands, Your Excellency.

speaker: Rudolf
text: Now go.

speaker: Berkut
text: Your Excellency, wait!

speaker: Rudolf
text: Berkut.

speaker: Berkut
text: Sire, why have you not given me leave to join the front lines? I know I failed you at the border, but all the more reason I beg for this chance!

speaker: Rudolf
text: A merciful leader may grant a second chance. Only a fool allows a third.

speaker: Berkut
text: Your Excellency!

speaker: Rudolf
text: My army has no place for the weak. You’ll remain here and watch in quiet.

speaker: Berkut
text: No... Please, have mercy, sire! YOUR EXCELLENCY! UNCLE!!!

speaker: Rudolf
text: Brave warriors of Rigel. You have fought with courage and skill at my side these long years. But the hour of reckoning is upon us. Our empire’s light is guttering. Now heed my words well! If I should fall, my final order is that you lay down your arms and surrender. I hear the young Zofian general is a man of mercy. If you have any love and loyalty for me, you’ll not waste your lives this day.

speaker: Alm
text: That’s Emperor Rudolf... This is strange... I’m not sure what I’m feeling at the moment. He’s caused so much suffering, and I know I should hate him, but...I can’t. Instead he just feels... I don’t know. Familiar, somehow?

speaker: Gray
text: Alm! Snap out of it, will ya? This is no time for daydreaming. We’re at Rigel Castle’s doorstep, buddy. We need you focused. Now pull yourself together already! We didn’t ce this far to lose here!

speaker: Alm
text: A-ah, right. Sorry, Gray. All right, everyone. Let’s do this!

speaker: Rudolf
text: Come... Strike me!

speaker: Alm
text: What’s going on? Why won’t you attack? What are you planning, Rudolf?!

speaker: Rudolf
text: You’ve...done well... I’m proud of you...my son.

speaker: Alm
text: ...What?

speaker: Rudolf
text: I knew I was right to entrust you to my dearest friend.

speaker: Alm
text: Your friend... You mean...Mycen? What’s going on here? What are you saying?!

speaker: Rudolf
text: I’d thought you’d have realized by now. Your true name... Your true name is Albein Alm Rudolf. You are...my one and only son.

speaker: Alm
text: I... What? That can’t be true... You’re lying! Why should I believe a word you say?

speaker: Rudolf
text: Nnngh... Be still, Alm. I haven’t time left... to explain. But I beg you to grant me one... final favor.

speaker: Alm
text: You want a favor from ME?

speaker: Rudolf
text: Take the Divine Falchion that... sealed Mila's strength... Duma has become a thing of mindless evil. Use the blade... Destroy him... Please, my son... You must—

speaker: Alm
text: No, wait! Emperor Rudolf! Were you truly my father? Then I’ve just--- Oh, gods! What have I done?! Aah... AAAAAAAUGH!

speaker: Celica
text: Stop! Please, no more! Alm! How has it come to this?!

speaker: Jedah
text: The boy will come to slay Lord Duma erelong. A fool's erand, I fear, without Falchion.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm is coming here? Please, you mustn't hurt him! My soul alone is all you need, yes?

speaker: Jedah
text: Oh? Then you will offer up your soul to Lord Duma willingly?

speaker: Celica
text: I will. If it saves Alm, I will surrender my soul gladly.

speaker: Jedah
text: (laughs) As you wish, Your Highness. Now, come with me.

speaker: Soldier
text: L-long live His Excellency Rudolf II!

speaker: Archer
text: ...Welcome home, Prince Albein!

speaker: Cavalier
text: I was present when Emperor Rudolf marched on the Temple of Mila. I know the blade he used to seal her power away—the Divine Falchion— had long been housed in the treasure vaults beneath Duma Tower. Though I fear I do not know what became of it after...

speaker: Massena
text: Welcome home, Prince Albein. I am Massena, captain of Emperor Rudolf’s imperial guard. His Excellency told me everything before facing you in battle. Afterward, I gathered the remnants of his forces and awaited your arrival.

speaker: Alm
text: He told you...everything? Are you telling me he knew he was going to lose? That he expected to die by his own son’s hand?

speaker: Massena
text: ...I am afraid I cannot speak to His Excellency’s intentions. I humbly ask that you visit the throne and listen to what Sir Mycen has to say.

speaker: Alm
text: Mycen is here?!

speaker: Massena
text: Please, my prince. Visit the throne and hear what Sir Mycen has to say.

speaker: Mycen
text: So you’ve come, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Grandfather... What the hell is going on?! What are you doing here?! Rudolf said I was his son, and now all these people are calling me a prince!

speaker: Mycen
text: It’s only natural that you’re feeling confused. But there is no denying fact—you are the only son of Emperor Rudolf. Scion of the Rigelian imperial bloodline, and true heir to Rigel’s throne.

speaker: Alm
text: ...How could you? You knew all this time, and yet you kept it from me...! You KNEW, and you still sent me off to kill my own FATHER!

speaker: Mycen
text: Please remain calm, Alm. *sigh* Let me explain. ...Best I start at the very beginning. As you well know, Valentia has always been divided north from south— split between the two gods, Mila and Duma. But their involvement with mankind eventually grew too deep. When madness takes a god, man is lost. And where gods meet ruin, men die too. That is the plight Valentia now faces.

speaker: Alm
text: You’re saying the gods are...dying?

speaker: Mycen
text: I fear so. Rudolf was among the first to understand the signs. He saw Duma’s growing madness and knew it for a harbinger of ruin. But then you were born, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: What does that have to do with any of this?

speaker: Mycen
text: You bore the Brand—sign of the hero who would rise to save Valentia. Hearing that prophecy, Rudolf knew you must be kept hidden from the Faithful. He concealed the news of your birth, and entrusted you to me in Zofia. I will never forget the pain on his face when he placed you in my arms...

speaker: Mycen
text: That day marked a change in him. He donned the mantle of one who would destroy the old world order— one who’d free men to live by their own power, even if they hated him for it. He knew such heresy would bring forth those who wished for his death. So for that death to come at the hand of his beloved son was...a mercy. He told me himself that he could imagine no more peaceful end.

speaker: Alm
text: And what of my peace?

speaker: Mycen
text: This is not the time for mourning or self-pity, boy. Rudolf’s purpose now falls to you. The true foe you must defeat is Duma. As well as the zealots tainted by his madness who seek control of Valentia: Jedah, and his Duma Faithful. If you do not hurry, Celica’s life will also be in peril.

speaker: Alm
text: Oh, gods! Celica! She set out in search of Duma in order to save Mila.

speaker: Mycen
text: A passage beneath this castle leads to the Temple of Duma. Go, Alm. Go and finish this. Return the mad god Duma to the darkness... from whence he came.

speaker: Celica
text: Ah... Quiet, everyone!

speaker: Garth
text: Heh heh...

speaker: Celica
text: That must be Garth and his men. Probably best to avoid them. Let’s go around that way.

speaker: Mae
text: But Celica, look!

speaker: Celica
text: Huh?

speaker: Palla
text: Rgh... More of Grieth’s thugs, I take it?

speaker: Garth
text: Well, give the little girl a prize! Yer pretty smart for a foreign lass. In that case, might be ye also know how much coin a pair like you could fetch!

speaker: Palla
text: Catria! Keep your wits about you and do not leave my side!

speaker: Celica
text: It’s those sisters!

speaker: Mae
text: Aw, cripes, Celica. What do we do?!

speaker: Celica
text: Well, we sure can’t leave them to this rabble. Let’s go, everyone!

speaker: Garth
text: Muh? Who’re you? Bah, not like it matters. Yer just more merchandise now!

speaker: Garth
text: H-how...? I’ve bought’n sold tougher’n this... Uuurrrkk...

speaker: Celica
text: Thank the Mother we managed to keep those sisters safe... Come now. We’ll gain nothing by lingering.

speaker: Palla
text: Wait! We didn’t get to properly— *sigh* And they’re gone...

speaker: Woman
text: The path to Zofia Castle was blocked during that big earthquake that hit. Sorry to rain on your thatch, but there’s nothing for it...

speaker: Palla
text: Oh, good! I was hoping we’d find you. You really saved us back on the coast. We’ve managed to dig up some additional information since then. Turns out our sister Est is being held by a thief named Grieth. Your strength is beyond reproach. That much is certain... If you’re headed to Grieth’s citadel, perhaps you’d let us join you?

speaker: Palla
text: I hear you’re headed to Grieth’s citadel as well. Would you mind if we traveled together?

speaker: Palla
text: I see... A shame. Well, if your mind changes, please do let me know.

speaker: Palla
text: Ah, hello. Did you need something? Perhaps you changed your mind about traveling together?

speaker: Catria
text: Ah, there you are. I was hoping I might see you again and get a chance to thank you properly. You saved us on the Zofian coast, and we are greatly in your debt. Are you perchance headed to Grieth’s Citadel? It appears my sister Est is being held there. If such are your intentions, perhaps we could travel together.

speaker: Catria
text: I see my sister is traveling with you. That’s wonderful. I trust it’s all right if I accompany you as well?

speaker: Catria
text: I see. Well, I’ll not doubt your judgment nor your reasons.

speaker: Catria
text: Yes? Did you need assistance? Or perhaps you’ve decided to take me with you?

speaker: Lord Fugue
text: I’m the head of the Fugue family. Surely you’re familiar with the name? Recently, a thief stole into our home and took an heirloom—a shield. It bears the family crest, and has been handed down for generations. It’s irreplaceable, and if not retrieved, it will be a black mark on our honor. The burglar in question is in Grieth’s employ. I’m certain the Fugue Shield is languishing in his vault about now. The cur will likely sell it to a foreign, buyer, after which it will be lost forever. You’ve the look of warriors about you. Impressive, to a man! Might I enlist your help in retrieving the Fugue Shield from Grieth? You’ll be well rewarded, of course. Fugues are known for our generosity.

speaker: Lord Fugue
text: Our family shield! Oh, this is a sweet sight indeed. In truth, I’d nearly given up hope of seeing it again. My sincerest thanks. Please, take your promised reward.

speaker: Lord Fugue
text: With both shield and honor restored I must hurry home to the family estate.

speaker: Lord Fugue
text: Is this just a jape to you? Oh, how you twist the blade!

speaker: Lord Fugue
text: By the gods! This shield bears the mark of our sworn enemies, the Rion clan! Pah! The very sight of it disgusts me! Take it away!

speaker: Royal Chef
text: Pardon me, but I serve as chef to one of the noble houses. Or I did, until a tiny mistake provoked the ire of my employer. Now he says that if I don’t prepare the world’s finest fish, he’ll have me killed! A man mistakes salt for sugar ONCE, and now must pay with his life? Cruel! As you might expect from such a man, my employer’s tastes are quite fine. A run-of-the-mill fish won’t get me off the hook. ...Er, pardon the pun. I need to catch a legend. I need...dagon. But that’s not something you find in a fishmonger’s stall down at the market. Please aid me! My life is on the line! ...Er, pardon the pun. If there’s any way you can find a dagon fillet, let me know at once!

speaker: Royal Chef
text: Word is, there’s a master angler here in Zofia Harbor. But he set out to sea a while ago and has yet to return. The timing lines up with a bad storm, so I fear he may have capsized. I’m told he usually fished the waters around the Seabound Shrine.

speaker: Royal Chef
text: Word is, there’s a master angler here in Zofia Harbor. If anyone could reel in a dagon fillet, it would be him. If he’s not out at sea fishing, you’ll likely find him at the tavern.

speaker: Royal Chef
text: Ah. Yes. Well, I suppose you’ve your own business to worry about.

speaker: Royal Chef
text: Any chance you’ve found a dagon fillet?

speaker: Royal Chef
text: The color... The glow... Dagon for true! You’ve actually found it! And such a fine cut! The perfect dappling of fat! Exquisite! Surely this will satisfy even my temperamental employer. Thank you. I’m afraid this is all I have to give you in return, but I insist you take it.

speaker: Royal Chef
text: Please, I’m about to be gutted! ...And that is NOT a pun!

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: Oy, it’s you! From the Seabound Shrine! I owes you a debt, I do! If ya need anything, just go on and ask. ...... Eh? A dagon fillet? Mmmm... Dagons are fearsome beasties—closer kin to dragons than fish. Yet for its terrible look, the meat’s said to be sweet as nectar. Trouble is, their vision’s frightful good. They see yer line and steer clear. You need a line that’s strong as steel, but clear as glass. Track me down somethin’ like that, and I’ll happily dip m’pole for ya! Come find me again if ya find a line that’ll snag a dagon.

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: Hoo! Never thought I’d see something’ like this in all m’days! This just might make for a line that even a dagon wouldn’t see coming! I’ll put out to sea straightaway and see if the fishing gods are kind. Come find me in a couple of days. And pray for fair weather! Eh heh heh!

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: Are you waitin’ for me t’beg?

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: I needs strong, clear material for a line. Bring me that, and I just might be able to hook ya a dagon. Eh heh heh!

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: Well, look who it be... Howzabout ya feast yer eyes on THIS?! Landed me a dagon, I did! And all thanks t’yer magic line. As promised, here’s yer cut! Enjoy that, now! Eh heh heh heh!

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: Guess what? I went and landed me another dagon! Eh heh heh heh! I’m in a sharin’ mood, so why not take a cut for yerself?

speaker: Boey
text: Oh, great... Another graveyard filled with even MORE Terrors...

speaker: Mae
text: Oh, grow a spine already! So what if those guys sprout up like weeds? It’s perfect target practice! After this little warm-up, we can storm the Temple of Mila with spells blazin’!

speaker: Boey
text: Why would we want to storm the temple...?

speaker: Man
text: That Grieth is a real piece of work. He gives the orders to every scoundrel and sneak-thief in Zofia. He’s attacked this village time and again, and taken all the young folk. There’s not a man who would stand up to him, even when the king drew breath.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Have you been to the Dragon Shrine, north of the village? There’s a well there whose waters are rumored to revive the dead. But alas, fearsome necrodragons stand watch there, allowing none to pass.

speaker: Old Timer
text: To reach the Temple of Mila, cross the valley approach and continue north. The temple’s more than just a place of worship for the goddess, you know— it also defends the sluice gate at the kingdom’s border. However, the gate opens only to members of the Zofian royal family. With His Highness Lima IV gone, the sluice may lie closed forever...

speaker: Young Man
text: Is it true the Deliverance has retaken Zofia Castle? I worry if so. Oh, everyone talks of chasing out Desaix and the Rigelian Empire... but soon as they have to decide the next king, you know war will come again.

speaker: Atlas
text: I was off fighting on the frontier until a short while ago. Came home to find my village in ruins and my brothers taken by Grieth. I want to tear that thief’s head clean off his body! ...But I can’t do it alone. Are you lot going to Grieth’s stronghold? If so, let me come and have my revenge.

speaker: Atlas
text: Ah. I see. Well, you have your reasons, I’m sure. Apologies for the sudden request. I’ll try my luck alone, if that’s what it takes.

speaker: Atlas
text: Hm? Changed your mind, did you?

speaker: Fish-Crazy Man
text: Oy! You! Ever had dried shieldfish? It’s simply GRAND, so it is! Odd-lookin’ thing, shieldfish. Big’n flat, and covered in a hard shell. Looks a bit like a shield—that’s why they named it as they did, I reckon. But if ya dry ’em in the sun, they taste like nothin’ else. I get cravings I do. Terrible cravings... But I can’t find ’em to save m’life! I’d kill for a bite’a shieldfish! ...Well, not literally, but you get my meanin’.

speaker: Fish-Crazy Man
text: SHIELDFISH! DELICIOUS SHIELDFISH! HOW I YEARNED FOR YOUR TOUCH! Er, I mean...uh...here. Take this. You earned it!

speaker: Fish-Crazy Man
text: Can’t blame you. I wouldn’t share mine, either! Heh heh heh.

speaker: Fish-Crazy Man
text: You got no shieldfish! Ain’t very nice getting my hopes up like that.

speaker: Fish-Crazy Man
text: Sure could go for some dried shieldfish right about now...

speaker: Tired Lady
text: Please, can you help me find my son?

speaker: Tired Lady
text: After losing my husband to the plague that hit our village, I fell apart. My son felt he had to help me. I tried to stop him, but it was no use. He left for the Dragon Shrine in order to find the Well of Revival. They said it can give life to the dead, so he seeks to return my husband. Though I fear I’m more like to lose a son than reclaim a husband. That shrine is a horror of a place. I won’t let my son die there. Please find him and bring him back to me! I beg of you!

speaker: Tired Lady
text: Did you find my son?

speaker: Tired Lady
text: This...this is my son’s journal! ...Oh. Oh no. You sweet, stupid boy... How many must you take, Mila? How many more will satisfy you?!

speaker: Tired Lady
text: Pardon me. The other day, you helped me find my...my late son. At the time, I was too overcome to thank you. Please forgive my rudeness. I’m still working through my grief. It will take time, I’m sure. But I wouldn’t even be able to do that if I didn’t know his fate for certain. I know I’m late in this, but please let me thank you for finding my son.

speaker: Tired Lady
text: ...Eh? It’s too much? Oh, hardly! I sold my house and land, you see. This village is full of memories. It...hurts too much to be here. I aim to wander the world and take a long, hard look at my life. Perhaps we’ll meet again somewhere. Until then, stay safe.

speaker: Lumberjack
text: What a mess... I’ve been a woodcutter in this village since I was old enough to hold an axe. But when Grieth’s men swept through, they stole it! ...My axe, I mean. I can’t do a lick of work without it, and I’ve got a wife and kids to feed. And don’t tell me to go buy a new axe, because I can’t afford it! No axe, no money. No money, no axe. You get my problem here?

speaker: Lumberjack
text: Wait a sec—you’re just GIVING me this? Sweet Duma! This is gonna turn my whole life around! You’ve got yourself a new friend, pal. Take this with my thanks!

speaker: Lumberjack
text: Yeah, I suppose that’s not the kind of thing you just have lying around.

speaker: Lumberjack
text: I’m not much of a woodcutter without an axe—and I’m broke, to boot! I need to get my hands on a new axe, and soon...

speaker: Lumberjack
