text: Oh, hey! It’s my best friend! Here, have a look at this, pal. I tried my hand at carving a likeness of Duma with the axe you brought me. Figured maybe his blessing would help me chop through the forest, yeah? And it WORKED! When I’m holding it, I can feel strength surging through my chopping arm! The forest best watch out now that I’ve got this Duma carving! Gya hah hah!

speaker: Lumberjack
text: Oh hey. Look who it is! Terrors from the cemetery attacked the village a while back. Except they didn’t attack the village so much as come straight to my door. They took the Duma carving I made, turned around, and beat feet. I never should have made it. Duma must be angry I took liberties with his image! I’m terrified his punishment is only just beginning... O Duma! Forgive me!

speaker: Lumberjack
text: Hey, that’s the Duma carving I made! Get that awful thing away! I never want to see it again in my life!

speaker: Wolff
text: You don’t look half as scared as you ought. Don’t you value your lives? It’s time you had the fear of death put back into you!

speaker: Wolff
text: No... I’ll not surrender... Not like...this...

speaker: Pirate
text: Say, boss? I got some...uh...news. Kinda bad, like.

speaker: Grieth
text: ...WELL?! Don’t just stand there, idiot! Spit it out!

speaker: Pirate
text: The desert stronghold’s been...taken.

speaker: Grieth
text: WHAAAAT?! Was it Deliverance? It was, wasn’t it? Those lousy, no-good, dung-eatin’—

speaker: Pirate
text: Actually, it was a girl and her friends. Some kinda priestess or somethin’? Kind of an odd mix if ya ask me. A mercenary, couple’a kid mages—

speaker: Grieth
text: KIDS?! You’re tellin’ me that Wolff lost to a girl and some CHILDREN?! Who is she? I need information. All of it. GIMME THE GOODS!

speaker: Pirate
text: I got nothin’, boss, I’m sorry. All I know is what I told ya. Kid’s a priestess, yeah? ...Oh, and she had a mark on her right hand. Er, so whatta we do now, boss? Our men are sayin’ she’s coming here next! She’s gonna come here and kill—

speaker: Grieth
text: Shut up for a second. Did you say she has a mark on her right hand?

speaker: Pirate
text: Y-yeah, boss. That’s right.

speaker: Grieth
text: Well, I’ll be dipped in hog fat... That’s the lass Desaix was searchin’ for! That mark is proof a member of the Zofian royal family is still alive! And you say she’s headed here now? ...Heh. Haw! BWAAAAA ha ha ha ha! Looks like lady luck finally decided to let me take her to the barn dance! Working with Desaix was good business for a while, but he’s finished now. But if I serve that girl up to Rigel on a silver platter... then even if they take over all of Zofia, we’ll still be sittin’ pretty. Deen! Sonya!

speaker: Deen
text: You called?

speaker: Sonya
text: Did you need something?

speaker: Grieth
text: We’re expectin’ guests. Some little girl and her merry band of friends. Deen, set up in the northern desert. Sonya, you take the south. I want the girl alive. As for the rest... Well, have some fun. You earned it. ...YA GOT IT?!

speaker: Sonya
text: You don’t need to shout, sir. There’s nothing wrong with my hearing. If there’s nothing else, I’ll be going.

speaker: Deen
text: Understood. I’m off as well.

speaker: Grieth
text: Bah! Impudent louts. Still, I s’pose they get the job done. And once they do, I’ll have a Zofian princess in my collection. Heh heh... Ha ha ha! BWAAAA HA HA HA HA HA!

speaker: Jesse
text: Whew! You really saved the day. Thanks a million. Name’s Jesse, by the by. I’m just your average garden-variety merc. So I spotted this girl at the port of Zofia. Real cute, ya know? Anyway, then I hear she’s about to get sold off as a slave! You believe that? Well, I don’t let ladies get sold into slavery on my watch! No sir! So I up and chased after her, and wound up getting caught. Turns out trying to take on a group of slavers single-handed is a terrible idea. Anyway, that’s my story—what’s yours? You’re all traveling together, yeah? Looks like a real fun group. Don’t suppose you got room for one more?

speaker: Jesse
text: Oh yeah? Well, that’s a shame. I won’t take it personal, though. Come on back if you change your mind.

speaker: Jesse
text: Hm? What’s up? Decide you want to deal me in on the fun after all?

speaker: Young Traveler
text: I’m sorry to bother you, but it seems my father has gone missing. He’s a pious man who was going on a pilgrimage to the Temple of Mila. But that was some years ago, and I’ve heard nothing from him since. When last I saw him, he was wearing his lucky red tricorn hat. Sadly, that’s the only clue I have to go on. I managed to follow his trail this far, but I fear it’s grown quite cold. He could’ve been attacked by bandits or done in by Terrors or...worse. But I’d rather know for sure than lie awake at night with such grim thoughts. Well, there’s nothing for it but to return home to my mother. Er, but if you come across a man in a red tricorn hat, tell him to hurry home. Take care.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Grieth didn’t become king of thieves by being a fool. He’s a shrewd one. He’s been sending Desaix bribes a’plenty to escape justice for his deeds. And his men are no better. The pirate Barth was one such, in fact. I hear there are still captives rotting away in his dungeons. Some have been there for years, poor souls... If there’s any way you can help them...

speaker: Man
text: Deen and Sonya are feared for their strength, even among Grieth’s men. Deen, a master of the sword, is a flinty loner of a man. And Sonya is a deadly mage. Beautiful, though, if the rumors are true. They also say she was Rigelian, originally...

speaker: Celica
text: Jesse, you’re familiar with this area, are you not? We’re headed to Grieth’s Citadel, and the way seems perilous. Could we ask you to guide us there?

speaker: Jesse
text: Grieth’s Citadel?! Er, look. You seem smart and capable and all, but...I wouldn’t recommend it. His payroll’s a veritable who’s who of Zofia’s nastiest thugs. And no matter how tough you are, I don’t like those odds.

speaker: Celica
text: But there must be some way.

speaker: Jesse
text: Hrrrrmm... Maybe ask the Deliverance? They’re nuts. They might be up for it. They chased off Desaix, didn’t they? ...Which is actually pretty impressive.

speaker: Celica
text: The Deliverance force marches west to the border to fight the Rigelian army.

speaker: Jesse
text: Do they now? Well, that’s optimistic. I guess that means you’re out of luck.

speaker: Celica
text: *sigh*

speaker: Jesse
text: Aw, c’mon. Don’t give me that look! Damsel-in-distress types slay me. Just break my heart. I mean, not that you’re a damsel or anything, but... Hmm... Well, I suppose there is one thing you might try...

speaker: Celica
text: And what’s that?

speaker: Jesse
text: Deen and Sonya. Two of Grieth’s best. They’re a tough lot, but it’s not loyalty that keeps them in Grieth’s service. I don’t know the specifics, but it’s clear they’ve their own ambitions. They guard his citadel from the north and south ends of the desert. Break through one, and you’ll have a clear path to move on Grieth. Whichever you fight, the other won’t go out of their way to chase you down. ...Er, probably.

speaker: Boey
text: Hey, hold on...

speaker: Jesse
text: Like I said, going up against Grieth’s entire force at once is suicide. But knock out Deen or Sonya and focus on Grieth and his men at the citadel? Well then, you might just have yourself a chance.

speaker: Boey
text: And if you’re wrong and they chase us down while swearing bloody revenge?

speaker: Jesse
text: Yowza. Yeah, in that case, I’m guessing you’re probably dead.

speaker: Boey
text: The fact you’ve worked as a mercenary this long staggers the imagination.

speaker: Jesse
text: Aw shucks, you little flatterer! That’s sweet of you to say. Look, your ultimate goal is getting to the Temple of Mila, right? So this thing with Grieth is just a bit of...what? Community service? That’s admirable, but think long and hard before you make the trip.

speaker: Deen
text: Nothing personal, but I have to kill you. I promise to make it fast.

speaker: Deen
text: Rgh... I’ve too much left...undone...

speaker: Sonya
text: Naughty children. You ought never have made an enemy of Grieth. Still, this is mere business for my part. No hard feelings, I pray.

speaker: Sonya
text: It seems...today is the day... my star...goes out...

speaker: Pirate
text: Grieth! Boss! That girl and her band of idiots are here!

speaker: Grieth
text: Grargh! What the hell are the rest of the men DOING?! I need ’em here to FIGHT!

speaker: Pirate
text: Um, it doesn’t look like they’re moving, boss.

speaker: Grieth
text: WHAT?! ...Dammit! So I’ve been betrayed, have I? Gah! Fine. Just...fine! I’ll just go out there and crush this stupid girl ALL BY MYSELF!

speaker: Grieth
text: Well, lookie here—it’s Zofia’s crown princess! Ain’t you just FANCY!

speaker: Celica
text: How... Who told you that?

speaker: Grieth
text: Well, lemme think a second... Who could it have been? You know what? It don’t matter. Fact is, I owe you my thanks. While you royals were lounging about ignoring your own kingdom, I was becoming a VERY RICH MAN! You people turned Zofia into a place where only the strong survive. Hell, now it’s the spitting image of Rigel itself, doncha think?

speaker: Celica
text: You may think yourself something fine... but your days as a predator are done.

speaker: Grieth
text: Oh, Yer Highness... My kingdom may fall today... but I’m gonna DRAG YOU ALL TO HELL WITH ME!

speaker: Grieth
text: You didn’t...win nothin’... There’s gonna be...another me... There’s always...another...me...

speaker: Celica
text: Atlas! Did you manage to find your brothers?

speaker: Atlas
text: Yeah, they’re safe. Everyone’s safe. You’re our savior, m’lady! From this point on, I am yours to command. You just say the word. Now, want me to bust the skulls of any of Grieth’s men we might’a missed?

speaker: Celica
text: N-no, that’s... Thank you, Atlas, but I don’t think that’ll be necessary. Why don’t you go spend some time with your family instead?

speaker: Atlas
text: You sure? ...Well, all right. I’ll do whatever you think’s best.

speaker: Irma
text: I owe you thanks beyond measure for saving me. My name is Irma, and I serve at the Temple of Mila. ...Or did, I suppose. In truth, this place has been my only home for many a long year. I fear greatly what may have transpired at the temple...

speaker: Celica
text: So you’re an attendant to Mila? Interesting... We’re actually making our way to the temple right now.

speaker: Irma
text: Is that so? Then might I ask—  By the Mother! Are you...? No, you couldn’t be...

speaker: Celica
text: Er, I’m sorry?

speaker: Irma
text: Ah... F-forgive me. It’s just that you bear a striking resemblance to Lady Liprica.

speaker: Celica
text: Liprica? That’s...my mother’s name.

speaker: Irma
text: Then it’s true! You’re her! You’re Princess Anthiese! Mila be praised, you’re alive!

speaker: Celica
text: Are you saying you know my mother?! Please, you...you must tell me anything you can about her. I never had a chance to know her, you see...

speaker: Irma
text: It would be an honor, Your Highness. Where shall I begin...?

speaker: Irma
text: Like myself, Lady Liprica was a sister in the service of Mother Mila. But all that ended once King Lima’s royal procession arrived at the temple. Lady Liprica’s beauty caught his eye, and she was stolen away in the night. He took her to his castle and forced her to join his seraglio of countless brides. Despite the luxury, I expect life in the castle proved most difficult for her. She soon took ill, and left this world shortly after bearing Your Highness.

speaker: Celica
text: Mother...

speaker: Irma
text: I am so very sorry, Princess Anthiese. But I would implore you to spare your tears. Lady Liprica thought only of your health and happiness until her final breath.  Lady Liprica also left something for you, Your Highness.

speaker: Celica
text: For me?

speaker: Irma
text: Aye, milady. It is a circlet that proves your royal standing. She asked that it be given to you once you were of age.

speaker: Celica
text: A circlet...? You can’t mean the royal crown?! Surely my mother had cause to hate the monarchy above all else?

speaker: Irma
text: I fear I know not what her intentions were, milady. Nor have I the means of asking now. But, Your Highness... I know a time will come when your mother’s heart grows clear to you.

speaker: Irma
text: The circlet is stored in the temple vault. I shall make my way there now. I must tell everyone that Her Highness Anthiese has returned to us! I will await your arrival at the temple. May Mila’s blessing be upon you always.

speaker: Est
text: Thanks so much for saving me! My name’s Est, by the way. I was kidnapped by pirates in Archanea and brought here. I’d really like to hurry home, but... Well, it wouldn’t be right to run off before thanking you for your help. I’d like to fight with you, if you’ll have me. What do you say?

speaker: Est
text: Wait, you’re sure? You don’t want me to help you? I see... Well, I’ll wait around here a while in case you change your mind. Just say the word if you need me.

speaker: Est
text: Yes? Did you change your mind about taking me with you?

speaker: Est
text: Palla! Catria!

speaker: Palla
text: Est! Oh, I’m so glad you’re safe! Do you have any idea how much worry you’ve caused us?

speaker: Est
text: I’m sorry, Palla, but I... I... I was so scaaared! Catriaaa!

speaker: Catria
text: Wha—? Hey! Stop this at once, Est! You’re not a child anymore.

speaker: Est
text: B-but... But I... Can’t I be the kid sister just this once? After everything I went through?

speaker: Catria
text: But it’s not just “this once.” That’s the problem. You’re never anything BUT the kid sister.

speaker: Est
text: That is totally not true!

speaker: Palla
text: Enough, you two. We’re reunited for five minutes, and already you’re at each others’ throats? Honestly...

speaker: Celica
text: Hee hee.

speaker: Palla
text: Oh, Celica! I apologize for the scene my sisters caused.

speaker: Celica
text: Don’t be silly—I’m just glad the three of you are all right.

speaker: Palla
text: We wouldn’t be if you hadn’t helped us. There’s no way Catria and I could have done this by ourselves. Thank you, Celica. Truly.

speaker: Deen
text: You Celica?

speaker: Celica
text: I am. And you are...?

speaker: Deen
text: Deen. I worked under Grieth. The northern desert was my watch.

speaker: Celica
text: Ah, so you’re Deen. We owe you thanks. Had you pursued us, we couldn’t have defeated Grieth. Your restraint was much appreciated.

speaker: Deen
text: Heh. Quite the gamble. Fortunately, it paid off. ...You’ve got stones, little one. I like leaders with stones. What say I throw in my lot with you?

speaker: Deen
text: Figures. Well, I won’t force you.

speaker: Deen
text: You here to ask for a hand?

speaker: Sonya
text: My goodness. You really are but a child.

speaker: Celica
text: I’m sorry, who are you?

speaker: Sonya
text: Sonya. I assume you’ve at least heard the name?

speaker: Celica
text: Ah, so that’s you. We owe you thanks. Had you pursued us, we couldn’t have defeated Grieth. Your restraint was much appreciated.

speaker: Sonya
text: I get the feeling you knew all along that’s how I would react. Quite the clever one, aren’t you? ...It’s a bit infuriating. Still, I’ll wager your friends are seldom bored. Maybe I’ll just have to join up and see. If there’s room for one more, that is? I’m certain you won’t regret it.

speaker: Sonya
text: Right. All full up. Well, don’t come running back to me if you regret it later.

speaker: Sonya
text: You came running back after all. I told you not to do that. Hmm... I wonder if this is really such a great idea.

speaker: Alessio
text: Ah, it’s you! Thank you again for your help with that coral fragment business. But alas, I fear I’m in deep once more, for another deal has fallen through. A sizeable one this time. Now I need to source a boatload of steel lances with all speed. With Desaix dead, my only connection on the the inside was Grieth. And I don’t have to tell you how THAT one ended. I wonder what sort of monstrous men were finally able to put Greith down? Even the Zofian Knights couldn’t touch that one in his prime! Well, whoever it was, they owe me some steel lances on the double. My client on this one is a nasty type, and my failure will be repaid in blood. I’ve scraped together as many as I can, but I’m still five short of the quota. If you have any spares lying around, I’d be happy to buy them from you. I’d even pay extra, since it’s my skin. How’s 50 silver marks apiece sound?

speaker: Alessio
text: My friend! Can I get you to open your heart and part with any steel lances? Ah, you’re a life saver. Literally! Take this, with my compliments.

speaker: Alessio
text: You’re killing me. Literally!

speaker: Alessio
text: I’m still short of steel lances, so if you come across any, I’ll buy them!

speaker: Alessio
text: Whew! That should be enough lances to save my poor hide. Thanks to you, it’s looking like I’ll keep my head AND turn a tidy profit. For now, though, I must rush these to my client. Take care!

speaker: Alessio
text: Ah, it’s you. So in a twist, my angry client doesn’t need steel lances anymore. However, he was still furious I didn’t get the order together in time. DANGEROUS furious, if you please. So I’m going into hiding for a bit.

speaker: Celica
text: At last, the valley approach. Cross this, and we’ll finally reach the Earth Mother’s temple. Take heart, everyone. We’re nearly there.

speaker: Blake
text: Aye, but are you?

speaker: Celica
text: Who— Oh, by the Mother! What are Rigelian forces doing all the way out here?

speaker: Blake
text: ray think on it for a moment. I’m sure the answer will come to you.

speaker: Celica
text: No. No, that can’t...

speaker: Blake
text: You’re a priestess, aye? Other of your kind have tried to cross this valley and seek Mila’s blessing... but nary a one of them have completed the journey in one piece. Ignorance is a pitiable thing, aye, so it is. Doubly so when it’s the very Mother who’s responsible for your suffering...

speaker: Celica
text: What is that supposed to mean?

speaker: Blake
text: Why waste time explaining when you’re about to be dead like all the rest?!

speaker: Blake
text: What are you waiting for? Soon you’ll all serve as scabbards for my shadow sword!

speaker: Blake
text: Damn... You’re stronger than you look... Shame you’re too late... Mila is...already...

speaker: Mae
text: Dangit, I hate it when they die right before they say something important! What do you think, Celica? What beans was he about to spill there?

speaker: Celica
text: I don’t know. But whatever it was, I don’t like it. We must hurry to the temple.

speaker: Palla
text: Where are you going? That’s not the way to Grieth’s citadel. If you insist on heading in that direction, I’ll excuse myself.

speaker: Catria
text: You’re not going to Grieth’s citadel? Then I’m afraid our paths part here. Farewell.

speaker: Atlas
text: Hey, that isn’t the way to Grieth! I don’t have time for detours. If you’re taking the long way, our deal’s off.

speaker: Celica
text: What a strange place... Clean, but in the sort of way that comes from being devoid of all life. Hostile to it. That sound in the distance... Waves against a shore? I remember as a child hearing it said that somewhere in Zofia a sea spans the gap between the living world and the dead.

speaker: Celica
text: That’s...the Rigelian Army! Has the temple already fallen to the Rigelians?

speaker: Boey
text: What have they done to the Mother? You don’t think...

speaker: Celica
text: We need to confirm her safety immediately. Everyone, infiltrate the temple as quickly as possible!

speaker: Mikhail
text: Heh heh heh...

speaker: Celica
text: Who are you?

speaker: Mikhail
text: I am Mikhail, cantor of the Duma Faithful. I have come to teach Duma’s greatness to the fools who cling to Mila’s lies. Now, rue your ignorance from inside the bellies of my gargoyles!

speaker: Celica
text: ...Take care, everyone. He’s a cantor—he’s likely to summon forth some manner of terrible beast. Stick close and watch each other’s backs above all else.

speaker: Mikhail
text: Hmph... Ignorant, slothful heathens. Serving as food for my beasts is an honor greater than you deserve!

speaker: Mikhail
text: Heh... Killing me changes not your fate... It changes...nothing... Heh heh heeeeeh...

speaker: Celica
text: We’ve won. ...Somehow.

speaker: Mae
text: Yeah, but look at the temple. It’s in shambles! I always thought it would be crazy beautiful, you know? I mean, Mila can’t ACTUALLY live in a place like this, right?

speaker: Celica
text: I don’t know. Let’s go see for ourselves. We must discover exactly what came to pass in this place.

speaker: Saber
text: ...There ain't no one here. Where's this Earth Mother of yours hiding, lass?

speaker: Celica
text: I don't understand... Why isn't she here? She's supposed to be here!

speaker: Irma
text: Princess Anthiese!

speaker: Celica
text: Irma! Tell me what happened.

speaker: Irma
text: I beg forgiveness, Your Highness. I had no idea the temple fell to the empire while I was prisoner. They took Mila...and Your Highness's circlet as well. It's unthinkable. They're no knights— only blasphemers and thieves!

speaker: Celica
text: The Rigelians hold Mila captive?! You're certain of this?

speaker: Irma
text: I am, Your Highness. Emperor Rudolf led the charge himself. Sealed her powers and took her away. To where, I fear I know not.

speaker: Celica
text: Rudolf himself...

speaker: Cleric 1
text: Quickly!

speaker: Cleric 2
text: Mother Mila! Intruders!

speaker: Cleric 2
text: Mother Mila, you must save us!

speaker: Cleric 1
text: Mother, please!

speaker: Mila
text: This is Zofian soil. The Rigelian Emperor would do well to state his intentions.

speaker: Mila
text: The Kingsfang...

speaker: Rudolf
text: The Mother may deduce my intentions... from this blade; you know what it signifies.

speaker: Mila
text: Indeed! [stands up from her chair] It means... you are in violation of the Accord!

speaker: Mila
text: Damn you, DUMA!!!!!!

speaker: Saber
text: Now, hold on just a tick. We get to the temple and everything's taken care of. That was the deal.

speaker: Boey
text: Unfortunately, none of us expected the Mother to have stepped out. Nothing like this has ever happened before.

speaker: Mae
text: Well, I guess now we know why the soil’s gone barren. It’s been cut off from Mila’s bounty.

speaker: Boey
text: ...... What do we do now, milady?

speaker: Celica
text: The only thing we can. We find the Mother and bring her back.

speaker: Boey
text: Uh, please take this as kindly as possible, milady, but...are you MAD?! How exactly do we "bring her back"? And from where?!

speaker: Celica
text: I don"t know. But if the Rigelian Army took her, she’ll be somewhere in the empire. And since we’ve already come to the border... Well, we might as well continue into Rigel.

speaker: Boey
text: Hold on just a moment. You're saying we INVADE Rigel? This isn't a motley band of pirates or thieves—it's an entire empire of them! We should all take a step back and consider our opti—

speaker: Celica
text: No amount of thinking will change the situation. Come, Boey. This isn't the first time we've faced hopeless odds. And when people told us to give up, did we run? We need to trust in our abilities. We've come this far for a reason. And that reason is restoring Mila to her rightful place. She's still the only one who can save the world from this...chaos.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Nay, she isn't.

speaker: Celica
text: Hmm?

speaker: Celica
text: Well? Go on. Please don't leave us in suspense.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Mila cannot save this world. But you can...Princess Anthiese.

speaker: Celica
text: Ah! How did you—

speaker: Masked Knight
text: I bear you a gift.

speaker: Irma
text: Lady Liprica's circlet!

speaker: Celica
text: What? How is it that you possess this?

speaker: Masked Knight
text: A question for another time. Are you prepared to accept it, Princess?

speaker: Celica
text: How do you mean?

speaker: Masked Knight
text: This is no mere memento of your mother. It is a crown—and accepting it is a kind of coronation. As Princess of Zofia, are you prepared to wear this and ascend the throne?

speaker: Celica
text: I... I'm afraid I know little of kingdoms or the scope of rule. But I have people I wish to protect. Both here and elsewhere. I wish for this by my will alone. For my own happiness. Is that resolve enough?

speaker: Masked Knight
text: It is indeed.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Princess Anthiese, this crown is now yours to bear.

speaker: Celica
text: I accept it willingly.

speaker: Mae
text: Wow, Celica... You look so beautiful!

speaker: Boey
text: It’s not Celica anymore, dummy. [To Celica] Isn’t that right, Princess Anthiese? Er, Your Highness?! ...Uh, ma'am?

speaker: Celica
text: Hee hee. Celica is just fine, you two. [To everyone] Though from this day on, I will no longer conceal my identity. I expect that will bring even more hardship than we've faced till now. But I hope I can still count on you all.

speaker: Saber
text: Yeah, all right. Guess I'll go along and swear fealty. It suits you, lass. Or should I say "Princess Anthiese." Anyway, our loyalty belongs to you, for now and always.

speaker: Celica
text: Thank you all. Truly.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Mila was taken by Jedah, priest of the Duma Faithful. They’re keeping her in Duma Tower, the seat of their foul cult.

speaker: Celica
text: Then that’s where we must go.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: If you’re headed into Rigel, seek a man called Halcyon in Sage's Hamlet. He is an able soul, and will mostlike assist you however he can.

speaker: Celica
text: I will seek him out. Thank you.

speaker: Boey
text: Surprisingly enough, I think I'm starting to get used to him.

speaker: Celica
text: He's not a bad sort—and he clearly cares about my well-being. I can't really ask for more in such times. And yet, he's not without his mystery... I get a strange sense of nostalgia when I'm near him, though I've no clue why.

speaker: Cleric
text: Thank you for your kind aid, masters. But I’m afraid there’s nothing left here now...

speaker: Cleric
text: The lands north of the temple are ruled by a man called Dolth. As an archcantor of the Duma Faithful, he summons necrodragons to his aid. It’s said all who trespass on his land become fodder for the arisen beasts...

speaker: Woman
text: Only one of Zofia’s royal bloodline can open the temple’s sluice gate. With His Highness Lima IV deceased, who is left to take his place? What’s more, I hear the western gate has been occupied by Rigelian forces. At this rate, Zofia is at risk of a flood the likes of which we’ve never seen.

speaker: Saint
text: You wish to know what happened here? Beg pardon, but I fear I cannot be the one to tell you. Irma, one of our longest-serving sisters, was taken prisoner. Even now, that black dog Grieth holds her in his citadel. Alas, there are things I can speak of only with her leave.

speaker: Saint
text: Rudolf used the Divine Falchion to seal Mila’s powers before taking her. A treasure given him by the wicked god Duma, no doubt. Aye, finding Mila may just be a matter of reaching Duma Tower. But Duma himself can only be slain by Falchion’s edge.

speaker: Priestess
text: Someone at the castle said that when Lady Liprica first held you in her arms, she swore she would never let you stand before Mila. What do you suppose she might have meant by that?

speaker: Old Timer
text: Eh? Who are you s’posed to be? ...Me? I’m the one what guards this here sluice gate. ...How’s that? You want me to open it? Bah! I won’t do nothin’ of the sort! The gate opens for Zofian royal blood, not some random whippersnappers! Go on—shout orders at an old man. Won’t change my mind none!

speaker: Old Timer
text: By the Mother! That circlet! Symbol of the Zofian throne, it is! Then you must be the missing Princess Anthiese! I thought I’d never have the pleasure, Your Highness. You must have come to inquire about this here sluice gate, eh? ...Well, of COURSE I can open it! All is as Your Highness desires.

speaker: Old Timer
text: Er, one small issue, Your Highness. Openin’ this here gate isn’t enough what to let water flow freely. You also have to open the western gate.

speaker: Celica
text: The western sluice gate, you say? That won’t be a problem.

speaker: Old Timer
text: Oh? Then you’ve news from the west?

speaker: Celica
text: Not exactly—but I can’t imagine Alm would let this situation continue. He’ll see the gate opened. I’m sure of it. ...Won’t you, Alm?

speaker: Berkut
text: It’s not possible... Alm is the emperor’s true son? Which makes him the rightful successor to the imperial throne. All this time... All the effort! What has it all been for?! ...No. It isn’t true. It can’t be. I refuse to believe it. Nothing but lies... Lies, lies, lies, lies, LIES! [notices an erupting flame] Is that...an altar? How did I get here? What’s happening?

speaker: Duma'S Voice
text: Heed me...

speaker: Berkut
text: Who are y—

speaker: Duma'S Voice
text: Heed me, you who thirst for power... Call to me. Accept me unto your soul.

speaker: Berkut
text: That voice... Duma? Is it really you?

speaker: Duma'S Voice
text: (sighs which displayed as "......")

speaker: Berkut
text: What?

speaker: Rinea
text: [offscreen] Lord Berkut!

speaker: Berkut
text: Rinea...

speaker: Rinea
text: I’ve been looking all over for you. This is the last place I would have expected to find you. You always hated the Faithful, after all.

speaker: Berkut
text: This is true... But then I had the throne snatched from under me by some magical heir. Plying the gods’ mercies is what men do in hopeless situations, is it not?

speaker: Rinea
text: I didn’t mean-- Forgive me. I shouldn’t have said anything.

speaker: Berkut
text: (panting desperately which displayed as "......")

speaker: Rinea
text: Please don’t despair so. Alm seems a kind and generous man. I’m certain he’ll treat you fair.

speaker: Berkut
text: And I’m to be content with that?!

speaker: Rinea
text: Ah!

speaker: Berkut
text: I wanted to BEAT him, Rinea! To dispatch him and claim the throne! I wanted to make you my empress, and hold all Valentia in our palms together! But what of those dreams now?! Even Rigel alone is now forever beyond my grasp. So I’m to live in this Alm’s shadow? Throw myself upon his mercy?! I would sooner an honorable death at the executioner’s blade!

speaker: Rinea
text: Berkut, you mustn’t say such things! I never-- The truth is, I never wanted to be empress.

speaker: Berkut
text: *gasp* ...What?

speaker: Rinea
text: To stand at your side is all I’ve ever desired. I don’t care if you’re the emperor or a swineherd so long as we-- Berkut?

speaker: Berkut
text: (in shock and sadness which displayed as "...") You too, Rinea?

speaker: Rinea
text: What?

speaker: Berkut
text: Were you laughing along with them? Rudolf, Massena, and all the rest? Watching me toil away while you knew I would never become emperor?! Was every kind word part of the act?! EVERY SMILE AN ACT OF PITY?!

speaker: Rinea
text: Berkut, you’re frightening me!

speaker: Berkut
text: Duma! O ancient god! I call out to you now! Grant me the power to set this land to ruin... for good and all! Take of me what price you will! I care not anymore!

speaker: Rinea
text: Eeek!

speaker: Fernand
text: Lord Berkut! Lord Berkut...?

speaker: Fernand
text: Wh-Who are you? What have you done to Lady Rinea?

speaker: Alm
text: Grandfather, what’s this door?

speaker: Mycen
text: It leads to the altar beneath Duma Tower. But know that it is a path not easily returned from. Prepare well before you enter.

speaker: Massena
text: A moment, Prince Albein? I ask that you show Lord Berkut compassion. He weighed heavy on Emperor Rudolf’s mind for many years. The emperor knew that keeping the boy in ignorance could only bring him pain. And yet, the prospect of your being discovered was too great a risk. Still, Berkut was his nephew, and the same age as the son he parted with. So I beg leniency of you, if only to respect Emperor Rudolf’s wishes.

speaker: Mycen
text: It leads to the altar beneath Duma Tower. But know that it is a path not easily returned from.

speaker: Saber
text: Blast it all! This place is crawling with Terrors! So much for “begone to wherever you will,” you damn useless priest!

speaker: Boey
text: And what is that supposed to mean? You’re not actually thinking of leaving Celica in there and running away?!

speaker: Saber
text: Did you hear me say anything about running away? Gimme some credit here, you little snot!

speaker: Conrad
text: Stop flapping your jaws and focus on the fight! I’d prefer not to die here, if it’s all the same to you two fools!

speaker: Alm
text: Whatever lies at the end of these corridors possesses a frightful aura— it sets the hairs on the back of my neck on end. The lord of this temple awaits... and here I am, terrified of him. But we must press on, if we are to put an end to this long war.

speaker: Alm
text: Hold up, everyone.

speaker: Clive
text: What is it, Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Someone’s coming. It’s...Fernand?!

speaker: Clive
text: What?

speaker: Fernand
text: That voice... Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: Fernand!

speaker: Clive
text: Gods, what’s happened to you?

speaker: Fernand
text: Spare me your pity. I’ve none to blame for this but myself... Such trivialities matter not at this point. But you... You made it here. Then you truly intend to slay Duma?

speaker: Clive
text: We do, for it was Emperor Rudolf’s dying request.

speaker: Fernand
text: I see... Then he must have known of Duma’s madness.

speaker: Clive
text: Duma is mad?

speaker: Fernand
text: Oh yes... Duma is a god no longer. Merely an incarnation of the lust for power... ...You there. Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah, that’s me.

speaker: Fernand
text: Listen well... You must beware of Berkut. He-- He’s no longer... ...Hngh!

speaker: Alm
text: Fernand!

speaker: Fernand
text: Please, Alm... Stop Duma. I know I’ve no right to...ask anything of you... But I beg it of you regardless... You’re the only one who can end this. Let no one else be tainted by his madness. Let this tragedy end.

speaker: Alm
text: I will. I swear I will lay Duma to rest.

speaker: Fernand
text: Then I leave it...to you... Ngh!

speaker: Clive
text: Fernand! Are you all right?

speaker: Fernand
text: Haah...ha ha... Strange, isn’t it...? Me, begging boons of you...

speaker: Clive
text: Not in the least. I still count myself among your friends.

speaker: Fernand
text: You always were...too nice for your own good. Always so...quick to pardon me... Along the way, I...I forgot how to ask for forgiveness...

speaker: Clive
text: Fernand, please—

speaker: Fernand
text: I knew. I always knew. None of my misfortunes were anyone else’s fault... Yet if the world is rotten, then who permitted it to be so? It’s me...and no one else. I took anger better aimed at myself and turned it on...the defenseless masses. I’ve failed my duty as a nobleman...

speaker: Clive
text: Enough, Fernand. You’ve suffered enough. You needn’t flog yourself any further.

speaker: Fernand
text: Good... I am...rather tired. Tired of despair... Tired of rage... But Clive...I’m glad I got to see you one last time. You were right... You chose the right king. You always were the...friend I was... proudest to— ......

speaker: Clive
text: ...Fernand? Fernand, no. Don’t do this. Look at me, Fernand! ...Fernand!

speaker: Clair
text: I simply won’t accept this, Fernand! I insist you wake up this instant! We’re all returning to Zofia together! ...Fernand? Fernand, say something!

speaker: Clive
text: He’s gone, Clair. ...He's gone.

speaker: Clair
text: No... Oh, Fernand... *sob*

speaker: Alm
text: Are you two going to be all right?

speaker: Clive
text: ...Yes. Grief will have its day, but it will not be this one. Right now, let us do what we must. Lead the way, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: All right. Fernand... I wish I could have fought beside you in the army you created. At least now your fight is over. ...Farewell.

speaker: Alm
text: That statue... Mila? Is that really the Earth Mother?

speaker: Lukas
text: But how could the goddess have been turned to stone? Only the sacred blade can seal a divine dragon’s power. ...Look there. The blade protruding from her forehead must be Falchion. But given that...

speaker: Celica
text: ...Alm?! Alm, is that you?

speaker: Alm
text: Celica! You’re safe. Oh. I’m so glad. ...Wait, are you alone? Where are the others?

speaker: Jedah
text: Ahh... So this is Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Who are you?

speaker: Jedah
text: My name is Jedah. I must thank you for disposing of Emperor Rudolf.

speaker: Alm
text: Well then, Jedah. Enjoy your last moments—I’m here to put an end to you AND Duma. I’ll see Zofia restored to Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm, you can’t. You mustn’t!

speaker: Alm
text: What? Why not?

speaker: Celica
text: If Duma is gone, Rigel’s lands will turn as barren as Zofia’s have. Even more people will starve.

speaker: Alm
text: But Celica, we can’t let—

speaker: Celica
text: And even if you wanted to stop Duma, you can’t. Nothing can stop him now. Mila has chosen to seal Falchion away with her.

speaker: Alm
text: What?! But then...all this fighting. What was it even for? F-Father!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm...

speaker: Jedah
text: (laughs maniacally) Alm and Anthiese, you stand at the pinnacle of your respective kingdoms. The hour is come for the world of man to return to the gods’ control! It is the dawn of an age of fear and chaos, cradled in Duma’s shadow!

speaker: Alm
text: We’ll never let that happen.

speaker: Jedah
text: Rejoice, Anthiese, for you have the honor of serving as its cornerstone!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica? What is he talking about?

speaker: Celica
text: I’m sorry, Alm... This is the only way. There’s no other choice...

speaker: Jedah
text: The girl will offer up her soul to quell the madness in Duma’s heart. She does so for the sake of Rigel and Zofia’s people both.

speaker: Alm
text: What? No! Celica, you can’t! Tell me he’s lying!

speaker: Celica
text: I’m sorry, Alm...

speaker: Jedah
text: Do not think me a monster. I shall grant you the time for a farewell. But be quick about it!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: I’m so sorry. Please forgive me.

speaker: Alm
text: This is crazy! You can’t do this! I’m going to get you out of here. Just hold on!

speaker: Celica
text: You don’t understand, Alm. I came here knowing what awaited me.

speaker: Alm
text: What?

speaker: Celica
text: Back on the island, I had a dream. A dream where something terrible happened to you. So I decided to petition Mila for the strength to protect you. Yet for all my travels, you’ve still faced terrible danger. And you were even forced to end your own father’s life. ...I’d seen it all. I knew it was coming, but I couldn’t change a thing. I failed to keep you safe, Alm!

speaker: Alm
text: That’s not... Celica, none of what’s happened is your fault. You’re not to blame for any of it!

speaker: Celica
text: But I won’t lose you... I won’t let any of you die! I don’t want you to fight Duma. I don’t want anyone to be hurt or killed. That’s my only desire in this life.

speaker: Alm
text: Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: And this is the only means I have of ensuring that comes to pass. So again, Alm, I’m sorry. I wish it could have been different. I always have. I wish I could have gone home to the village and lived there with you.

speaker: Alm
text: Celica, please wait! CELICA!

speaker: Clair
text: Alm? I don’t wish to be vulgar, but... Well, what is the proper course of action for us now? Emperor Rudolf bade us defeat Duma, but Princess Anthiese asked us not to. Have we come this far simply to reach an impasse and accept it?

speaker: Lukas
text: One thing seems abundantly clear as things now stand: The chances of Zofia’s recovery are nearly extinguished. With Mila in her current state, there is little hope of change.

speaker: Tobin
text: No... But Celica is going to take care of Mila AND Duma for us, right?

speaker: Gray
text: Are you serious, Tobin?! You’re going to just sit around on your butt and let Celica die for us?!

speaker: Tobin
text: What? N-no! I don’t want that any more than you do! But what other choice do we have? There’s nothing left we CAN do!

speaker: Alm
text: I’m not giving up.

speaker: Tobin
text: Huh?

speaker: Alm
text: I’m not giving up on her. Every part of me—every fiber of my being—says this is wrong. So we’re going to take down Duma and bring Celica home safe!

speaker: Tobin
text: Sure, that all sounds fine and well. But how do we do that, exactly?

speaker: Clive
text: Consider your position, Alm. You’re no longer just the leader of the Deliverance. You are to be Rigel’s next emperor. You must set your personal feelings aside, no matter how difficult it may be. All of Valentia depends on you now. That must be what steers your decision.

speaker: Alm
text: Fine. Then I decide to follow the will of the previous emperor, Rudolf.

speaker: Clive
text: Alm!

speaker: Alm
text: Oh, come on! What’s wrong with personal feelings?! All of you fought this far because you hold some kind of hope for the world. It’s man’s individual hopes and fears that shape the world. That drive it. And that’s how it SHOULD be. I truly believe that. Should we let the world crumble on a god’s whim? Or his absence?

speaker: Clive
text: You’re right, of course, but...

speaker: Alm
text: I don’t want to lose anyone else I care about. I don’t want to see anyone else lost because of Duma. Don’t you feel the same, Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: ...... Even if we escape from Duma’s control, a starving people can know no peace. Villains and thieves will arise to feed on the weakest and most vulnerable. Are you prepared to inflict that upon the world?

speaker: Alm
text: I will dedicate my life as emperor to ensuring such a thing doesn’t happen. And yes, I know as well as anyone that there will be losses along the way. I think I’ve learned that much by now... But when I think of the next thousand years, I don’t want this. I want to leave behind a world where we shape our lives by our own hands. Where we make our own mistakes and fix them—as many times as necessary. That’s a world worthy of a future.

speaker: Clive
text: ...So be it. If you have the determination to see it through, I’ll not object. I am yours to command, Your Excellency.

speaker: Gray
text: Count me in! I’m not living my life bowing to Duma and his little idiots. I’ll take going hungry over that any day of the week.

speaker: Tobin
text: I... I’m just not sure.

speaker: Gray
text: Oh, quit your whining and hop on board already!

speaker: Tobin
text: If it were just me I would, but I have little brothers and sisters to think of.

speaker: Lukas
text: I will gladly take up a trowel and work the land with them.

speaker: Tobin
text: Wai—but you’re a noble, Lukas!

speaker: Lukas
text: Such things will mean precious little in the world ahead of us. Myself, I refuse to be controlled by Duma or go hungry. If it means working the barren earth, then I shall do just that.

speaker: Clair
text: And you won’t do it alone! In truth, I’ve always been curious about farming. I’m sure we can reap or sow or... whatever it is enough to stay alive. Though I admit, I think all this talk of doom and gloom is entirely premature.

speaker: Alm
text: This is great, guys. Count me in, too. I’m pretty handy with a plow, actually. I’ll show you guys how it’s done!

speaker: Clive
text: An emperor plowing the fields? I never thought I’d see the day.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh?!

speaker: Alm
text: Mila’s statue is glowing...

speaker: Clive
text: What’s going on here? Wasn’t she sealed away?

speaker: Alm
text: She... She’s calling me...

speaker: Clive
text: Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Let’s go. Mila is calling to me—we might still be able to pull this off. We have to find a way to the altar!

speaker: Jedah
text: It is time, Anthiese. Lord Duma is waiting.

speaker: Celica
text: Not yet. Not before you’ve released Mila. That was the arrangement.

speaker: Jedah
text: I’m afraid that what you ask is beyond my ability. Mila has sealed Falchion herself. We mortals have no say in the matter.

speaker: Celica
text: You-- You lied to me!

speaker: Jedah
text: If you are displeased, Princess, I suggest you point your ire at Mila. Lay blame upon the merciless goddess who forsook her Zofian children!

speaker: Celica
text: Mila! No... How could you?!

speaker: Jedah
text: Cease your lamentations and come along, girl! I’ll send the boy to you shortly. That I can promise.

speaker: Celica
text: No, not Alm! You swore to leave him alone!

speaker: Jedah
text: Keh heh heh... How hopeless a fool can you be? [to Duma] Rejoice, Lord Duma! I have brought the Brand-bearer who threatens your order. Take her soul unto you and feast!

speaker: Celica
text: No! Stop! Let me go! AAAAALM!

speaker: Jedah
text: Ohh... Such potent energy! Bwaaaa ha ha ha! My Lord Duma is PLEASED! You needn’t wait much longer. I shall offer up the other Brand-bearer’s soul to you presently!

speaker: Jedah
text: Anthiese, I declare you reborn as Duma’s faithful pawn. Now go. Fall into the darkest depths and rot with Mila below!

speaker: Alm
text: There... It’s him!

speaker: Berkut
text: Heh... Heh heh ha ha ha... You kept me waiting, Alm! Or should I say...Your Excellency? Perhaps Emperor Rudolf II of Rigel?

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut, listen to—

speaker: Berkut
text: Tell me, how does it feel to possess both Zofia and Rigel? I imagine it’s wonderful, though it’s a sensation I’ll never know.

speaker: Alm
text: This isn’t a conquest for me. I have no illusions the people of Rigel will suddenly welcome me as their ruler. But my father placed this land in my care, and I’ll do anything for it. Whatever it takes to keep Valentia’s people safe.

speaker: Alm
text: The path ahead is a difficult one for us all. So help us, Berkut. Lend us your strength! Rigel’s people trust and love you far more than me. You and I are cousins, after all. Family. I didn’t think I had any family in this world, and yet, here you are. I know we can be close friends as well. Let’s work together, Berkut. Put all we have toward ensuring all Valentia is—

speaker: Berkut
text: Silence.

speaker: Alm
text: Um...what?

speaker: Berkut
text: Listen to you, offering mercy and trite platitudes from on high. Work together? Us? Don’t make me laugh. Strength isn’t lent, it’s taken! Pried from the grip of your dead foes!

speaker: Alm
text: What the...

speaker: Clive
text: So this is what Fernand warned us about. Alm, Berkut has taken in Duma’s power. He’s no longer the man we knew!

speaker: Alm
text: No!

speaker: Berkut
text: Ah, my beloved Rinea... Beautiful, isn’t she?

speaker: Alm
text: Oh gods... You offered the woman you love up to Duma?!

speaker: Alm
text: How could you?! What’s the point of power if you have nothing left to protect?!

speaker: Berkut
text: I finally realized something. Power won’t betray me. Power won’t deceive me. Blood ties? Years of life lived together? All meaningless. The only thing in the world a man can rely on is his own strength!

speaker: Alm
text: Years of... Are you accusing my father of betraying you? You’re wrong! He loved you! He worried about you to the last! You knew him so much better than I did. How can you not see that?

speaker: Berkut
text: SILENCE! I’m tired of listening to your pretty little lies. [to Rinea] It’s time, Rinea. Come with me. We’ll hold our wedding atop his funeral!

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut!

speaker: Berkut
text: You... You took...everything from me. You will SUFFER for what you’ve done!

speaker: Berkut
text: Graugh!

speaker: Berkut
text: Nnngh...

speaker: Alm
text: Why, Berkut? To have finally found family after all this time... Why did it come to this?!

speaker: Berkut
text: Heh... I have no family...nor do I want for one. Now stop talking and finish this. End me, and you can stand alone as inheritor of Rigel’s royal blood.

speaker: Alm
text: I never wanted that! Don’t you get it? I’ve spent enough of my life alone!

speaker: Rinea'S Voice
text: My Lord Berkut...

speaker: Berkut
text: ...Rinea? Rinea, is that really you?

speaker: Rinea
text: Dear, proud Berkut... Even without crown or throne or castle... You were ever my emperor. A just, right, and noble man...

speaker: Berkut
text: Rinea...

speaker: Rinea
text: You were born to lead... This just wasn’t your empire. So come with me now. Let us find our empire together. If you’ll still take me for your empress?

speaker: Berkut
text: You’re right... You were always right. The moment I turned to a power beyond myself, the man you loved was dead. Rinea, forgive me... If you’ll have me, I’d be honored to...set out with you...

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut!

speaker: Berkut
text: Is that you, Alm...? Here...take this.

speaker: Alm
text: A ring?

speaker: Berkut
text: A memento...of my mother... Let it be of some use... ...Ngh!

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut, no! Please... I don’t want to be alone again! Help me rebuild Rigel! Tell me about my father!

speaker: Berkut
text: You’re not...a child anymore... Alm... You must...make Valentia a land not... of gods...but of men... A world where people...never again... are corrupted by divine power... You can do it... I know...you...

speaker: Alm
text: Berkut! Berkut... Why? Someone please tell me... I never got to know you... or my father...

speaker: Alm
text: What is this place?

speaker: Clair
text: Why, it’s a treasure vault, of course! ...Isn’t that obvious? Mmm? What’s this say? “These doors bar all save those of royal blood.”

speaker: Alm
text: The royal treasury... This is where Falchion was supposed to be stored.

speaker: Clair
text: So we’ve been told, yes. Though I believe it found a new home in Mila’s skull. One shudders to think of it. Regardless, we’ve no business here.

speaker: Gray
text: You sure about that? I doubt Falchion’s the only trinket tucked away in there. Who knows what might be left? Gold? Jewels? Magical doodads? Whatcha think, Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Maybe so...

speaker: Alm
text: ...Huh?! The Brand... It’s glowing.

speaker: Gray
text: Alm? You okay there, buddy?

speaker: Alm
text: I’m feeling something...strange. I need to take a look.

speaker: Gray
text: Take a look at what? ...Alm? Uh, Alm? Hey, where you going?!

speaker: Gray
text: Waugh! What in the...? Oh come on! I can’t get past!

speaker: Clair
text: It appears the vault really does bar all but the royal family. How cheeky! But oh dear, I do hope Alm will be all right on his own.

speaker: Alm
text: That’s... What are Mila and Falchion doing here? And what the heck happened?!

speaker: Alm
text: *gasps* Celica! You're all right!

speaker: Alm
text: Nraugh! Celica?! Celica, what are you doing?! It’s me!

speaker: Celica
text: (growls meancingly, displayed as "......")

speaker: Alm
text: Celica...?

speaker: Jedah
text: Keh heh heh... Your words can’t reach her, boy.

speaker: Alm
text: Jedah!

speaker: Jedah
text: The girl has already offered up her soul to Lord Duma. What you see now is a husk. A witch. A puppet loyal to the dark god’s will!

speaker: Alm
text: No... NO! Celica, please! You have to wake up!

speaker: Jedah
text: Go, witch. Offer up your fellow Brand-bearer’s soul to your new master! Ah, the sight of fate’s twin children fighting to the death... How marvelous! A reenactment of Duma and Mila’s struggles from legend!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica, don’t do this!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm...please... Listen, Alm... You have to...stop me before I kill you! You know what you have to do! Alm! Do it now! KILL ME!

speaker: Alm
text: Are you crazy? You know I can’t do that!

speaker: Mila'S Voice
text: Hear me, bearer of Duma’s Brand.

speaker: Mila'S Voice
text: Grasp Falchion now in your hand.

speaker: Jedah
text: What’s this? What is the boy doing?

speaker: Jedah
text: Impossible! No one should be able to unbind that blade!

speaker: Mila'S Voice
text: Trust in Falchion.

speaker: Alm
text: Gods, no...

speaker: Alm
text: Don’t leave me, Celica... You can’t!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica? Celica! Say something, please!

speaker: Alm
text: CELICAAA!

speaker: Celica
text: ...Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Celica...

speaker: Alm
text: Celica! Oh, Celica, thank goodness you’re okay...! But... how?

speaker: Celica
text: Ha... I don’t know either. But I heard a voice. A very... kind voice. It said everything would be all right, and to have faith in Falchion. [noticing something] Alm, look, what is that?

speaker: Mila'S Voice
text: Alm... Anthiese. Children of fate, bearers of the Brand...

speaker: Alm
text: That voice!

speaker: Mila
text: I am Mila. Your kind call me “goddess”. Together with my brother Duma, I shaped this land.

speaker: Alm
text: Earth Mother!

speaker: Mila
text: Some have called me by that name... But no such power remains within me.

speaker: Alm
text: What?

speaker: Mila
text: See well Falchion, which you now hold. It was carved from the fang of Naga, ruler of dragons, to sever the gods. For Naga knew there was but a creeping madness waiting at eternity’s end. It is a ruin all dragons share. And the only end is one of total destruction. Thus it was that Naga bestowed Falchion upon Duma. She did so to prepare for the day our madness would drive the land to ruin, that the people might have a means to destroy us. That Falchion might become the fangs they lack...and the hope they deserve. And yet, in my foolishness, I sealed the blade away. I did it to protect my brother... I loved my brother, even as we loved mankind. Where we strayed, I cannot remember.

speaker: Alm
text: Mila...

speaker: Mila
text: Alm, Anthiese, children of fate... You have overcome much to reach me here, and I thank you both. You have shown me the strength possessed by mankind. Perhaps men have long been walking on their own without our aid. Perhaps I simply refused to see it. And alas, Duma was no different. I entrust Falchion to your care. I pray you will use it to free my brother... from the depths of his pain.

speaker: Celica
text: Mila!

speaker: Alm
text: ...Let’s go, Celica. We have to save Duma, for her sake and ours.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm, I...

speaker: Alm
text: Listen, Celica. I know you sacrificed your own life to protect me and the others. But I never wanted that. I couldn’t ever be happy in a world you died to create!

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, Alm... I’m sorry! I’m so, so sorry!

speaker: Alm
text: Don’t apologize. Just know that I need you, all right? Without your wisdom, all I know how to do is fight whatever’s in front of me. So please... Will you fight with me? Believe in me. Believe in US. Believe in our combined strength!

speaker: Celica
text: I do. It’s as Mila said... We’ve had the strength to live and fight for our world this whole time. I lost faith in that somewhere along the way... But right now, it seems the most obvious thing in the world. I trust in mankind like I trust in you, Alm. Absolutely, and without hesitation.

speaker: Alm
text: I feel the same, Celica. This isn’t where things end for us. Even without gods, this world has a long and prosperous future ahead of it. Now let’s go claim that future together!

speaker: Celica
text: Let’s be ready for anything.

speaker: Mae
text: Celica! That’s really you, right?!

speaker: Celica
text: Mae! Everyone! You’re safe! You have no idea how happy this makes me!

speaker: Mae
text: Right back at ya, sister! That chump Jedah’s magic sent us off to who-knows-where! We were surrounded by Terrors and junk—I thought we were dead meat! But then we heard this weird voice kinda...talking, I guess? So we followed it because hey, why not? And that’s how we ended up here!

speaker: Celica
text: A voice? It must have been Mila.

speaker: Jedah
text: No... No, this cannot happen! Falchion’s seal, broken? Foul Mila! Duma is your brother! Would you truly betray your own kin?!

speaker: Alm
text: Stand down, Jedah! Your schemes end here and now. Prepare to pay for your atrocities!

speaker: Jedah
text: Rudolf’s worthless spawn... You’re both disgusting heretics. How dare you wish harm on Duma!

speaker: Celica
text: Open your eyes, Jedah. No matter how it pains you, you must see the truth. Duma’s gone mad—he brings only suffering to his people now. This is the divine dragons’ fate.

speaker: Jedah
text: Silence, girl! You know nothing of what you speak. And if suffering is the gods’ will, what of it? Without their strength at its foundation, Valentia cannot sustain life.

speaker: Alm
text: No. You’re wrong. It’s time for us all to stand on our own feet. To live as free men and women.

speaker: Jedah
text: Foolish boy. You truly believe such heresy to be possible?

speaker: Celica
text: It IS possible! We’ve come all this way to prove it.

speaker: Jedah
text: Presumptuous human child... Go on, then! Prove me wrong! Show me this strength to “stand alone.” Show me the true limits of man!

speaker: Gray
text: All we’re asking is the ability to live as we think best. Is that really so bad?

speaker: Tobin
text: Even without gods, I have my friends. With them, I can survive anything.

speaker: Kliff
text: It’s all strength and power with you. If you’re that desperate for a show of force, I’ll be happy to oblige.

speaker: Faye
text: This world belongs to Alm. To all of us. There’s plenty of room for hope in it... but there’s no room in it for you!

speaker: Lukas
text: A battle between god and mortal? Sounds exhilarating to me.

speaker: Silque
text: Merciful Mila... I carry your will within me. I will see Duma freed from his suffering!

speaker: Clair
text: This business of relying on gods and... so forth all seems quite absurd to me. The creepy man will excuse himself now!

speaker: Clive
text: I’ll take a proud death as my own man over a life of kneeling to a mad god!

speaker: Forsyth
text: I have no deference for one who would wield unjust power over his people. Such a despot is no god of mine!

speaker: Python
text: Ugh, people who go on and on about power are just the WORST.

speaker: Luthier
text: Your spirit’s voice is ghastly dark. I have no use for magic so foul.

speaker: Mathilda
text: I alone will decide who I choose to worship. But I can promise you one thing: it certainly won’t be you!

speaker: Delthea
text: Come on, who needs gods when you’re as strong as me?

speaker: Tatiana
text: This is my world, and Zeke’s as well. I won’t allow you to endanger it!

speaker: Zeke
text: Emperor Rudolf... Your loyal servant will see your dreams realized!

speaker: Mycen
text: This is a battle I cannot lose. For my own sake or yours, Rudolf!

speaker: Mae
text: You’re gonna pay for what you did to Celica, buddy. You’re gonna pay HARD!

speaker: Boey
text: Sorry, but I’ve got no interest in the way people like you operate. That’s reason enough for me to want to put you down!

speaker: Genny
text: I’ll never accept a god so horrible...

speaker: Saber
text: Well, hell. I’ve come this far. Might as well see the damn thing through to the end, lass.

speaker: Valbar
text: Foisting your way on the world by force? You’re no better than pirates. And it just so happens I don’t take kindly to pirates!

speaker: Kamui
text: I get the feeling my luck ran out the day I got mixed up in all this... But meh, why not? May as well see things through to the end!

speaker: Leon
text: Your fetish for power is simply barbaric. Where’s the joy? The love? Your perfect world is as dull as dirt.

speaker: Palla
text: The greatest of powers is but one mistake away from utter tragedy. We know that all too well, and I refuse to stand aside and watch it happen!

speaker: Catria
text: This world doesn’t exist as a plaything for dragons!

speaker: Est
text: It’s our world, and we’ll be the ones to shape it—Archanea and Valentia both!

speaker: Jesse
text: Ruling the world with might and terror? Talk about your stale clichés. What’s the point in living if you’re not having fun? I’m not about to find out!

speaker: Atlas
text: Yours isn’t the world I fought to protect. I’m taking every one of you down!

speaker: Sonya
text: Ugh. It’s almost painful to watch... Just how hopelessly ignorant can someone be?

speaker: Deen
text: I won’t say a world ruled by might is unappealing, per se... But a world where I bow to YOU is out of the question.

speaker: Nomah
text: Divine Duma, you have lived long enough... It is time to leave a world of hope and possibility to the next generation.

speaker: Conrad
text: Duma... O ancient benefactor. Consider this is an act of mercy. A great god is deserving of a proud and glorious end!

speaker: Jedah
text: Bow before Duma’s eminence! Kneel before his awesome power!

speaker: Jedah
text: Aah... This cannot be... It mustn’t... Lord Duma... My Lord...Duma...

speaker: Marla
text: Such naughty, willful children... Why won’t you be good and listen to Father?

speaker: Marla
text: Do you really...hate Father so...? Such lost...misguided children...

speaker: Hestia
text: That’s no fair, Sonya... Why should you be the only one allowed to live as she chooses?

speaker: Hestia
text: Oh... It seems so...obvious now. I should have just lived...as I pleased... like you...

speaker: Duma
text: Only power holds meaning. Only strength holds sway. Call to me. Thirst for me. Thirst for power!

speaker: Alm
text: It’s over, Duma! Berkut, Fernand, Mila... Even my father. They and countless others, lost to us— tainted by your precious power. But that chain of tragedies ends here.

speaker: Celica
text: My heart is full of thanks for all you’ve given man, O divine Duma. Without yours and Mila’s bounty, Valentia could never have existed. We would never have been born into this world. Never tasted joy and sorrow. So please, do not suffer any longer. Let all of our pain end here. Allow your great and weary soul the rest it deserves!

speaker: Duma
text: So be it, Alm. I leave Valentia’s future to you, her hero. Take from us what lessons you will and shape her into a land to remember. Make her strong like Duma, and fill her with Mila’s love. Let our grave mistakes be warnings of where not to tread as you lead her forth. Now, we shall sleep. And never shall you disturb our slumber.

speaker: Celica
text: So this is where you were.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? Oh, hey, Celica.

speaker: Celica
text: You aren’t going to be late to your own coronation, are you?

speaker: Alm
text: No. ...Of course not. I’m just still wrapping my head around sitting on your father’s throne. None of it feels real.

speaker: Celica
text: ...It isn’t my father’s throne. This isn’t Zofia any longer, Alm. It’s the One Kingdom of Valentia. And you’re going to be its first ruler.

speaker: Alm
text: Celica...

speaker: Celica
text: Please don’t misunderstand. I don’t bear him any grudge. Not now. I just think he was a very sad man. Perhaps if I’d been there with him, I might have helped him change. If I have any regrets, it’s that.

speaker: Alm
text: I know what you mean... Neither of us got the chance to stand by our fathers. If we’d been given the opportunity to learn more about each other, maybe things would’ve turned out differently for us.

speaker: Celica
text: Perhaps it was the same for Mila and Duma.

speaker: Alm
text: Hmm... I wonder. They’d been fighting for centuries, right? Seems like a lost cause to me.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm, that’s a terrible thing to say!

speaker: Alm
text: Ah, sorry! I didn’t mean any disrespect. But they’re at peace now, you know? Asleep. ...Together.

speaker: Celica
text: Yes. They’ll look down over this new Valentia forever from their mountaintop graves. ...And the trees. Do you know of them, Alm? They say that where divine dragons sleep, sacred trees take root and grow.

speaker: Alm
text: Wow. Must be some trees.

speaker: Celica
text: In time, yes. They grow for hundreds, even thousands of years. Who can say what Valentia will look like once they’ve matured? Will man’s endeavors continue without the grace and strength of the gods?

speaker: Alm
text: They won’t continue on their own. We have to make it happen. We’ll forge a land where we can do just that. All of us—together.

speaker: Celica
text: That sounds lovely, Alm. And you’re right. I know we can do it.

speaker: Alm
text: We can...and we will. I think Mila and Duma gave us one last gift... The strength to trust in our own abilities. ...Anyway, it’s time. Let’s go, Celica.

speaker: Celica
text: Gladly.

speaker: Alm
text: Once upon a time, there was a god named Duma and a goddess named Mila who fought each other bitterly for an age.

speaker: Celica
text: Hey, why did Mila and Duma have to fight so much? Couldn't they just say they were sorry?

speaker: Alm
text: Let’s promise we'll never end up like that, okay?

speaker: Celica
text: Yeah, nothing will ever come between us.

speaker: Alm
text: Gods, no...

speaker: Alm
text: Don't leave me, Celica... You can’t!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica? Celica! Say something, please!

speaker: Alm
text: CELICAAA!

speaker: Faye
text: ...Alm? ...Alm! *sigh* Where did he go this time?

speaker: Gray
text: What's the matter, Faye? Don't tell me you’re after him again?

speaker: Faye
text: Oh! Hey, Gray. Say, have you seen Alm? I can't find him anywhere.

speaker: Kliff
text: Alm? Don’t waste your time looking for that guy.

speaker: Faye
text: Kliff! ...Wait, why not?

speaker: Kliff
text: He and Celica went off for a stroll in the woods. I saw them leave.

speaker: Faye
text: He's with Celica? ...Again?

speaker: Gray
text: Exactly. Again?! I mean, Celica JUST moved to Ram Village, right? *sigh* Nice to know we're so easily replaced.

speaker: Faye
text: H-he's not replacing us. Celica's his cousin. Of course they’re gonna be close.

speaker: Kliff
text: Uh, I hate to break it to you, Faye...

speaker: Faye
text: Huh?

speaker: Kliff
text: Sir Mycen only has one grandkid. And that's Alm. Celica is his ward. Mother told me. They’re not related by blood.

speaker: Gray
text: Kliff's ma, spoutin' gossip? *gasp* I don’t believe it! Still, I like where this story is going. Celica and her dark, unspeakable past...

speaker: Faye
text: Stop that, would you? So does this mean... I mean... Is Alm gonna marry her someday?

speaker: Gray
text: Wha— Marry her?! Are we having the same conversation?

speaker: Tobin
text: Ha ha! Ah, there you are! You guys'll never believe this!

speaker: Gray
text: Hey, Tobin. Believe what?

speaker: Tobin
text: Somebody saw a knight in the woods! A real knight! From the castle! Come on, let's go check it out!

speaker: Gray
text: What? Why would a knight come here? Big fan of manure or something? I'm not missing this! He could be the last knight we see for months...or years! Kliff, Faye! You coming?

speaker: Faye
text: Yeah!

speaker: Kliff
text: Huh? H-hey, wait up!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm! Over here! Come look at this!

speaker: Alm
text: What is it, Celica? You find something?

speaker: Celica
text: I made a wreath out of these flowers. Here, put it on!

speaker: Alm
text: Wh-what? No!

speaker: Celica
text: Why not? I think it'd make you look very handsome.

speaker: Alm
text: I think you mean "very stupid." Boys don’t wear wreaths.

speaker: Celica
text: Don't call it stupid! It took me a long time to make this. Fine then. Maybe I’ll just give it to Grandpapa instead.

speaker: Alm
text: You're kidding, right?

speaker: Celica
text: Grandpapa knows a manly wreath when he sees one...unlike SOME boys. Ha ha.

speaker: Alm
text: Har har. Very funny.

speaker: Celica
text: You're picturing him wearing it. Ha ha! Admit it!

speaker: Alm
text: ...Heh heh.

speaker: Celica
text: There’s the smile I was looking for. ...Huh? What, is something wrong?

speaker: Alm
text: No, I just... I'm glad you’ve cheered up, is all. When you first came to the village, you always wore such a dark expression... Plus, you never spoke a word! Grandpapa told me to be nice, but I wasn't sure how to make things better.

speaker: Celica
text: Well, I think you did just fine. Each story that you told me, each flower you picked for me, each walk you took with me here in the woods— that all made a difference, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Come on, I didn’t do anything special.

speaker: Celica
text: Or maybe you did. I'm sorry that my first words to you were so unkind.

speaker: Alm
text: Are you talking about when you called me a "boor," or a "clod"?

speaker: Celica
text: Hey, I said I’m sorry! I've just never had any friends my age. So I guess I wasn't used to boys like you.

speaker: Alm
text: Well, I'd never met a girl like you, either. Don’t let it get to you.

speaker: Celica
text: Say, Alm? Why are you so nice to me?

speaker: Alm
text: ...Why? Do I need a reason? I mean, I guess it's because I never knew my parents, I have no siblings... and Grandpapa has always forbid me from setting foot outside the village. You're like a window to a world that I’ve never had the chance to know. Is that a good enough reason, or... ...Oh, hey!

speaker: Celica
text: What is it?

speaker: Alm
text: See this? We have the same mark.

speaker: Celica
text: Um, yes? Except yours is on your left hand and mine is on my right...

speaker: Alm
text: Well, that makes us close! Er, doesn’t it?

speaker: Celica
text: Ha ha! I suppose it does, in a strange sort of way. I wonder why the marks are so similar.

speaker: Alm
text: It's because they’re special. They prove that the two of us belong together. Always. That is, if you're not already tired of a clod like me making you laugh.

speaker: Celica
text: Of course not! So...do you mean it? We'll always be together?

speaker: Alm
text: Yes. I promise. Isn't that what you want?

speaker: Celica
text: Yes, of course! You have my word, I'll never lea—

speaker: Faye
text: [offscreen] Eeeeeek!

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? That was Faye!

speaker: Celica
text: Is she in trouble?

speaker: Alm
text: It came from beyond those trees. Come on!

speaker: Faye
text: Stop it! Let me go!

speaker: Soldier
text: Heh... Looks like our luck's picked up, eh, Sir Slayde? After days of the same old trees, such cherubic faces are welcome indeed! After all, where little brats play... we’ll find a village, I say.

speaker: Slayde
text: Listen well, you whelps. My men and I, loyal knights in service to His Majesty King Lima IV— may the powers bless him and his name until the end of days— hereby command you to lead us to your miserable line of hovels, where you shall have the honor of dining us and otherwise providing all comforts. It shall be an evening to remember. So lead on! And make haste, now.

speaker: Tobin
text: B-but, we can't just... We'll get the scolding of our lives if we bring strangers to the village!

speaker: Gray
text: Good Sir Knight, if I may... Ahem! Our home is but a small village—to call it a line of hovels is too generous. We do not wish to offend you when you are clearly deserving of so much more. So please, we humbly implore your great mightiness to—

speaker: Slayde
text: You. Boy. Have you an older sister?

speaker: Gray
text: Er, me? I have two, actually. What about 'em?

speaker: Slayde
text: Ha ha ha! That’ll suffice! We’ll take all the food and drink you can muster—and your sisters can serve it! I wager we’ll get naught but pig feed and horse piss, but so be it. I shall force it down if I must.

speaker: Gray
text: Grrr...

speaker: Kliff
text: *sniff*

speaker: Gray
text: Gods, Kliff, shut your hole! Don’t cry in front of ’em!

speaker: Kliff
text: B-but Gray...

speaker: Tobin
text: We should ALL be crying, Gray! We’re not really gonna take 'em to the village, are we?!

speaker: Gray
text: Hey, I don’t like it either! If I knew the royal knights were such royal turds, I never would've—

speaker: Slayde
text: Enough chittering, little squirrels, I am not a patient man! If you do not wish to entertain us the one way, you can entertain us the other. Perhaps we shall remove your tiny heads from your shoulders, one...by...one.

speaker: Gray
text: Aaaaah!

speaker: Slayde
text: You first, filly. Don’t worry, lass— I’ll make a nice, clean cut...

speaker: Faye
text: No!

speaker: Alm
text: Back off!

speaker: Slayde
text: Ugh. How many whelps does this blasted village contain?!

speaker: Alm
text: Get away from my friends! You're not going to set one foot in our village!

speaker: Slayde
text: Is that so? Someone neglected to teach this mangy pup any manners... Hmm?

speaker: Celica
text: *gasp*

speaker: Slayde
text: You there! Girl! Show me your face.

speaker: Celica
text: No...

speaker: Slayde
text: By the gods... It really IS her! Heh heh. How you came to walk among these animals is beyond me. Regardless, you shall make a fine prize to take back to General Desaix. [to his minions] Seize her!

speaker: Celica
text: No... L-let me go!

speaker: Alm
text: Get your hands off her!

speaker: Slayde
text: Ooof!

speaker: Gray
text: *gasp* Alm, you did NOT just punch a knight!

speaker: Slayde
text: Urgh! You dare raise a hand to me?! You baseborn...barn-bred... So be it. You will stave off your death sentences no longer—especially you!

speaker: Alm
text: Ah!

speaker: Slayde
text: Ha ha ha! The Mother can’t save you now, brat!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm! Look out!

speaker: Alm
text: ...Huh? *gasp* Grandpapa?

speaker: Slayde
text: What? Mycen?! What are you doing in a backwater wasteland like— ...Ah. But I think I know.

speaker: Slayde
text: Now, this...this is indeed good fortune. We never finished what we started in the flames that night, old man. I have much to repay you for. ...I mustn't forget ALL my virtues, after all.

speaker: Mycen
text: ...Children. Run to the cemetery up ahead. Go on now.

speaker: Alm
text: What? Why? What are you gonna do?

speaker: Mycen
text: Now, Alm! All of you! RUN!

speaker: Alm
text: A-all right. Come on, guys!

speaker: Mycen
text: Listen well, children. We will drive these ruffians away, but you must follow my every command.

speaker: Alm
text: What? But we’re no match for them!

speaker: Celica
text: ...You’re serious, Grandpapa?

speaker: Gray
text: He’s ALWAYS serious! It’s just that this time, he’s also crazy!

speaker: Tobin
text: We can’t do this! Half a dozen children can’t win against mounted knights!

speaker: Faye
text: *cries* I...I want my mother...

speaker: Kliff
text: [sniffles] I wanna go home!

speaker: Mycen
text: ENOUGH!

speaker: Mycen
text: The only way you’re going home is by fighting as if your life depends on it! Alm! Celica!

speaker: Alm
text: Uh, sir!

speaker: Mycen
text: I trust you two remember some of what I’ve taught you of the sword. Now, clear the mind, steady the hand, and show me what you’ve learned. Only you can get yourselves through this!

speaker: Mycen
text: Are you ready? I want you to follow my every command. First, get yourselves to a safer position!

speaker: Mycen
text: Keep your distance from the enemy. Don’t try to pursue them!

speaker: Mycen
text: Take shelter in the trees there. They can provide cover. Remember, always use the surrounding terrain to your advantage!

speaker: Mycen
text: You’ve done all you can for now. Now brace for their attack!

speaker: Slayde
text: Damn! They nearly have me... But not today. I must return to the castle. General Desaix will be eager to learn that we have found...her. The princess who refuses to die. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Alm
text: We did it! We actually did it! Look at 'em run, Grandpapa!

speaker: Gray
text: So, wait. HOW did we do that. exactly?

speaker: Tobin
text: Ha ha! It’s all in the wrist.

speaker: Kliff
text: You wish. We only survived because we did exactly as Sir Mycen commanded.

speaker: Tobin
text: Oh yeah? Does that mean Sir Mycen commanded you to sob like a baby?

speaker: Faye
text: [pants for air] How can you guys joke about this?

speaker: Alm
text: Grandpapa, Celica, that was great!

speaker: Mycen
text: Mmm...

speaker: Alm
text: What? You’re not happy? We saved the village from those despicable knaves! We’re heroes! I mean, if nothing else, we’re not dead. You could at least crack a smile.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm, you don’t understand.

speaker: Mycen
text: Now that they know Celica is here, they will stop at nothing. It’s no longer safe for her to stay in the village.

speaker: Alm
text: ...What? But...why? It doesn’t have to be like that. Tell him, Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: I'm so sorry, Alm. I know that you would have kept your promise.

speaker: Alm
text: Don’t apologize, Celica. Just... Just tell me that this is a mistake! That you don’t have to go!

speaker: Mycen
text: It is already settled. And we lack the time to discuss it further. Get back to the village and pack your things, Celica. Hurry.

speaker: Celica
text: Yes, sir...

speaker: Alm
text: Hold on a second! Explain this to me, Grandpapa. Why are you making her leave? I want to know!

speaker: Mycen
text: No, my boy—I fear that’s a page you don’t want to turn. ...Not yet, at any rate.

speaker: Alm
text: Oh, great. Now you’re talking in riddles? I won’t let you do this to her! She needs me!

speaker: Mycen
text: You? A foolish boy who won’t listen to reason? Celica has proven she has the strength to make hard choices. Yet what of you?

speaker: Alm
text: Please... Don’t take her away...

speaker: Celica
text: Alm... Would you mind looking after something for me?

speaker: Alm
text: *gasp* But this is... This is your good-luck charm. You never take this off! It’s...special.

speaker: Celica
text: Yes, it is. And now it’s yours. I want you to keep it close always. As close as you would have kept me. My mother gave that to me. Not that I actually remember, but...

speaker: Alm
text: Celica, I can’t take this from you.

speaker: Celica
text: You’re not taking it, I’m giving it. I pray that it keeps you safe. Take care, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Wait... Celica!

speaker: Tobin
text: Well, this turned into a fine mess.

speaker: Kliff
text: We don't know why she’s leaving, or even where she’s going. And whatever Sir Mycen knows, he isn’t telling the likes of us.

speaker: Gray
text: Hey, not everything is our business. I just feel bad for her, you know? She and Alm are different from us.

speaker: Tobin
text: Different? In what way?

speaker: Gray
text: In every way.

speaker: Mycen
text: Are you certain, Celica?

speaker: Celica
text: Yes. If I try to say good-bye to him, I’ll just end up crying. Grandp— Er, Sir Mycen? Where will I go next?

speaker: Mycen
text: Hmm... I have a place in mind. Perhaps it's time to call on an old friend. Under his care, I am certain your enemies will never find you. Forgive an old knight for failing you, Princess. Had the Mother willed it... I would have stayed by your side and protected you to my dying days. But I cannot leave Ram Village. Not yet.

speaker: Celica
text: You don’t need to apologize, Sir Mycen. I regret nothing. The days I spent here with you and Alm were wonderful. The experiences I had and the friends I made all mean the world to me. You don’t have to be my shining knight, Sir Mycen— you just have to promise to always be my grandpapa.

speaker: Mycen
text: Of course.

speaker: Alm
text: CELICA!

speaker: Celica
text: *gasp* ...Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm! You came for me.

speaker: Alm
