text: I want to make a new promise. One day, when I’m older and stronger, I’m going to find you. It doesn’t matter where the world hides you or how long it takes. I promise to find you. So please...don’t forget me, okay?

speaker: Celica
text: I could never forget you, Alm. And I promise too. I’ll be waiting for the day we can meet again. But for now, I have to go. [to Mycen]...Grandpapa?

speaker: Mycen
text: Yes, child?

speaker: Celica
text: ...Do you think I’ll ever see him again?

speaker: Mycen
text: I do. So long as destiny wills it.

speaker: Celica
text: Destiny... So be it.

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: I am a researcher unearthing shocking new truths from Zofia’s history. ...Or I very well might be, if I had any of the resources I needed. Might I ask your help in this matter? You are familiar with the underground cemetery at the Deliverance hideout? Well, at one corner of that site lies the royal grave where Zofia’s kings sleep. At the risk of sounding grave-robby, I desire the Lima Armlet from it. But the place is crawling with Terrors, and I...am not the Terror type. Yet those Terrors are drawn to riches. It’s said they raid the graves for gold. One may drop the armlet I require. Bring it to me and I’ll pay you well!

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Ah! The Lima Armlet! Precisely as the records describe it... It bears the royal emblem of the late king himself. If I can translate this inscription, it may even offer up new insights. Er, pardon me for getting so excited. I’m only eager to return to work. This isn’t a huge sum, but please, take it. You’ve done me a great service.

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Wa...What? No, please! What will become of my poor, beleaguered research?!

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: Oh, you don’t have it. And here I got my scholarly hopes up...

speaker: Scholarly Man
text: How goes your investigation of the underground cemetery?

speaker: Young Man
text: There’s a strange old man I’ve not seen before hanging about the throne room. There’s something not right about him. Almost like he’s some manner of ghost.

speaker: Eerie Hermit
text: I have long stood watch over this castle and its masters... But some fool has violated the grave where Zofia’s monarchs lie. They’ve broken the seal, and now a massive fiend has made its home there. It sullies the site with its foul presence, barring the fallen kings from slumber. I ask this of you, warrior—rid their holy tomb of this blight!

speaker: Eerie Hermit
text: Fine work, child of fate. You have proven your strength. My master, too, has acknowledged you as worthy to inherit the kingdom. That royal shield is your proof. Use it well. And know that my master and I will watch over you always.

speaker: Eerie Hermit
text: You must destroy the beast that has made its home in the royal grave.

speaker: Young Man
text: Mmm? Where did the strange old man who was in here go? I wonder who he actually was...?

speaker: Lord Rion
text: It’s over... All over.... There’s nothing to be done!

speaker: Lord Rion
text: I am the eldest son of the Rion family, one of Zofia’s oldest houses. But that dog Desaix demanded we give him our greatest heirloom—a shield. The Rion Shield was a gift from Queen Zofia I, passed down ever since. If I can’t find some way to recover it, my ancestors’ legacy will be lost. The Deliverance is marching on Desaix’s fortress, is it not? If you chance to find the Rion Shield, please see it returned to me. You will be rewarded handsomely, of course. I thank you in advance.

speaker: Lord Rion
text: Yes... Yes! This is our family shield! You have my thanks! And here, a token of that gratitude.

speaker: Lord Rion
text: Now that I’ve recovered the shield, I must be heading home.

speaker: Lord Rion
text: What is your intent in this? Why would you play at such a game?

speaker: Lord Rion
text: Please recover the Rion Shield. I cannot bear to return home without it!

speaker: Lord Rion
text: This shield bears the crest of the Fugue family—our sworn enemies! A pox on those dastards! Even looking upon this sets my blood to boil!

speaker: Ally Soldier
text: Sir Alm! Our scouts have spied Rigelian forces up ahead!

speaker: Alm
text: ...... ...Then the battle begins here.

speaker: Lukas
text: So it seems. The fights ahead will be nothing like our skirmishes in the south. You’ve wounded Rigel’s pride, and they will strike back without mercy. But the spirit of Zofia demands you prevail. There’s no turning back now.

speaker: Alm
text: I know.

speaker: Fernand
text: There you are, whelp. I thought you’d never arrive.

speaker: Alm
text: Wait a second...

speaker: Clive
text: Fernand?! You march beneath Rigel’s standard now?

speaker: Fernand
text: Does that really surprise you, Clive? You and the Deliverance took all I believed in and trod it into the mire. In Rigel, they still have ideals worth upholding.

speaker: Clive
text: Damn you, Fernand! Listen to yourself!

speaker: Fernand
text: My king is dead. My country fallen. But I’ll not hand this land over to you. Now, it is the Rigelian Empire’s turn. Lord Berkut shall lead us and unite Valentia under one noble order!

speaker: Clive
text: Come to your senses, Fernand! You have always fought for your motherland—for Zofia!

speaker: Fernand
text: Only one of us has lost his senses, Clive.

speaker: Clive
text: What?

speaker: Fernand
text: Allow me to enlighten you. That boy you have been parading around as your new hero? He was never Mycen’s grandson.

speaker: Clive
text: What is this folly?

speaker: Fernand
text: ...Oh, I can assure you it is no folly. My source has known Sir Mycen for years. The old knight has no family. Heh. Perhaps he made some orphan his ward so he wouldn’t have to die alone.

speaker: Clive
text: You lie... And yet there is the matter of what the old man at the castle said...

speaker: Fernand
text: Ha ha ha! Oh, Clive. You’ve become the very picture of absurdity. Once you were a man to whom the lineage of our noble houses meant all. But now you take for your future king a boy you don’t know from a gutter rat!

speaker: Fernand
text: Come at me. Surely you detestable vermin don’t think you can stand against a true nobleman?

speaker: Fernand
text: Nnngh... I have...no choice... I must fall back...and rejoin Lord Berkut in the main force...

speaker: Zaxon
text: You don’t look half as scared as you ought. Don’t you value your lives? It’s time you had the fear of death put back into you!

speaker: Zaxon
text: No... I’ll not surrender... Not like...this...

speaker: Alm
text: We’ve emerged victorious, but... the survivors will be making their way back to the main force. We can’t rest on our laurels now. Wouldn’t you agree, Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: ...Hmm? Oh, yes. Quite.

speaker: Alm
text: What is it? You look shaken. ...Oh, right. Forgive me. You and Fernand were good friends.

speaker: Clive
text: No, it’s not that... Well, it’s not JUST that... In any case, it’s nothing you need trouble yourself with. If you’ll excuse me.

speaker: Alm
text: What’s with him?

speaker: Lukas
text: A moment please, Alm. I have a fresh report from our scouts. Apparently, the enemy’s main force has retreated west through the forest. But before we give chase, we should deal with Desaix. It wouldn’t be wise to pass him by while his fortress lies in reach.

speaker: Alm
text: All right, that makes sense. But listen, Lukas... Do you know anything about the Rigelian general Fernand mentioned? Berkut, I believe it was?

speaker: Lukas
text: Lord Berkut, yes. I am no stranger to the rumors, at least. They say he is about your age. A talented young general of royal blood... It’s no wonder Fernand is so smitten with him.

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah... Does it really matter so much where you’re born or who your father was?

speaker: Lukas
text: I beg your pardon?

speaker: Alm
text: Oh—sorry, I was just... I don’t meant to speak ill of nobles or anything.

speaker: Lukas
text: Well, I should hope not. Your own grandfather was a count, after all.

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah, I know, but...

speaker: Clive
text: ...... Enough of this talk. Alm, beyond this forest lies a great army— you shouldn’t trouble yourself with anything but the battles ahead.

speaker: Alm
text: You’re right, Clive. I apologize.

speaker: Berkut
text: As I live and breathe... The Deliverance! Well, this is simply delightful.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh?! Fernand! And who’s this?

speaker: Berkut
text: My name is Berkut. I am nephew to His Majesty Emperor Rudolf.

speaker: Alm
text: So here he is...

speaker: Berkut
text: Alm, was it? I must say, I was most impressed by the battle at Zofia Castle. I nearly mistook that motley band of rustics you were leading for an army.

speaker: Clive
text: What are you doing here? Your main force has retreated.

speaker: Fernand
text: Lord Berkut longs for sport and wishes to test your might.

speaker: Berkut
text: I’ve gone too long without fighting and felt I needed a spot of practice. Now then...do try to make this little exercise worth my time!

speaker: Alm
text: Gods, he’s charging right at us!

speaker: Berkut
text: Hah! What’s the matter, farmboy? Afraid you won’t land a single blow?

speaker: Alm
text: The name is Alm—not “farmboy.”

speaker: Berkut
text: Oh, my mistake. Wait a second...

speaker: Berkut
text: That mark on your left hand... Where did that come from?

speaker: Alm
text: What do you care?! Are you here to fight or not?

speaker: Berkut
text: No... It cannot be the Brand. Not on one as unremarkable as you. It must be false. Just like its bearer!

speaker: Berkut
text: Come then! Are you going to entertain me or not?

speaker: Berkut
text: They’re stronger than I thought... But no... I came here to be entertained, not to give up my life.

speaker: Fernand
text: I needn’t test you as Lord Berkut does. I already know how pathetic you are!

speaker: Fernand
text: Careless... But next time will be different.

speaker: Alm
text: I’m not quite sure how we just pulled that off... There were only three of them—how did they give us so much trouble?

speaker: Clive
text: Rigel may be stronger than I first believed... What if this IS a mistake?

speaker: Alm
text: Did you say something, Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: ...It was nothing. Come, we must plan our siege of Desaix’s fortress. An ally of ours is being held there, and we must rescue her.

speaker: Alm
text: ...You’re talking about Mathilda, right? I heard what happened. She’s...special to you, isn’t she?

speaker: Clive
text: She is. We promised to share a future together. And because of that promise, she has suffered for far too long. It relieves me to know she will soon be free of this burden.

speaker: Alm
text: I’m glad to hear it. And you know I’ll do everything I can to help!

speaker: Clive
text: Thank you, Alm.

speaker: Woman
text: You’re too late! Ain’t nothin’ left for you in this village. We never made trouble for no one. Honored the old laws, we did. But Desaix and them Rigelian brutes raided and pillaged us all the same! You’re with the Deliverance, ain’t ya? Then think kindly on us when ya give that dastard Desaix what’s comin’!

speaker: Young Man
text: Are you with the Deliverance? I’m afraid I have some ill news. One of the enemy soldiers mentioned a female knight they’re holding captive. Desaix plans to put her to death soon as an example to others...

speaker: Clive
text: What?! They intend to execute Mathilda?!

speaker: Young Man
text: I fear so, good sir knight. If she’s dear to you, you’d best march on his fortress before it’s too late.

speaker: Young Woman
text: Desaix’s men come here without pause to raid, pillage, and upend our lives. One of their more wicked knights even made off with some poor lass! And now the empire is trying to start a flood and put half of Zofia to ruin. *sigh* Will we never have peace?

speaker: Old Timer
text: Luthier and Delthea descend from the founder of our village, so they do. She was a mage, one who was said to be the champion Zofia’s finest disciple. For generations, children in their family have been born with a gift for magic, though only those in our village and the late king knew of it. So what fool told those damned Rigelians? *sigh*

speaker: Luthier
text: *gasp* You there! You’re with the Deliverance, are you not?

speaker: Alm
text: I am. Who are you?

speaker: Luthier
text: My name is Luthier. Merely a humble mage from a humble village. On this day, however, I cry your aid, for my younger sister is in trouble!

speaker: Alm
text: What happened?

speaker: Luthier
text: First of all, you should know that my sister is named Delthea. She possesses magical potential beyond that of any in our village. One of Rigel’s arcanists, Tatarrah, caught wind of this and kidnapped her. He’s using his powers to control her and make her guard the northern sluice. They plan to block the sluice until it collapses and Zofia is flooded.

speaker: Alm
text: What?! But that would be catastrophic!

speaker: Luthier
text: Indeed it would. Surely you’re planning to stop them, correct? If so, I ask that you also rescue my sister. I’ll even go with you if you like. If we defeat Tatarrah, that will release his hold on her.

speaker: Luthier
text: Your decisions are your business. See to your own desires, then. I will be here if you find your mind changed.

speaker: Luthier
text: So... Will you let me accompany you or no?

speaker: Man
text: Soldiers of the Deliverance, I require your assistance! Gargoyles have kidnapped my daughter and taken her to the western shrine. If it is at all in your power, you must not let any harm befall her. I know I ask much, so if you manage to save her, my treasure is yours!

speaker: Man
text: I’ve been waiting for you, Deliverance! I hear you saved my daughter from the shrine to the west. I insist you help yourself to my treasure.

speaker: Girl
text: Tee hee. Thank you for coming to save me, brave sir.

speaker: Merchant’S Wife
text: Please, I need your help! My husband went to Zofia Castle to sell his wares, but hasn’t returned. What am I to do? Our child will be born soon, and I can’t survive without him. And actually, I heard a girl from our village was taken to the Sylvan Shrine... What if my husband was taken there as well? Oh, I can’t bear it! If you’re heading to the Sylvan Shrine, would you please look for him?

speaker: Merchant’S Wife
text: Did you find my husband? I think he’s being held in the Sylvan Shrine.

speaker: Merchant’S Wife
text: Wh-what? Aaaaaah!

speaker: Fernand
text: Mathilda...

speaker: Mathilda
text: Fernand? What are you doing here? Have you come to rescue me?!

speaker: Fernand
text: No, milady. I fear I no longer serve the Deliverance.

speaker: Mathilda
text: What? What do you mean?

speaker: Fernand
text: Exactly as I said. Sadly, Clive and I no longer share the same ideals. I have sworn my lance instead to Lord Berkut of the Rigelian Empire.

speaker: Mathilda
text: The general who leads our enemies? Has madness taken you?! A lance sworn to him is a lance through my heart. Don’t you care about Zofia?

speaker: Fernand
text: Zofia? You mean the proud kingdom whose riches fell to wild and ignorant savages? Zofia is dead to me. I have buried her and will not look back.

speaker: Mathilda
text: How can you say such a thing, Fernand? You and Clive were like brothers. It’s not too late to fix this. Return to the Deliverance! I know Clive would welcome you back with open arms.

speaker: Fernand
text: ...With you by my side, I might have chosen differently.

speaker: Mathilda
text: Fernand?

speaker: Fernand
text: What is done is done. ...Desaix intends to put you to death. It won’t be long now.

speaker: Mathilda
text: *gasp*

speaker: Fernand
text: On the morrow, I depart for Rigel at Lord Berkut’s side. Farewell, Mathilda.

speaker: Mathilda
text: Fernand, wait!

speaker: Soldier
text: Chancellor! The rebels have reached the fortress!

speaker: Desaix
text: And damn them for it. Why can’t that Clive see reason? He would sooner have me kill his woman than lay down arms? The obstinate fool! Ah, well. It seems she is of no further use to me. ...Archers! Kill that wench in the cage, but do it slowly. I want her suffering to last.

speaker: Desaix
text: It seems I vastly misestimated you. I’ll grant you that. But today you vermin will die at my hands!

speaker: Desaix
text: Damn you, Mycen... You think to...hand Zofia over to Rudolf’s pup...? T-traitorous dastard...!

speaker: Tobin
text: We did it, Alm! Desaix is finished!

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah...

speaker: Tobin
text: Huh? What’s wrong? I thought you’d be thrilled.

speaker: Alm
text: I AM thrilled, but... Desaix’s dying words have been troubling me. Something about my grandfather and Emperor Rudolf.

speaker: Tobin
text: Huh? You sure you’re not imagining things? What would Sir Mycen and the Rigelian emperor have to do with each other?

speaker: Alm
text: That’s what concerns me. Something’s been bothering me lately. Something I can’t shake. It feels like every victory I secure takes me one step further from Zofia.

speaker: Tobin
text: Ha! Am I allowed to point out that that’s literally what’s happening? We’re a long way from Ram Village, kid. Look, I’m worried too. About my family, about everyone else we left behind... I miss them all terribly, so I get that you’re homesick. But that’s okay, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Thanks, but...I’m afraid that’s not what this is, Tobin. This is...different. *sigh*

speaker: Tatarrah
text: Desaix has fallen... It is but a matter of time until the Deliverance reaches the sluice gate. Your moment to shine has come, my dear Delthea.

speaker: Delthea
text: (possesed moan)

speaker: Tatarrah
text: That traitor is certainly proving himself useful... Heh heh heh...

speaker: Tobin
text: Whoa, look at this. Hey, Alm

speaker: Alm
text: You find something, Tobin?

speaker: Tobin
text: I sure did. Feast your eyes on this baby! You think this is the treasure Desaix stole from Zofia Castle?

speaker: Alm
text: Well...it certainly looks important. Should we open it?

speaker: Tobin
text: Whooooooa! Check the sword! That is one impressive piece of hardware! I’m just gonna—

speaker: Tobin
text: Hng...! Whu... Huh? This thing weighs a ton! It won’t...budge...

speaker: Lukas
text: This must be the Royal Sword of Zofia.

speaker: Alm
text: What’s that?

speaker: Lukas
text: Long ago, Rigel presented this sword to Zofia as a symbol of friendship. It’s a very special treasure—only one of royal blood can lift it.

speaker: Alm
text: Hmm... Interesting. Here, Tobin—let me have a go at it.

speaker: Tobin
text: You?! Pfft, please. If I can’t lift it, there’s no way that— Huh?!

speaker: Alm
text: Sometimes I don’t get you, Tobin. This thing’s light as a feather. Was this all some kind of jape? Who put you up to this?

speaker: Tobin
text: But...but it wasn’t a jape! Zero japes! I thought my arms would snap just trying to lift it!

speaker: Alm
text: Hmm. But that means...

speaker: Lukas
text: By the gods... You can wield the Royal Sword! ...Hmm, what DOES that mean? Alm, are you...

speaker: Alm
text: ...... O-oh, come on. It’s just some legend. You don’t actually BELIEVE it, right? I’m sure everyone can use this thing! Well, except Tobin. And...um... Look, I’m sure the Zofian royals made up a story to keep folks from nicking it.

speaker: Lukas
text: ...Well, that didn’t exactly work out now, did it? But perhaps you’re right. Tales do have a habit of getting taller with time. Either way, it seems clear the blade belongs with you.

speaker: Alm
text: Are you sure? I mean, we could have other people give it a shot.

speaker: Lukas
text: It wouldn’t work. You alone seem able to tame this legend. And we wouldn’t want to see so fine a treasure wasted, would we? Take it.

speaker: Alm
text: Well...all right...

speaker: Alm
text: Clive, I’m... I’m so sorry about Mathilda. I couldn’t save her. I didn’t have what it takes.

speaker: Clive
text: ...No. You did not.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh?

speaker: Clive
text: You have ruined everything! First you cost me my best friend, and now the woman I love is dead! Is that what you would have me say?! ...It will not close these wounds.

speaker: Alm
text: Look, I’m...

speaker: Clive
text: ...... I wish I could stand by my choices, unwavering. I have always done what I thought to be right, even when my heart disagreed. But now I must face cold reality. I may have made a terrible error.

speaker: Alm
text: What are you talking about, Clive?

speaker: Gray
text: Oh no. No, no, no. We’re not going down THAT old road now. Don’t you dare say that making Alm the Deliverance’s leader was a mistake. We’ve been through way too much to start in with second-guessing now!

speaker: Tobin
text: Yeah! I mean, I know you lost so much, and that you’re hurting. But don’t take it out on Alm. He’s been doing as good a job as anyone!

speaker: Clair
text: The two boys will hold their tongues! My brother will not be subjected to your abuses!

speaker: Tobin
text: Ah...

speaker: Clair
text: You are a loathsome cad, Gray. As are you, Tobin. Clive has just lost someone dear to his heart. If you possessed hearts yourselves, you would leave him in peace to grieve!

speaker: Tobin
text: B-but...

speaker: Alm
text: Would you all please calm down?

speaker: Tobin
text: But Alm—

speaker: Alm
text: Clive is clearly privy to some information he can’t share with us. Am I right, Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: Alm, please...

speaker: Alm
text: You’ve been acting strange for a while now. Whatever secret you’re harboring, I know it weighs heavy on you. I’ve been scared to broach the subject because I could sense it was about me.

speaker: Alm
text: But if nothing else, I want you to know this... I will always be grateful for the trust you have placed in me, and I will be honored for each moment I can fight for the Deliverance. She wanted to know why a nobody like me would risk so much to fight. The answer was, I just wanted to make a difference in people’s lives. I HAD to leave Ram Village. It was just a matter of when. When Lukas came to the village, that was my “when.” I want to repay that kindness. Clive, Lukas—let me help you. Let me help Fernand.

speaker: Clive
text: Fernand? But he has insulted you at every step.

speaker: Alm
text: And I can’t claim to understand his motivations for all of that. But he helped you and Mathilda found the Deliverance, didn’t he? He’s part of the reason we’ve come this far. So he deserves my respect, no matter how he’s treated me in the past. If he returns to the Deliverance, I’ll gladly welcome him back.

speaker: Clive
text: You would do such? ...Pray forgive me, Alm. I withdraw my words from before. But there are yet matters I need time to consider.

speaker: Alm
text: Take all the time you need.

speaker: Clive
text: Mathilda!

speaker: Mathilda
text: *gasp* Clive! Oh, how I have missed you, my sweet Clive!

speaker: Clive
text: Forgive me, Mathilda. I should never have left you to suffer for so long. Speak now your loathing for me, and I will gladly bear it all.

speaker: Mathilda
text: Oh, stop your nonsense. You did what any commander ought. Your judgment was sound. And I bear the blame for my capture, not you. I was careless. So let us speak no more of blame.

speaker: Clive
text: As you wish.

speaker: Mathilda
text: Good. Now, I wonder what comes next...

speaker: Clive
text: What indeed...

speaker: Gray
text: What a woman! Yowza! ...Um, Alm? You’re blushing.

speaker: Alm
text: Wh-What? No I’m not!

speaker: Mathilda
text: Ah, you must be Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: Y-Yes, milady.

speaker: Mathilda
text: I would not be alive if not for your fine leadership. I thank you from the bottom of my heart, Alm. And with your permission, I wish to take up arms at your side. Will you have me?

speaker: Mathilda
text: Very well. I have confidence in my ability to fight, but will respect your judgment. Please come find me if you change your mind.

speaker: Mathilda
text: Yes? What is it? I stand ready to fight for you. You need only speak the words.

speaker: Mathilda
text: I saw Fernand. He visited me in my cell the other day.

speaker: Clive
text: I see. Then you know what has transpired.

speaker: Mathilda
text: Yes. It feels like a different age when the three of us started the Deliverance. Though we were once brethren, we now must come to blows.

speaker: Clive
text: (sad sigh) I wish I could stand by my choices, unwavering. I have always done what I thought to be right, even when my heart disagreed. But now I must face cold reality.

speaker: Mathilda
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Clive
text: I may have made a terrible error.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? What are you talking about?

speaker: Clive
text: (sad sigh)

speaker: Gray
text: Oh no. No, no, no. We’re not going down THAT old road now. Don’t you dare say that making Alm the Deliverance’s leader was a mistake. We’ve been through way too much to start in with second-guessing now!

speaker: Tobin
text: Yeah! I mean, I know you lost a dear friend, and that you’re hurting. But don’t take it out on Alm. He’s been doing as good a job as anyone!

speaker: Alm
text: Would you all please calm down?

speaker: Tobin
text: But Alm—

speaker: Alm
text: Clive is clearly privy to some information he can’t share with us. Am I right, Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: Alm, please...

speaker: Alm
text: You’ve been acting strange for a while now. Whatever secret you’re harboring, I know it weighs heavy on you. I’ve been scared to broach the subject because I could sense it was about me.

speaker: Alm
text: But if nothing else, I want you to know this... and I will be honored for each moment I can fight for the Deliverance. ...You know, a friend once confronted me about this. She wanted to know why a nobody like me would risk so much to fight. The answer was, I just wanted to make a difference in people’s lives. When Lukas came to the village, that was my “when.” Don’t you see? Every one of you has set my life moving in ways I never imagined. I want to repay that kindness. Clive, Lukas, Mathilda—let me help you. Let me help Fernand.

speaker: Clive
text: But he has insulted you at every step.

speaker: Alm
text: Oh, I’m well aware. And I can’t claim to understand his motivations for all of that. But he helped you and Mathilda found the Deliverance, didn’t he? So he deserves my respect, no matter how he’s treated me in the past. If he returns to the Deliverance, I’ll gladly welcome him back.

speaker: Clive
text: You would do such? I cannot speak for Fernand, but... Thank you, Alm.

speaker: Alessio
text: What a mess I’ve gotten myself into...

speaker: Alessio
text: You see, Chancellor Desaix asked me to procure him a coral ring. But what happened when I acquired the coral shards and crafted the ring? The damned Deliverance came along and killed the buyer! I sunk all I had into this coral ring. If I don’t sell it, I’ll be ruined! Er...say. Do YOU want a coral ring? It’s crafted from the finest coral fragments a merchant can scrounge up! Since you seem woefully poor... Hmm... Well, I’ll cut you a deal and part with the ring for a mere 30 silver marks.

speaker: Alessio
text: Then we have a deal! ...And thank the Mother we do! Now I can finally go home.

speaker: Alessio
text: Hmph. Fine, skinflint!

speaker: Alessio
text: Ho there, friend! Are you interested in the sale of the century? This is a coral ring made from only the finest coral fragments. And I am willing to part with it for the low, low price of 30 silver marks.

speaker: Soldier
text: The Rion Shield? No, I ain’t seen it. But I hear that Desaix sold off some of his plunder to Grieth.

speaker: Alm
text: So this is the Zofian Sluice Gate... It’s massive!

speaker: Lukas
text: Indeed it is. And were it to collapse, the damage would be more massive still.

speaker: Alm
text: Then we need to get it open before it’s too late.

speaker: Tatarrah
text: Heh heh... So the Deliverance finally DELIVER themselves to me...

speaker: Alm
text: Are you Tatarrah?

speaker: Tatarrah
text: The one and only. ermit me to introduce my new servant, as well...

speaker: Alm
text: That girl...

speaker: Tatarrah
text: Go, Delthea! Put the fear of Duma back into these faithless fools. Smite them with your aura!

speaker: Alm
text: Aaah!

speaker: Delthea
text: ENEMIES OF TATARRAH...MUST...DIE.

speaker: Clive
text: Alm, what are you doing? Snap out of it! Strike her down before she ends you!

speaker: Alm
text: No! I promised Luthier I would bring his sister home safe.

speaker: Clive
text: But Alm, you’re going to—

speaker: Alm
text: Everyone, stay clear of Delthea’s magic! And whatever you do, do NOT kill her! That’s an order!

speaker: Luthier
text: Alm! If we eliminate Tatarrah, that should release his hold on my sister. I beg of you—please help her!

speaker: Tatarrah
text: Heh heh heh... You imbeciles think yourselves a match for the mighty Tatarrah? Such a dire misjudgment cannot go uncorrected.

speaker: Tatarrah
text: Wh-what...? Impossible... Father Dumaaa... Aaargh...

speaker: Delthea
text: ...Huh? What am I doing here? LUTHIER! Brother, are you there?!

speaker: Lawson
text: Zofian dullards... I’ll dismantle you limb by limb!

speaker: Lawson
text: So this is the end... Forgive me, sire...

speaker: Gazelle
text: You have taken your last step in this realm. Now prepare to visit the next!

speaker: Gazelle
text: To die at the hands of worthless vermin... How shameful...

speaker: Alm
text: Just imagine how many generations these massive ruins have stood witness to. The dusty air carries more than the scent of broken, rusty iron; it’s like I’m breathing in centuries of history. And yet, I can see the signs of men of ill intent having come and gone with no regard for the place at all.

speaker: Girl
text: Aaah! Oh, it was so awful!

speaker: Rudolf
text: Back so soon, Berkut?

speaker: Berkut
text: Sire, I was merely—

speaker: Rudolf
text: Are the tales true? You challenged the Deliverance for sport and lost?

speaker: Berkut
text: ...Forgive me, Uncle. They proved to be more skilled than I first imagined.

speaker: Rudolf
text: Hmm...

speaker: Jedah
text: What a most distressing turn of events. Our own Lord Berkut, broken by a band of farmers and cowhands. Did you mean to drag your knights’ honor through the dung whilst playing?

speaker: Berkut
text: Hold your tongue! You are a servant to our house, and you dare insult Rigel’s finest? It’s far more sensible for clods such as you to stay cowering in your robes.

speaker: Jedah
text: You forget that we answer to none but Duma, father of all Rigel. Though I may be a servant, it is certainly not to you. We shall see who cowers in the end.

speaker: Berkut
text: What are you implying?

speaker: Jedah
text: Emperor Rudolf, allow me to put your heart at ease. It is true that the Deliverance is nearing the sluice gate at our border. However, it is guarded by Tatarrah, one of the Duma Faithful’s finest arcanists. And as I understand it, he has come across a most interesting toy. I have the utmost faith he will make short work of those rebels.

speaker: Berkut
text: ...Sire!

speaker: Rudolf
text: What now, Berkut?

speaker: Berkut
text: Tatarrah may yet fail. Permit me to take my men to the border. If the Deliverance does break past the sluice, they must reckon with me!

speaker: Rudolf
text: Mmm...

speaker: Berkut
text: This time, I will smash their puny rebellion once and for all. I swear it! You must give me one last chance!

speaker: Rudolf
text: ...Very well. If they try to set foot on our land, they are to pay dearly. Am I understood?

speaker: Jedah
text: What silliness. The rebels will be dead long before they reach the border. Heh heh heh...

speaker: Berkut
text: *grumble*

speaker: Berkut
text: Urgh...

speaker: Rinea
text: Berkut, my lord. Have you finished your report to the emperor?

speaker: Berkut
text: Yes. We march for the border.

speaker: Rinea
text: Again? But we only just returned home.

speaker: Berkut
text: It was my choice—I had to beg the emperor for a chance at redemption. All because of that maggot, Alm! Because of him, I had to sit there while that snake Jedah spat venom at me... I will make him pay for this disgrace a hundredfold!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Why, Lord Berkut. What grieves you?

speaker: Berkut
text: Ugh, Nuibaba. Not you...

speaker: Nuibaba
text: These halls have been dark without your unique fire to light them, my lord. I shall treasure this meeting when I return to my post on Fear Mountain. Master Jedah honors me. ...Yet I hear he has not done the same for you. Perhaps because of your...embarrassing loss at the hands of those rebel scum?

speaker: Berkut
text: You Faithful are in dire need of a lesson on how to speak to nobility.

speaker: Nuibaba
text: And I am certain you would be a most fearsome teacher. Regardless, you wrong me, Lord Berkut. I merely wish to aid you.

speaker: Berkut
text: Heh. How could YOU help ME? All of you claw at the heels of your god while ignoring his first teaching. He wished for men to be strong! Not a pack of supplicating fools.

speaker: Nuibaba
text: So you do not need our power? ...I see. Then I pray you fare well in your battle at the border. For should you lose... well, I doubt your uncle would give you a third chance. Or is this the fourth?

speaker: Nuibaba
text: For all your stubborn words, you have some wisdom. You have seen what the Faithful are capable of in battle. I know it. Father Duma’s power is vast, and not to be looked down upon. Yes, it’s true—Marla and Hestia both. In turn, the Father rewarded Lord Jedah with incredible magic.

speaker: Rinea
text: His own daughters? How dreadful!

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Do you see now, Lord Berkut? Come to my abode...

speaker: Berkut
text: ...Never. Victory over Alm would mean nothing if not won by my own hand.

speaker: Nuibaba
text: So prideful! ...Very well. But at least allow me to give you this.

speaker: Berkut
text: What is this? ...A mirror?

speaker: Nuibaba
text: One filled with my sorcery. Of course, I believe you when you say you have no need for such...tricks. But one day you may find yourself cornered and without recourse. If that day comes, shatter the mirror. I don’t need such baubles...

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Are you certain?

speaker: Nuibaba
text: Think of it as a safeguard, if that helps. Something...just in case. Hee hee hee...

speaker: Delthea
text: *gasp* Luthier! Brother!

speaker: Luthier
text: Delthea! Thank heavens you’ve returned to your senses.

speaker: Delthea
text: Hmm? What’s that supposed to mean? Whatever game you’re playing, Lu, I won’t fall for it this time! (pauses) Wait! Tatarrah was CONTROLLING me? Eeeeew! I am SO sorry! I must have been a real handful. But I swear I don’t remember any of it.

speaker: Luthier
text: It’s all right, Delthea. All that matters is that you’re safe and back with us.

speaker: Delthea
text: I’m sorry I worried you, Lu. Good thing the Deliverance came along, huh? Yup! Thanks, Deliverance. So if Lu is sticking with you guys, I get to come too, right? I’m pretty darned tough, you know. I’ll give all your enemies what-for!

speaker: Delthea
text: WHAT?! Aw, come on! Why not? Well, don’t come crawling back to me later. ...Or, you know, do.

speaker: Delthea
text: Aha! I knew it! You need me. ...Say you need me. I wanna hear it!

speaker: Delthea
text: Oh! You’re those folks from before. What’s going on? I can’t remember a thing. ...... Wait, Tatarrah was CONTROLLING me? Eeeeew! I am SO sorry! I must have been a real handful. Well, anyway, my name is Delthea. It’s super nice to meet you! Hey, but you look like you could use my help. Want me to tag along?

speaker: Delthea
text: WHAT?! Aw, come on! Why not? Well, don’t come crawling back to me later. ...Or, you know, do.

speaker: Delthea
text: Aha! I knew it! You need me. ...Say you need me. I wanna hear it!

speaker: Alm
text: Ha ha. Delthea sure isn’t short on energy, is she?

speaker: Luthier
text: I know. She’s simply incorrigible. She was spoiled growing up, and now look at her. She just runs amok! I feel your pain...

speaker: Alm
text: Well, I admire how close you are. I never had anything like that. I’m glad you’re a team again.

speaker: Luthier
text: It’s appreciated, Alm. But there aren’t words enough to thank you proper, so I’ll speak with action. From here on out, sire, I am your most loyal man.

speaker: Alm
text: Yeah, maybe let’s not have any of the whole “sire” thing.

speaker: Luthier
text: Ha ha ha! And why not? You’re our king, aren’t you?

speaker: Alm
text: *sigh* I wish Luthier hadn’t said that...

speaker: Clive
text: Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Hello, Clive.

speaker: Clive
text: I just wanted to say... Fine work there, rescuing the maiden as you did.

speaker: Alm
text: What’s this? Are you maybe, possibly admitting that I did the right thing?

speaker: Clive
text: Heh heh. I am as shocked as you. It appears you are more fit to be king than I will ever be.

speaker: Alm
text: Oh no. Don’t YOU start!

speaker: Clive
text: Unlike you, Alm, I have been too willing to put people’s lives on the line. I stand by my belief that a commander must put reason before emotion. But failing to rescue Mathilda or my sister was cowardice, not reason. The truth is, I chose not to act for fear it would undermine my authority.

speaker: Alm
text: Stop it, Clive. You’re no craven.

speaker: Clive
text: Aren’t I? Just look at what you did in my stead. I criticized you roundly for diverting our army to save one person. But you did it anyway because you have something I do not—strength of heart. You understand what is precious and fight for it no matter the cost. Clive, I don’t know what to say...

speaker: Man
text: Open the sluice gate? Hah! Impossible! We’d flood the bloody continent. Someone has to open the sluice at the Temple of Mila first.

speaker: Man
text: Now that the temple sluice is open, we can open the gate here as well. ...Still, I do find it curious. Only members of the Zofian royal family can open the sluice at the temple.

speaker: Alm
text: Are you serious?

speaker: Man
text: Makes you wonder if Princess Anthiese is alive after all. Hah! It would make for a fine story, that’s for sure! Oh my, yes. Ha ha ha!

speaker: Alm
text: Anthiese... Did a member of the royal family really open the gate? Celica, are you...

speaker: Jedah
text: So, they’ve opened the sluice. This is a fortuitous and most welcome turn of events. That feisty girl is certain to come looking for Mila... and when she does, I shall be waiting to scoop her up! Perhaps I might even go greet her myself... Heh heh heh...

speaker: Mycen
text: Well done, Alm. We’ll end today’s training here. Your swordsmanship has come a long way. I’ve always known you had talent.

speaker: Alm
text: You really think so? You’re not just saying that, are you, Grandfather?

speaker: Mycen
text: Either I’m getting old or you’re getting better—and we both know I’m not old.

speaker: Alm
text: Ha! Well, good. Then that means you’re ready to let me travel outside the village.

speaker: Mycen
text: Hmph. Don’t misconstrue my words, boy. The rule still stands.

speaker: Alm
text: But why?! I’m not a child anymore. You just said I can fend for myself! If I meet with any dangers, I’ll have my sword and my wits.

speaker: Mycen
text: Alm, that’s not what this is about.

speaker: Alm
text: Then what IS it about?

speaker: Mycen
text: Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: Look, I’ve heard from the others. I know the drought’s made Zofia a scary place. People are starving, and many have turned to thievery and plunder. Brigands loot villages for a mere sack of grain, and soon they’ll be at OUR door! And don’t think I haven’t heard what the Rigelian army has been up to. They’ve been crossing the border for years in violation of the Divine Accord. And with that sacred bond broken, now the Terrors have resurfaced as well...

speaker: Mycen
text: ...All true.

speaker: Alm
text: Zofia is full of innocent people who are looking for help. Please, Grandfather. I want to make a difference in a world bigger than a handful of houses. I want to see all the amazing places you’ve told me about— that Celica told me about!

speaker: Mycen
text: Suppose you do set forth with your sword and your wits. So what?

speaker: Mycen
text: Will the grand story of your life be how you met the end of a brigand's axe? Before you dream of changing the world, learn your damned place in it, and no more talk of leaving.

speaker: Alm
text: ...What's his problem?! Why teach me to use a sword if you’re not going to let me fight? Every day in this place is exactly the same as the next. I know I’m meant for more than this! But you have to let me find it!

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? What's all the commotion? It’s coming from the gates. Hmm...

speaker: Lukas
text: Good day. You must be Sir Mycen's grandson. Alm, was it? My name is Lukas. I fight for the Deliverance.

speaker: Alm
text: The "Deliverance"? What's that? Aren't you one of the Knights of Zofia? The king's knights?

speaker: Lukas
text: Oh, I see. I suppose that means word hasn't yet reached your village. In that case, please forgive me for heralding such dark news, but... King Lima IV is dead. He met his end some days ago at the hands of Chancellor Desaix.

speaker: Alm
text: What? You're saying it was regicide?!

speaker: Lukas
text: I fear so. It seems Desaix sold Zofia to the Rigelian Empire along with his soul. No doubt they promised him lands. Perhaps even a title. Upon Lima’s death, the chancellor and the Rigelian army seized Zofia Castle and began to visit unspeakable injustices upon the king’s people. Sir Clive—of the Knights of Zofia you mentioned—would have none of it. He formed an army to free us from Rigel and named it the Deliverance. However, we are outmatched and fast losing this war. We need a hero’s aid. And so I have come to the home of one of Zofia's greatest heroes: Sir Mycen.

speaker: Lukas
text: Do you see, Alm? Sir Clive would not have sent me were it not urgent. Will you take me to see your grandfather?

speaker: Alm
text: Y-yes, of course.

speaker: Gray
text: Good goblets... I knew Zofia was in hot water, but is this guy serious?

speaker: Tobin
text: So there's going to be a war?

speaker: Kliff
text: There already is one, from the sound of things.

speaker: Faye
text: But that’s... that's awful! If Sir Mycen rides off to war, what'll happen to Alm?

speaker: Kliff
text: You got me.

speaker: Lukas
text: *sigh*

speaker: Alm
text: Lukas! Were you able to speak with my grandfather? What did he say?

speaker: Lukas
text: He said no. Sir Mycen made it clear he has no intention of joining the Deliverance.

speaker: Alm
text: What? But he's ridiculously strong! He could defeat some stuffy chancellor with his eyes closed! Why would he refuse when so many people are suffering?

speaker: Lukas
text: I cannot speak to Sir Mycen's thinking, but it seems we misplaced our hopes. I'll have to return to our hideout and bring Sir Clive the ill news. Perhaps Mycen has simply grown too old for the battlefield.

speaker: Lukas
text: It was good meeting you, Alm. I must be on my way. Thank you again for your assistance.

speaker: Alm
text: He's not old... He’s tougher than men half his age!

speaker: Alm
text: Lukas, wait!

speaker: Lukas
text: Alm? What is it?

speaker: Alm
text: I'll go. I'll join the Deliverance.

speaker: Lukas
text: You?

speaker: Tobin
text: Alm, what the hell?! You can't do that! ...Wait, CAN he do that?

speaker: Gray
text: I'll admit, you fight like a beast and they’d be lucky to have your sword, but this isn't sparring with your gramps, Alm. You're volunteering to go to war!

speaker: Alm
text: I know what it is. And if Grandfather won't do it, then I’ll do it for him. Consider my sword as his.

speaker: Lukas
text: Alm, I understand how you feel, but—

speaker: Alm
text: Sir Mycen has been teaching me to use a blade since I was a boy. I've received tutelage in military tactics, medicine, weather, terrain... I know as much about war as any man who has never seen one can. Let me fight for you with my grandfather's gifts. I’ll prove he's no cowardly old man. He’s a warrior who trains warriors.

speaker: Lukas
text: Hmm... That might just work.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? Then you mean...!

speaker: Kliff
text: Oh, come ON! You can’t be serious!

speaker: Lukas
text: Why not? Alm presents a good case. He has a hero's blood in him. ...And clearly a hero's fire. His presence is sure to raise the troops' morale. And for my part, I'm curious to see what a self-proclaimed warrior can do. Especially now that he’ll be doing it for the Deliverance.

speaker: Alm
text: Thank you, Lukas... You won't regret this!

speaker: Gray
text: I've seen a lot of cake-taking in my day, but this REALLY takes the cake!

speaker: Faye
text: Alm, you should back out of this. It's far too dangerous! If anything were to happen to you, I'd... I mean... Just don't do it, okay?!

speaker: Alm
text: I'm sorry, Faye, but I’ve made up my mind. But...maybe all of you could come with me?

speaker: Faye
text: Er, what?

speaker: Kliff
text: Splendid idea. Maybe we could all get impaled on the same lance.

speaker: Alm
text: I'm just saying we could do it together. ...Fighting, I mean. Not the lance. Grandfather trained all of us, right? Not just me. You already know how to use a sword and a bow. So what’s the problem?

speaker: Tobin
text: Alm, are you insane? We were sparring with wooden fences and tree trunks! They don’t hit back!

speaker: Gray
text: Oh, sod it all. I’m not as bright as I’d like to think I am, so, uh...count me in!

speaker: Tobin
text: Gray! Not you too?!

speaker: Gray
text: Me too, Tobi-poo. It’s better than waiting for Rigel to reach Ram and kill "slash" enslave us. Might as well bring the fight to them.

speaker: Tobin
text: But you’re gonna— I mean, once they— [in frustration] ...Ugggh!

speaker: Lukas
text: You have my thanks, Gray. And the Deliverance welcomes you. In the end, we need every able fighter we can get. There will be much to learn, but I can teach you a great deal in battle. And you’ll be given a proper wage, of course.

speaker: Tobin
text: Wait. You mean we get paid? As in, actual money?

speaker: Lukas
text: Of course. Our soldiers work hard and sacrifice much. We would be remiss not to offer compensation.

speaker: Tobin
text: I've got little brothers and sisters who could use that gold... Ma and Pa struggle to make ends meet, but if there’s a way to help... Hmm...

speaker: Alm
text: Tobin, you don't have to go if you don’t want to. Why don't you all take a little time to think about it? Let's split up for now and meet back here later. I need to go thank my grandfather and say good-bye.

speaker: Alm
text: Grandfather, I'm home! Do you have a minute? There's something I need to speak with you about... [noticing that nobody is responding] ...Grandfather? Hmm, where is he? Grandfather...? Grandfather!

speaker: Tobin
text: ...Ah! There he is. Alm, over here!

speaker: Alm
text: Tobin! Does this mean you’re coming with us?

speaker: Tobin
text: Sure am! I could tell Ma and Pa were worried, but I think they'll understand. Listen, everyone, try not to be amazed when I show Alm up on the battlefield.

speaker: Gray
text: You know they don't pay extra for that, right, moneybags?

speaker: Lukas
text: There’s nothing wrong with fighting for coin. Many people do. We don't have any rule stating one's reasons must be noble. Now then, Alm. Were you able to say good-bye to your grandfather?

speaker: Alm
text: I tried, but...I couldn’t find him.

speaker: Lukas
text: Well, that IS vexing. I suppose we could tarry here a bit longer if you—

speaker: Alm
text: It's all right. Let’s go.

speaker: Lukas
text: Oh? Are you certain?

speaker: Alm
text: I can write him a letter. Come on, we can’t wait forever.

speaker: Lukas
text: So be it. I’ll defer to your judgment.

speaker: Tobin
text: Alm, are you sure about this?

speaker: Alm
text: Am I sure about what?

speaker: Tobin
text: Not saying good-bye to your grandfather. My ma and pa have all my brothers and sisters to look after them. I mean, sure, they’ll miss me— or I hope they will, at any rate— but family will help them get by, you know? But all Sir Mycen has for kin is you, and all you have is him.

speaker: Alm
text: I know. But considering he's never let me take one step outside the village, I doubt I could have talked him into letting me join an army. Not that it would have changed things either way—I HAVE to go. Not just to prove him as a teacher, but to prove myself to me.

speaker: Gray
text: Well, you've always wanted to put Ram behind you, right? This is your big chance! Your first adventure writ large! We'll call it Alm's Epoch! Or maybe... The Tale of Gray! ...Plus That One Guy.

speaker: Alm
text: Heh. I don't think so. Although I admit there might be a little something to what you’re saying. It’s almost as if I feel someone calling out to me.

speaker: Gray
text: ...So you really have gone crazy then. Welp, it’s been nice knowin' ya!

speaker: Alm
text: Heh. Look, I know how it sounds. But it’s the truth.

speaker: Tobin
text: Do you think it's Celica?

speaker: Alm
text: What? Celica? Where the heck did THAT come from?

speaker: Tobin
text: Oh, please. You two were inseparable while she was here. You barely made any time for us!

speaker: Alm
text: I guess that’s true...

speaker: Alm
text: Maybe it is her. Celica, are you the one who’s been calling me? I know that you’re out there... I just don’t know where. But I can feel it. I hope this journey will bring us together again...

speaker: Lukas
text: First, we should make for the Southern Outpost. Desaix's men hold it for now, but my fellow in the Deliverance have been fighting to reclaim it. The Deliverance hideout lies beyond the outpost. We'd best prepare ourselves for a long journey.

speaker: Woman
text: Well, if it isn't Alm! You all finished with today's training? I still remember when you were only THIS tall, and now look at you. Sir Mycen has certainly made a strong young man out of you. I say "Sir" Mycen, but the story is your grandfather was once a famous general. General Mycen! Ha! I always wondered why such a fellow would end up here. Then again, the woods around Ram have become dangerous as of late. Perhaps it's for the best that we have him—and YOU—to keep us safe!

speaker: Young Woman
text: *sigh* What I wouldn't give for some food. It’s been years since we’ve had a proper harvest. Can’t grow much without rain... Why has Mila forsaken us? What’s happened to the Earth Mother? She's killing us by withholding her blessings. The Rigelian Empire will seize our lands and we’ll be too weak to resist... You've heard how well trained their soldiers are, haven’t you? We’ve never toiled or fought for a thing, and we’re about to pay for it...

speaker: Young Man
text: It's good to know our plight has the nobility so grief-stricken. King Lima dances at the end of Chancellor Desaix's puppet strings. The king would rather eat grapes and frolic in a seraglio than actually rule. It's no wonder the kingdom’s being torn apart by rebellion after rebellion. I wish someone would come along and save us from ourselves already. ...What's that? The Mother Mila? Pah! Like I'd waste my prayers on a goddess as useless as her.

speaker: Tobin
text: Alm! Hey. This fellow's here to see Sir Mycen. He was just about to tell us more.

speaker: Gray
text: Sorry, pal, but I still can’t trust a man in full armor. Keep one hand on your hilt while you talk to this guy, yeah?

speaker: Tobin
text: A knight—can you believe it? What's he doing in OUR village? You'd have to practically ride off the edge of the map to find this place!

speaker: Kliff
text: He's sure come a long way just to find a whole lot of nothing... Whatever he’s here for, I hope he hasn't brought any trouble with him.

speaker: Faye
text: Alm! How was sword practice? Everything go okay? Sir Mycen is far too hard on you... I hope you don't have any new bruises!

speaker: Lukas
text: Take all the time you need, Alm. You should pay your respects to Sir Mycen.

speaker: Young Man
text: I heard what the knight said, but it sounds like a load of horse plop to me. Everyone knows it’s Zofia's fault that Rigel invaded in the first place. King Lima refused to help the Rigelian Empire during their famine, remember? And we all know the emperor didn't take too kindly to THAT little slight. Such a shame. The kingdom and the empire had been getting along so well. The king may be dead, but his choices live on. Ain't that always the way of it?

speaker: Woman
text: My word. Can you believe it? The king—murdered! What do you suppose happens now? He has no heirs, you know. Not anymore, I mean. They say Chancellor Desaix himself murdered all of ’em in cold blood! Anyway, hope this "Deliverance" knows who they’ll be delivering to that throne.

speaker: Man
text: Alm, is it true you're leaving the village? You’ll be sorely missed. Just be careful, hear? The woods outside Ram are dangerous enough... but once you’re through them, you’ll hit Fleecer’s Forest. The place is crawling with brigands. No one gets through that wood alive...

speaker: Greedy Old Man
text: Ram Village used to be known across the kingdom for its magnificent wine, but alas, it's been ages since anyone made a new batch. Valentia's fanciest nobles would send orders for Ram wine from far and wide. If there are any bottles left, they’re like to be aged to perfection by now. A wine that mature would taste absolutely incredible! I'd give anything for one more glass before Mother Mila calls me home...

speaker: Greedy Old Man
text: What I wouldn’t give for a bottle— no, even just a GLASS of Ram wine!

speaker: Greedy Old Man
text: This aroma! Berry... Leather... Straw...This is Ram wine for true! Thank you. You’ve made an old man very happy this day, so you have. ...Here. I was saving this to go with the wine, but I want you to have it.

speaker: Greedy Old Man
text: Oh, the callow rudeness of youth! You whippersnappers have no manners!

speaker: Greedy Old Man
text: As a little thank-you, let me share some news I heard. If you follow the left-hand wall in the Thieves' Shrine, you'll find a tunnel. Hidden back there is a treasure chest— but also check the jars around it! One of them contains a secret bauble I hid there when I was young. If it’s still there and you can find it, it’s all yours.

speaker: Greedy Old Man
text: Thank you again for bringing me that Ram wine.

speaker: Indignant Woman
text: I was ACCOSTED on the way back from the capital the other day! I ran from those brigands until my sides were ready to split. So undignified! And while I'm happy to be alive, those thugs stole everything I bought. Oh, I never should have gone at all! You MUST go teach those ruffians some manners. I’ll make it worth your while! They should really feel it, so make sure to give 20 of them a sound thrashing! That will teach them to mess with the likes of me. Hmph! They’re holed up in the awful Thieves' Shrine. As if they'd be anywhere else!

speaker: Indignant Woman
text: Get going already! Those 20 brigands aren't going to thrash themselves!

speaker: Indignant Woman
text: Ooo! You look like someone who has just made 20 brigands' lives miserable. I feel so much better already. Who knew revenge was so great?! Well, I told you I would make it worth your while, so here you go.

speaker: Indignant Woman
text: I hope I can call on you again if MORE brigands decide to mug me.

speaker: Kliff
text: You know, I guess I don't mind going along. The Deliverance is fighting all across Zofia, right? Well, I've always wanted to see the world, and now's my chance. ...All I have to do is not get killed. Easy, right?

speaker: Kliff
text: Fine. Have it your way. Not like I was itching to leave anyway.

speaker: Kliff
text: Huh? Now you want me to come with you after all? Make up your mind!

speaker: Faye
text: I'm coming too! I’m staying with you no matter what! End! Of! Discussion!

speaker: Faye
text: You... don’t want me? Oh. I... I see. Then I guess I'll stay here and just be... sad... forever... But you’d better come back safe, you hear me?!

speaker: Faye
text: Oh! Yes? Does this mean I can come with you? Pleeeeeease?

speaker: Brigand
text: Oy, travelers! 'Fraid I'm gonna have to ask ya to stop right there. These here woods belong to me and my boys, see? So if ya wanna be passin' through, yer gonna have to pay the toll. Ha ha!

speaker: Lukas
text: Well. That didn't take long.

speaker: Alm
text: *gasps* Brigands already? But it's only been minutes—we're still within sight of the gates!

speaker: Lukas
text: Worse surprises than this await us, Alm. Is everyone ready?

speaker: Alm
text: Yes. Come on, let's clear this rabble out!

speaker: Alm
text: Follow me. I'll clear us a path!

speaker: Lukas
text: Alm, if I may? You mustn't rush headlong into battles on your own. Without experience, your friends will never grow into accomplished fighters. Trust them. Give them something to do. ...At least let them deal the final blow.

speaker: Alm
text: Right. That's good advice. I'll give it a try!

speaker: Alm
text: Yes! We won!

speaker: Lukas
text: That was some fine swordsmanship, Alm. I can see you have more than a bit of your grandfather in you.

speaker: Alm
text: You think so?

speaker: Lukas
text: Hm? Hold, everyone.

speaker: Alm
text: What is it, Lukas?

speaker: Brigand
text: Hrrm...

speaker: Alm
text: More brigands? It seems the rumors were no exaggeration.

speaker: Lukas
text: Based on their numbers, I surmise they must have a hideout nearby. But we can ill afford to pick fights with every cutpurse and rogue we encounter. Let's sit back and lay low until they depart.

speaker: Brigand
text: Didja get a look at the wench we nabbed this morning? Hoo-ee!

speaker: Brigand #2
text: She'll certainly add some color to that run-down old shrine! Gar har har!

speaker: Brigand
text: Gar har har! She's prettier'n the boss, that's for sure!

speaker: Alm
text: What? They've taken a prisoner?!

speaker: Lukas
text: Alm? Let's just be calm and... Alm?! Alm, wait, don't—

speaker: Alm
text: Hold it, you lecherous pigs!

speaker: Brigand #2
text: Huh? Who the hell are you?

speaker: Alm
text: Release the woman you're holding at once, or else!

speaker: Brigand
text: Bwa ha ha! Or else WHAT?

speaker: Brigand #2
text: Ya must really want a knife in the belly if yer slingin' taunts at the likes of us.

speaker: Lukas
text: So much for laying low... To arms, everyone!

speaker: Lukas
text: Look over there. They have an archer. He can strike from a distance, so we must plan our approach carefully. Whoever goes after him needs to finish him quickly, or be ready for a reprisal. If you're not strong enough to take an arrow or two, stay well away.

speaker: Lukas
text: *sigh* Well, I suppose that counts as our good deed for the day.

speaker: Alm
text: Sorry, Lukas. My legs were moving before I had the chance to even think.

speaker: Lukas
text: Valor is nothing to be sorry for. Now come. Let's find this prisoner they spoke of. They mentioned a shrine, yes? It must be nearby.

speaker: Alm
text: What's that shrine?

speaker: Gray
text: Oh yeah, guess you wouldn't know since you've been stuck in the village. Shrines like this were built by folks so they had a place to worship Mila, but famine and other problems kinda put a damper on most Zofians' piety. Now they're mostly just home to brigands and the like.

speaker: Alm
text: Then the woman who was taken captive must be inside...

speaker: Brigand
text: Eek! Stay away from me! I'm only the stupid watchman! I just WATCH things! Eeeek!

speaker: Alm
text: The enemy could be anywhere. We need to proceed carefully.

speaker: Alm
text: The dank smell of mold permeates the shrine.

speaker: Brigand Boss
text: Huh? What do you scrawny little rats want? You got nerve bargin' in here just as I was gettin' to the main event. Kill 'em, boys! ...And be creative about it.

speaker: Brigand Boss
text: Urgh. Who do you think you are? Saving one wench won't make this world any less of a pit!

speaker: Brigand Boss
text: Argh! Damn...you...

speaker: Alm
text: Miss, are you all right? Say something!
Nnngh... Wh-who are you? How did I get here?

speaker: Alm
text: You're in a shrine. Some brigands kidnapped you and took you here. Don't worry, they're gone. We dealt with them before they could do you any harm.
I see. Thank you, sir. After those ruffians seized me, I passed out... Ugh... I don't want to think about it.

speaker: Alm
text: What's your name?

speaker: Silque
text: I am Silque. I hail from a priory far to the east, on the island of Novis.

speaker: Gray
text: So, uh, Silque... What brings a woman of the cloth like you so far from home?

speaker: Silque
text: *gasp* My mission! I nearly forgot! I must find a man named Sir Mycen. Are we far from Ram Village?

speaker: Alm
text: Are you serious? Ram's our home! Sir Mycen is my grandfather.

speaker: Silque
text: What? You're Sir Mycen's...grandson? ......! May I see that mark on your left hand?

speaker: Alm
text: What, this? Sure. Pretty strange for a birthmark, huh? And that's not even the weirdest part. A long time ago, a girl in my village had the same mark on her hand.

speaker: Silque
text: So you're the one sh—

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? What is it, Silque?

speaker: Silque
text: Sir Alm, I have something for you. Here. Please, take this.

speaker: Alm
text: All right, but...what is it?

speaker: Silque
text: It's called Mila's Turnwheel. It's a relic that contains some of the Earth Mother's power. I believe it will be of great use to you.

speaker: Alm
text: Are you sure? You were supposed to give this to my grandfather, right?

speaker: Silque
text: No. This is definitely for you. Now that you have left your village and embarked upon an auspicious journey, the Turnwheel will become a vital tool during the trials ahead.

speaker: Alm
text: Okay... Well, thank you. I promise to take good care of it. By the way, how do you use it?

speaker: Silque
text: You don't use it. It uses you. When the time is right, the Turnwheel will give you a sign.

speaker: Alm
text: O...kay? I'm not sure I understand, but I'll take your wor—

speaker: Silque
text: Ah! It appears that Mother Mila already wishes to show you something.

speaker: Alm
text: The Turnwheel... It's glowing... What's happening?!

speaker: Alm
text: Where am I...? That's Zofia Castle! This is our kingdom? What happened here? Is the Deliverance too late?!

speaker: Alm
text: AAAAAH!

speaker: Silque
text: Sir Alm, what did you see?

speaker: Alm
text: It was... It was so clear! Silque, it was horrible!

speaker: Silque
text: Be calm. What you saw in the vision is not the present. The Mother is either telling you what could be...or what once was. Her power is sight.

speaker: Alm
text: So the vision is something that's going to happen?

speaker: Silque
text: Something that COULD happen. If the vision was ill-boding, perhaps it was a sign—a sign that the Mother wishes for you to take action in order to prevent it.

speaker: Alm
text: ...... (distressed breathing)

speaker: Silque
text: Ah, Sir Alm. In my travels, I have witnessed the sorry state of our kingdom. With no goddess to bless them and no king to rule, most Zofians are at a loss. And I, for one, refuse to stand by and watch them suffer. I would ask for permission to accompany you on your quest.

speaker: Silque
text: Very well. That was not the answer I was hoping for, but I shall respect your decision.

speaker: Silque
text: Yes? Do you require my assistance?

speaker: Mila'S Servant
text: Welcome, child of fate. I am a servant of Mila. Present to me those who are worthy. By my master's will shall I bestow upon them new power.

speaker: Lukas
text: Hmm? Alm. Look up there.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? That uniform...!

speaker: Alm
text: That looks like a Zofian soldier. Is he one of Desaix's men?

speaker: Lukas
text: Yes. We'll see more of them, now that we're nearing the Southern Outpost. It seems Desaix's men have hired brigands to hold the valley for them. This will be a tricky fight.

speaker: Alm
text: ...I'm ready.

speaker: Lukas
text: Take a closer look at that soldier. He's armed with a leather shield. It'll be difficult to land blows on him. We could take the shield for ourselves... IF we manage to defeat him.

speaker: Alm
text: The valley's clear... Still, that wasn't easy.

speaker: Lukas
text: You have my thanks. We'll soon reach the Southern Outpost, which is under Deliverance control. Once we've rejoined our comrades, the fights ahead will become easier.

speaker: Alm
text: Comrades, huh? I wonder what they're like? I'm excited to meet them!

speaker: Ally Soldier
text: Ngh... S-Sir Lukas? It's good to see you made it back safely.

speaker: Lukas
text: I recognize you. You were stationed at the outpost. Has something happened? Why are you here?

speaker: Ally Soldier
text: Forgive us, Sir Lukas, but... The tides turned after you left, and we were forced to abandon the outpost. I'm afraid Lady Clair was taken captive. Desaix's men hold her there even now.

speaker: Lukas
text: What? Clair! Gods, how could this happen?!

speaker: Alm
text: Lukas...

speaker: Lukas
text: This is my fault. Lady Clair is new to military command. I should have left her in more experienced hands.

speaker: Alm
text: Don't blame yourself, Lukas. Sir Clive sent you to Ram Village, right? You didn't have a choice. If blame lies with anyone, it's him.

speaker: Alm
text: Regardless, standing here accomplishes nothing. We need a plan. I assume this Clair person is still alive, right? In that case, we just have to take back the Southern Outpost and save her!

speaker: Tobin
text: Oh hey, that's a great id— Wait, WHAT?! No! How are WE supposed to reclaim a fortress from trained royal soldiers?!

speaker: Alm
text: I don't know, but we have to find a way. Otherwise, our journey is already over. Here and now, we make our decision. Will we live our lives as simple villagers? ...Or will we fight on as soldiers of the Deliverance?!

speaker: Tobin
text: But Alm...

speaker: Gray
text: Okay, good speech! Hear, hear. ...What've we got to lose? Let's do it.

speaker: Tobin
text: Gray!

speaker: Gray
text: Tobin! ...Listen, just stop and think about this. I know it's hard, but try. Clair is a GIRL. And if we save a GIRL... Eh? You follow?

speaker: Tobin
text: I can't believe you're the same man who mocks the fact that I fight for gold.

speaker: Gray
text: Yes, because it's gold. This is GIRLS. Don't you like girls?

speaker: Tobin
text: I mean, I admit they're...not bad?

speaker: Gray
text: You see? We speak the same language. So you're in, right?

speaker: Lukas
text: I don't know what to say... except "thank you." You're very brave to do this. The Deliverance is lucky to have you.

speaker: Alm
text: Same goes for you, Lukas.

speaker: Lukas
text: One thing, Alm... You may be right that some of the blame lies with Sir Clive... But please, tread soft with him regardless. Lady Clair is his younger sister. I'm sure no one's head is hanging lower than his own right now.

speaker: Alm
text: Oh. Lukas, I... I'm sorry. You're right.

speaker: Enemy Soldier
text: Who goes there? ...More rebels? Ha! Haven't you dogs learned your lesson yet?

speaker: Alm
text: We're not rebels... We're the Deliverance! Everyone! With me!

speaker: Lukas
text: Watch out. That archer is carrying a powerful bow. We should only send in capable—and cautious—units to deal with him.

speaker: Alm
text: We did it! The outpost is ours!

speaker: Lukas
text: Thank you, my brave friends. Thank you for everything. I know that my fallen comrades would say the same.

speaker: Alm
text: Oh, Lukas. I'm so sorry. But we'll have time to mourn later. Right now, we must find Lady Clair. She must be somewhere inside the outpost.

speaker: Lukas
text: Clair!

speaker: Clair
text: Lukas! You came to rescue me! Why, how simply gallant of you... Now extricate me from this filthy and unseemly cage at once!

speaker: Clair
text: You simply must remove me from this rat-infested hellhole at once!

speaker: Alm
text: That should do it!

speaker: Clair
text: You there! The boy will offer a lady his hand.

speaker: Alm
text: Who, me? ...Oh, uh, sorry.

speaker: Clair
text: Very good. I say, it DOES feel good to move about again. I thought I might never emerge from that disgusting pigsty. You have my thanks, er...

speaker: Lukas
text: This is Alm. He recently joined us in the Deliverance.

speaker: Clair
text: Oh! Well, how simply lovely. Welcome! I am Clair. They young man may address me as "Lady Clair," or "milady."

speaker: Alm
text: Um... It's a pleasure to meet you, milady.

speaker: Clair
text: So! From where do you hail, Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Uh...I "hail" from a little place called Ram Village.

speaker: Clair
text: A village? You don't say! That's one of those places with all the cows and the barns and the fields, yes?

speaker: Alm
text: Um...yeah. Something like that.

speaker: Clair
text: My word! I hardly ever speak with villagers! What is it like to chase cows every day? I wager they bite, the nasty creatures. Hmm... And yet, you aren't smothered in manure. This is not what I pictured.

speaker: Alm
text: Right. Um...

speaker: Lukas
text: Clair, perhaps you should consider Alm's feelings in regards to his home.

speaker: Clair
text: His... Huh? Oh dear, have I done it again? It's as Clive constantly reminds me: "The Deliverance is not like the Knights of Zofia. Not every soldier in our ranks is noble, but we must treat them all as equals." The peasant must forgive his lady for this gauche breach of etiquette.

speaker: Alm
text: It's all right. The peasant—whose name is Alm—will get over it.

speaker: Clair
text: Oh, Alm! I can see you are truly kind. Might I ask you more about your village later? I'm ever so curious!

speaker: Alm
text: Of course.

speaker: Clair
text: Splendid! I've always wanted to know more about cows and pigs and such.

speaker: Alm
text: Yes, they're...they're amazing creatures...

speaker: Tobin
text: Woof! She's going to be a handful.

speaker: Gray
text: Yeah, I uh... *cough* That's what I'm hoping.

speaker: Tobin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Gray
text: Hey, what are you schemin'?

speaker: Tobin
text: Wh-what? Nothing!

speaker: Gray
text: Uh-huh...

speaker: Ally Soldier
text: Thank you for freeing us. I thought my time had come. You're new to the Deliverance, right? Then you'll want to hear this. They say Mother Mila has disappeared from her temple. That's why Rigel was able to break the Divine Accord, which was supposed to prevent them from ever invading Zofia. I don't know how much of it's true, but it's disturbing nonetheless.

speaker: Fernand
text: Clair! You're safe!

speaker: Clair
text: Oh! Good day, Fernand. And what brings you here?

speaker: Fernand
text: Need you even ask? When I heard you had been taken prisoner, I mounted my finest destrier and sped here at once. Sir Clive couldn't leave the hideout without its commander, of course. But I see I am a step behind regardless. Who is this rabble?

speaker: Alm
text: Um, are you talking about us?

speaker: Clair
text: They are not "rabble," Fernand. This boy is Alm. He is the grandson of Sir Mycen himself.

speaker: Fernand
text: Mycen's...grandson? Lukas, I demand to know the meaning of this! You were ordered to find the general himself, not some mewling child!

speaker: Lukas
text: Sadly, Sir Mycen was not so easily convinced. However, Alm and his friends have joined our cause in his stead.

speaker: Fernand
text: Is this some manner of folly to you, Lukas? Am I to be amused? Such baseborn curs cannot possibly aid our cause. The Deliverance has no place for brats with pitchforks.

speaker: Lukas
text: Fernand, you must listen to reason. These "curs" you so easily disparage fought valiantly for us. In fact, without Alm, we might not have retaken the Southern Outpost. I can vouch for their strength.

speaker: Fernand
text: Hah! As if the word of a backwater noble carries weight with me. Your entire house should be kissing the Knights of Zofia's feet!

speaker: Lukas
text: Ngh...

speaker: Alm
text: I think that's enough. You can say whatever nasty things about me you like. I'll get over it. But Lukas deserves your respect.

speaker: Fernand
text: I beg your pardon? Do I look like a man who listens to the opinions of peasants?

speaker: Clair
text: Then you can listen to me, because I happen to agree with him. Fernand, my brother already explained this to you, did he not?

speaker: Fernand
text: Sir Clive? What exactly did he explain?

speaker: Clair
text: A soldier's worth is not determined by the station of his birth. If we do not all fight together as one, then we will never defeat Desaix. Those are wise words. Unforgettable words! Desaix's forces already have us at hell, yet you would splinter us further?

speaker: Fernand
text: Rrr... You there! Boy!

speaker: Alm
text: ...That's me, I take it?

speaker: Fernand
text: Out of respect for Sir Clive, I will permit you to join the Deliverance. But you WILL learn your place! Now, Clair. Seeing as you are safe, you have no need for these people. Come, let us return. We must report this matter to Sir Clive at once.

speaker: Clair
text: I will do no such thing! I'm going with Alm.

speaker: Fernand
text: ...Very well. Do as you please.

speaker: Tobin
text: ...Wow, what a jerk! I've never met someone so rude!

speaker: Gray
text: I guess we've been spoiled by Lukas. He'd nearly convinced me that swinish knights are the exception, not the rule. But...that was a swine, all right. *snort* (pig noises)

speaker: Clair
text: You poor dears must be so upset. I apologize for the way he treated you.

speaker: Gray
text: Don't be silly. You don't have to lower yourself for a miserable human being like that.

speaker: Clair
text: Oh my...

speaker: Tobin
text: Oh, great. Here we go...

speaker: Gray
text: What? I have no idea what you're talkin' about.

speaker: Clair
text: Well, regardless...please don't think ill of Fernand. He wasn't always like this. The world...changed him.

speaker: Gray
text: Did...something happen to him?

speaker: Lukas
text: We live in trying times. And some things that transpire are... difficult to put into words. In any case, we should be on our way.

speaker: Lukas
text: Well fought, everyone. The Deliverance's hideout is just a stone's throw away now. I'll send a messenger ahead to inform Sir Clive of our arrival. Let us make haste. I'm sure he'll be quite eager to meet you.

speaker: Clair
text: Alm, where are you going? My brother will be most eager to meet you at the hideout. I insist we go!

speaker: Python
text: Not so fast. Where do ya think yer goin'? Don't y'know whose halls these is?

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? But I thought this was the--

speaker: Lukas
text: That's enough, Python. There's no call to play at trickery with our new recruits.

speaker: Python
text: Ha ha ha! Heh, Lukas, you ginger stud. You still draw breath. I was worried Desaix's dogs might have punched your ticket to the boneyard. So this sack of guts here must be Sir Grandson.

speaker: Lukas
text: Yes, he's the one. Is Sir Clive about?

speaker: Python
text: Yup. Better shake your tail feathers-- he's been waiting for you.

speaker: Python
text: Oh hey, kid! I almost forgot.

speaker: Alm
text: Hm? What is it?

speaker: Python
text: Terrors roam these halls. You'd best tread carefully.

speaker: Alm
text: Terrors?! What are monsters like those doing in your hideout?

speaker: Python
text: Well, to be fair, they technically got here first. We're just sort of...borrowing their catacombs. Plus, Terrors spawn in greater numbers the closer you get to Mila's power. Cutting 'em down only makes room for new ones, so we just let 'em be. Why the long face, stud? Don't think you can handle a few creepie-crawlies? 'Cause if not, I dunno how you're planning to fight for the Deliverance. Aw, I'm just japin' ya. Get going, yeah? Oh, and hold your nose--Terrors stink.

speaker: Alm
text: Great... Their hideout is guarded by an army of the dead...

speaker: Python
text: Go on. Sir Clive's in the chamber waaay in the back.

speaker: Alm
text: These sprawling catacombs were built as a resting place for Zofia's most distinguished families. But now their halls are clogged with the stench of the dead--rotten corpses who have risen again as Terrors.

speaker: Clive
text: Clair!

speaker: Clair
text: Brother!

speaker: Clive
text: It gladdens me to see you safe! I couldn't bear to lose you on top of everything else we have sacrificed.

speaker: Clair
text: You look so pale, Clive. Forgive me. You must have been worried sick. But I'm all right. Alm and the others arrived before true ill could befall me.

speaker: Clive
text: And you must be Alm. I've been looking forward to this meeting.

speaker: Alm
text: Y-yes, sir.

speaker: Clive
text: Ha ha ha. Please, be at ease. Such formalities are not required here. You saved the life of my dear sister. This makes you a friend. My name is Clive. And as you must already know, I lead the Deliverance. It's good to meet you, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: L-likewise, Clive.

speaker: Gray
text: I can't believe it. That's THE Clive! In the flesh and everything!

speaker: Tobin
text: What, is he famous or something?

speaker: Gray
text: Tobin! I am sorely disappointed in you. Sir Clive captains the Knights of Zofia! He's the finest knight in all the realm! Seriously, man. Read a book.

speaker: Tobin
text: Okay, okay. He's clearly a big deal. But then why is the "finest knight in all the realm" LOSING the war?

speaker: Gray
text: Well, he's obviously... I mean, he... Shut up, Tobin.

speaker: Lukas
text: How have we been faring, Clive?

speaker: Clive
text: Not well, I fear. We lost many good men when the outpost fell. ...Too many. The morale of our troops has taken an ill turn in kind. I was hoping to present Sir Mycen to them to re-ignite their courage, but...

speaker: Alm
text: Please don't judge my grandfather. I know he had his reasons. Even if I don't know what they are. But I promise you that I'll fight every bit as hard as he would have. ...Or harder! I just don't want you to think that... I mean, he's not--

speaker: Clive
text: Peace, Alm. I understand... None here would dare think your grandfather craven. That being said, I would beg a boon of you. The same one I was hoping to ask of Sir Mycen, in fact.

speaker: Alm
text: Please, go on. If it's within my power, I'll do it.

speaker: Clive
text: Then I shall state it plain. I would like you to become the new leader of the Deliverance.

speaker: Alm
text: WHAAAT?! I mean...um...what? I'm not a leader!

speaker: Fernand
text: Clive! Have you taken leave of your senses?

speaker: Clive
text: This needs to happen, Fernand. You know it as well as I. It's true the Deliverance began as a group of like-minded Zofian Knights, but it's grown into an army where most of our volunteers are of common birth. We share a cause, but little else. I know not how to speak to their hearts. Sir Mycen began as a common soldier before rising to a knight and a count. His story resonates with these people. Do you not agree that his grandson is just the banner they would rally to?

speaker: Fernand
text: What fool would agree with that?! If some ungrateful peasant won't heed your command, you sweep him aside!

speaker: Clive
text: Think, Fernand! Are we so flush with soldiers that we can afford to drive able men away?

speaker: Fernand
text: Ngh...

speaker: Lukas
text: I, for one, think it's a fine idea.

speaker: Fernand
text: You too...?!

speaker: Lukas
