text: Knights don't have a monopoly on skill, and Alm is as able a fighter as any. Clive has done all he can to hold the Deliverance together thus far, but if our ship is astray, then we must chart a new course. Alm is that course.

speaker: Fernand
text: I'll rip that traitorous tongue from your throat!

speaker: Lukas
text: Then you'll finally have the truth in your grasp! I lost friends at the Southern Outpost. Veteran men, yet dead all the same. We MUST adapt so we might end this war as quickly as possible.

speaker: Alm
text: Please, just...hold on a second. I know I said I would do anything in my power, but I can't--

speaker: Clive
text: I understand what you can and cannot do, Alm. My lieutenants and I would continue to handle day-to-day affairs. We only need you to do one thing: lead. You would be inspiring the troops and revitalizing the army. You are Sir Mycen's grandson. I know you to be capable of such.

speaker: Alm
text: I'm not so sure...

speaker: Clair
text: Please, Alm. For me. For all of us. My brother tries to hide it, but I know the anxiety takes its toll on him. You can relieve him of at least a portion of that burden.

speaker: Alm
text: I want to, but... ...... All right. If you think me worthy, then I won't let you down.

speaker: Clive
text: Are you certain? Then thank you, Alm. Thank you.

speaker: Alm
text: Just...please, keep your expectations low.

speaker: Clive
text: Ha! As you wish.

speaker: Clair
text: This could change everything... The boy will make a splendid leader! Simply splendid!

speaker: Lukas
text: Without a doubt.

speaker: Fernand
text: I've heard enough of this idiocy!

speaker: Clive
text: Fernand, what--

speaker: Fernand
text: I only joined this army because YOU were leading it! And now you want me to take orders from some wretched farmchild?

speaker: Clive
text: This is no mere farmchild, Fernand! He has Sir Mycen's blood!

speaker: Fernand
text: Mycen? Pah! Damn him and his blood! They may sing of him as a hero, but no one even knows what wench the man sprang from! His entire story is a disgrace to the Zofian nobility! You need to invoke the name of that old man to control your men? Pathetic.

speaker: Clive
text: Enough!

speaker: Fernand
text: I lost my taste for this long ago. We were supposed to be a band of noble knights. United in purpose! Upholding a tradition! Restoring the old order to Zofia! Now the Deliverance is full of baseborn serfs trying to lord over us. Like your lieutenant Forsyth. Or that Python--true to his name he is!

speaker: Clive
text: Both of them have proven themselves on the battlefield time and again! Are you suggesting I deny my men fair reward for their achievements? What incentive would they have then?! The damned army wouldn't function! Hear me, Fernand. Hear me well. I know you have your reasons for closing your heart to the common folk. But please, for the sake of our ideals, you MUST think beyond them.

speaker: Fernand
text: No, Clive. I will not. I would rather die than kneel to some whelp who was birthed in the hay. Today we part ways for good and all. I am finished with you and your "Deliverance." Farewell.

speaker: Clive
text: Fernand, wait--

speaker: Alm
text: Clive, shouldn't you go after him?

speaker: Clive
text: ...No. I knew this was coming--we've had no shortage of clashes lately. I cannot force him to see things as I do, so... Well, perhaps it's better this way.

speaker: Alm
text: Clive... I know it's not much in the way of comfort, but...I'll do my best.

speaker: Clive
text: Thank you, Alm. We shall march on Zofia Castle just as soon as you feel we are prepared. I suppose you must still have many questions about the Deliverance. Feel free to ask around to any of the soldiers here.

speaker: Ally Soldier 1
text: We've received word that Emperor Rudolf's nephew is visiting Zofia Castle. Not only is the lad a general, but he's also first in line for the Rigelian throne. That's due to the Emperor not having children of his own, you see. Anyway, he's said to be tough as nails. I sure hope I don't have to face him!

speaker: Ally Soldier 2
text: Sir Clive's lover, Lady Mathilda, used to fight by his side in the Knights of Zofia. She was every inch as strong as him, and clever as an old cat, to boot. But Desaix took her captive, and now keeps her locked up in his fortress. He's made many attempts to use her as leverage to force our surrender. But still, Sir Clive refuses to submit. One Desaix will tire of these games, and then she'll be in peril most dire... Knowing this, Sir Clive grows less bold as the days pass. Who can blame him?

speaker: Ally Soldier 3
text: Fernand's hatred for commoners is understandable. The peasants living on his lands were starving 'cause of the drought. They blamed Fernand for not providing for them and stormed his manor. His family died during the attack. ...Truly, a terrible thing.

speaker: Forsyth
text: Greetings, friends. The Deliverance welcomes you. I am Forsyth, Sir Clive's lieutenant and advisor. Together, let us take back the castle and return Zofia to her people.

speaker: Forsyth
text: Sorry? Did you say "no"? Ah. I...I see. Well then...S-so be it. I shall stay here and stand watch over the hideout with honor and...um...

speaker: Forsyth
text: Yes? Have you reconsidered? It would gladden me to join you.

speaker: Python
text: Heading off, are we? Well, take care! Don't let the Terrors bite! ...Eh? Am I coming with you? Well, I COULD...but I don't HAVE to... Howzabout I just let you decide?

speaker: Python
text: Hey, it's your deal, pal. Good luck...'cause you'll need it!

speaker: Python
text: What? Whaaaaaat. If you want me to come, just say so. You're making this so awkward.

speaker: Clive
text: Onward to Zofia Castle. We must wrest the castle from the chancellor's grasp. Lead us well, Alm.

speaker: Alm
text: I'll do my best.

speaker: Desaix
text: Ah hah hah! I wonder who built this throne? It is marvelously comfortable! Why did I let it be wasted on that incompetent fool Lima for so long? Soon, the Rigelian Empire will finish its conquest of Valentia. And then I will rule from this throne as king of Zofia! But first, I must crush those worms in the rebel army. And worms they are... You squash the blasted things into the muck, yet still more take their place! And now they dare march on the castle? They will pay for this insult in blood! I must know what—or who—gave them this second wind...

speaker: Soldier
text: Forgive me, Chancellor Desaix. We’ve captured a rebel in the forest. It’s Lor... It’s Fernand, sir.

speaker: Desaix
text: What?! But Fernand is Clive’s right-hand man. Why would he be wandering the woods without a detachment?

speaker: Soldier
text: March, prisoner!

speaker: Fernand
text: Unhand me! I have cleansed myself of those rebel scum!

speaker: Desaix
text: What’s this? Am I to believe you have left your precious “Deliverance”?

speaker: Fernand
text: Deliverance... Pah!

speaker: Desaix
text: Yes, well. It seems you have a story to tell. My ears are yours, Sir Fernand.

speaker: Desaix
text: ...What? Mycen’s grandson?!

speaker: Fernand
text: Indeed. Clive has thrown all of our ideals at the feet of the unworthy. He’s made the boy a figurehead just to leverage some decrepit hero’s name. Well, I say damn them all! There. You have my story. Now kill me and be done with it.

speaker: Desaix
text: But this doesn’t make sense. Mycen didn’t have any... Ah... Now I see this for what it is. Rudolf, you villainous dastard...

speaker: Fernand
text: Huh?

speaker: Desaix
text: Silence! When I address you, you’ll know it. ...I have decided your fate, Fernand. Killing you would be...wasteful. Come with me. I will introduce you to your new master. A master more...befitting of your ideals.

speaker: Fernand
text: New master? Wait—explain yourself!

speaker: Alm
text: Zofia Castle... We’re finally here.

speaker: Clive
text: Thanks to you, Alm. You should hold your head high as you command us on this great day.

speaker: Alm
text: It will be a great day, won’t it? Fellow soldiers! Fight with me! Today, Zofia’s people reclaim her castle and her pride!

speaker: Berkut
text: So this is the so-called Deliverance. What a disheveled herd of clodhoppers!

speaker: Desaix
text: I couldn’t agree more. Find a comfortable seat, Lord Berkut. The Empire’s finest general need not trouble himself with such rabble. You may watch from on high as my finest troops cut them down like wheat.

speaker: Berkut
text: I may just take you up on that offer. Shall we, Rinea?

speaker: Rinea
text: I have no desire to see such bloodshed. War is horrible, and I will make no spectacle of it.

speaker: Berkut
text: Heh heh. I jest, my dear.

speaker: Desaix
text: Forgive me. I must take my leave.

speaker: Berkut
text: Yes, of course. I trust the dracoshield I lent will add to your already considerable strength?

speaker: Desaix
text: It is a fine gift, my lord. You honor me.

speaker: Berkut
text: *sigh* You. Knight. Fernand, was it?

speaker: Fernand
text: Yes, my lord.

speaker: Berkut
text: You said the name of the Deliverance’s new leader is “Alm,” correct? And that he is of common birth? There is no mistake in this?

speaker: Fernand
text: None, my lord. Clive and the other fools believe he is Mycen’s grandson...

speaker: Berkut
text: Hmph. What nonsense. One is born either noble or common. This destiny cannot be changed. Has a sheep any hope of leading wolves? No!

speaker: Fernand
text: *gasp* Yes! Yes, exactly! Truer words were never spoken, Lord Berkut!

speaker: Berkut
text: Still, I am surprised at Sir Clive. Tales of his exploits have spread as far as Rigel... How could so celebrated a leader make so amateur a mistake? The Deliverance has no future now. All of Zofia will soon belong to the Empire... Rinea!

speaker: Rinea
text: Yes, Lord Berkut?

speaker: Berkut
text: I have a promise to make you, my dear. I will succeed His Majesty Rudolf and become the next emperor. I shall rule over the Valentian continent as I was meant to. And you shall be my empress. Does this please you?

speaker: Rinea
text: I...do not have words...

speaker: Berkut
text: ...It has begun. I pray this Alm fellow makes the battle at least halfway entertaining.

speaker: Desaix
text: Hear me, worms of the rebel army! You have done well to make it this far... but you have no hope of defeating me! ...Now, Slayde! Take the cavalry and run down every last one of those wretches!

speaker: Desaix
text: What’s this? Slayde has been defeated? Damned rebels will rue this day. I must withdraw! The rest of you are ordered to hold the castle at all costs!

speaker: Desaix
text: Rebel scum... You can’t hope to touch me. So long as I have the dracoshield Lord Berkut gave me, I am invincible!

speaker: Desaix
text: Urgh! N-no... W-wait... You have the wrong...

speaker: Slayde
text: I recognize you... You’re those bumpkin brats from the village in Ram Woods.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? ...This is the knight who tried to kidnap Celica!

speaker: Slayde
text: You whelps deprived me of a prize I most desperately needed. Hear me well, runts! My name is Slayde... and today, I in turn shall deprive you of your lives!

speaker: Slayde
text: I- impossible! This is neither the time nor place for me to die...

speaker: Slayde
text: D-don’t think you can gloat yet... You thought you defeated Desaix? Ha! That was just a double. The true chancellor has retreated to his fortress. And now it’s my turn. I’ve no intention of dying here with you maggots!

speaker: Berkut
text: Pathetic. The chancellor is all talk.

speaker: Fernand
text: What shall we do now, my lord?

speaker: Berkut
text: We cannot hold the castle with my detachment alone. We must retreat. Fernand, you stay with me. We’ll join up with our main force in the forest.

speaker: Fernand
text: Yes, my lord!

speaker: Berkut
text: ...You have made an impression, Alm. Yes you have.

speaker: Clive
text: Desaix’s forces are retreating...

speaker: Alm
text: You mean...we won?

speaker: Clive
text: Yes, Alm. We won. Zofia Castle can finally return to the hands of her own people!

speaker: Alm
text: We really did it... We did it! We freed Zofia!

speaker: Clair
text: Hee hee! The boy from Ram shall kiss my hand and thank me for securing this victory. Ha ha ha! A jest only, I assure you. You were wonderful, Alm. This victory proves you have what it takes to lead us.

speaker: Alm
text: This victory wasn’t mine alone. I share this glory with all of you.

speaker: Tobin
text: Sure, but hold on a second before we start throwing roses around. Desaix and Slayde both got away, remember?

speaker: Gray
text: Tobin, you sure know how to take a squat on someone’s big moment. Forget who got away! There’s still plenty of reason to celebrate.

speaker: Lukas
text: Gray is correct. True, it is deeply regrettable those two snakes managed to elude us. But regardless, we have retaken the castle—the symbol of her kingdom. Was this not the Deliverance’s primary goal?

speaker: Clive
text: Indeed, it was. I know this war will continue as long as the empire desires Zofia... but this victory is a sweet chalice, and right now, we should drink deep!

speaker: Alm
text: Clive couldn’t have said it better. We fought for this. We earned it. Now let’s take a moment to enjoy it.

speaker: Clive
text: So then! Shall we go inside? Our friends in the castle will be most eager to meet their deliverer.

speaker: Alm
text: Deliverer?! Come on, you make me sound like some kind of hero or someth— Hey, wait!

speaker: Archer
text: Huzzah for the Deliverance! Thanks to you, the castle is finally rid of those imperial dastards. Oh, what a joy to watch them run... We’re finally free! You have my heartfelt thanks. Truly.

speaker: Man
text: The chancellor retreated to his fortress west of the northern forest. He’ll be beggin’ Rigel for help now, so he will! What a piece of filth, leavin’ his men behind to die in his stead...

speaker: Woman
text: They say all of King Lima’s children are dead now, so they do. Oh, but I’ve heard tale that one of ’em still lives... Her name was Anthiese. PRINCESS Anthiese! Juicy bit’a gossip that, eh? Story goes, the villa she lived in was set to blaze some ten or so years back. Folks thought she burned to cinders, but you know how tongues like to wag. Could be some brave soul up and saved her. Wonder where she ended up if so?

speaker: Young Woman
text: Princess Anthiese had a brother from a different mum, but they were still close. After that fire at the villa, however, neither body was found. I often dream that at least the princess managed to escape somehow...

speaker: Lady Cavalier
text: That mongrel Desaix stole the royal sword when he turned tail and ran. The Rigelian imperial household gave us that sword as a sign of friendship. I don’t know what use Desaix has for it. Oh, it’s a powerful sword, and no lie... but only in the hands of the right wielder. And that wielder isn’t him!

speaker: Soldier
text: The ridersbane here in the vault makes short work of mounted soldiers. But as it’s a lance, only knights and similar classes can wield it.

speaker: Man
text: General Mycen was a magificent man, but King Lima never did like him. Of course, he never liked much of anything besides his wine and women. I wager Desaix looked upon the general as an obstacle of sorts, too, because after he murdered the king’s children, he pinned it on Sir Mycen. You’d have been daft to believe such a thing, of course... which is precisely what the king did. Or perhaps he just saw it as an excuse. Regardless, Mycen was found guilty and banished. He’s lucky he wasn’t hanged.

speaker: Clive
text: Friends, may I have your attention? It’s true we have made great strides by recapturing the castle... but Chancellor Desaix—the man who started all this—remains at large, and the Rigelian Army yet lingers inside our kingdom’s borders. To free Zofia, we must find Desaix, slay him, and drive Rigel back for good. Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: Yes?

speaker: Clive
text: You are our commander now. We would hear your opinion on this.

speaker: Alm
text: Oh, right. My opinion. Um... Well, what are our options?

speaker: Lukas
text: We could be defensive—garrison the castle and wait for Rigel to come to us. Or...we could take the fight to them. The choice is yours.

speaker: Alm
text: I see. ...... You know, until recently, I’d never set foot outside of Ram Village. This war has been my first glimpse of the kingdom I live in. Unfortunately, I’ve also seen what it’s been reduced to. Needless to say, it’s far worse than I’d heard. People are suffering. Even dying. But this war, no matter how terrible, has also taught me something. It taught me that when we stand up and fight...we help those people. I don’t want to stop helping them now. I want to press on and make as much of a difference as I can. I know this probably sounds empty. Maybe even mad. But I think we should keep fighting until we’ve taken back all of Zofia. So then...will you stand with me? Will you stand and fight?

speaker: Lukas
text: Heh...

speaker: Clair
text: What kind of question is that? Of course we will, silly boy!

speaker: Clive
text: Then it seems the matter is settled. The Deliverance shall march! We will put Desaix down and scatter the Rigelian Army to the four winds!

speaker: Tobin
text: Wow... That gave me goosebumps. Not bad, Alm. Not bad.

speaker: Gray
text: Were you even listening to a thing he said? Your goosebump-giver just declared war on the whole damned empire!

speaker: Tobin
text: I know, but I think it was a nice spee— WAIT, HE DID WHAT?! No, no. Come on, this isn’t WAR, Gray. He’s just going to kick them out.

speaker: Gray
text: Riiiight. And then Emperor Rudolf will just send a fruit basket to apologize! C’mon, Tobin. You can’t be so thick that you don’t see what’s coming.

speaker: Tobin
text: Hmm...

speaker: Gray
text: What? Stop staring at me. It’s creepy.

speaker: Tobin
text: You knew it would come to this, didn’t you? When you agreed to join the Deliverance, I mean.

speaker: Gray
text: Oh, come now.

speaker: Tobin
text: You’re the one who said all those years ago that Alm was different from us. You knew he was going to do something like this one day.

speaker: Gray
text: Ha! I’m not a prophet, Tobin. All I meant was that he’s different.

speaker: Tobin
text: Well, you were on to something no matter what you meant. Because now we’re starting to see that he’s much bigger than we are. I’m proud of him, but...I’m also going to miss him.

speaker: Gray
text: Oh, brother. You poor kid, Tobin.

speaker: Old Timer
text: Well, if it isn’t the good men and women of the Deliverance! I was hoping I’d run into you. Please, allow me to welcome you to the castle. I served Zofia’s king for many years, you know. If you need anything, just ask!

speaker: Alm
text: Thank you. That’s very kind. This is my first time here, so I’ll admit to feeling a bit lost. My grandfather, Sir Mycen, spoke of it on occasion, but—

speaker: Old Timer
text: Sir Mycen the Zofian general?

speaker: Alm
text: Er, yes, that’s the one. I’m his grandson, Alm. He lived in this castle long ago, didn’t he?

speaker: Old Timer
text: Well, yes, but...how very odd. I knew the general quite well, and he had neither wife nor child.

speaker: Alm
text: Huh?

speaker: Clive
text: I beg your pardon, good sir, but that simply cannot be the case. Alm is most certainly related to—

speaker: Old Timer
text: No, I assure you, General Mycen told me himself. “I have no family,” he said. Clear as day it was.

speaker: Alm
text: But wait... If I’m not...

speaker: Clive
text: Pay him no mind, Alm. The old man’s probably just confused, is all. It was a long time ago.

speaker: Alm
text: Y-yes... That must be it...

speaker: Cavalier
text: Commander Alm! You’re just in time. Please proceed up these steps. A visitor is waiting for you up on the balcony.

speaker: Alm
text: A visitor? Who is it?

speaker: Cavalier
text: I’m afraid I cannot say. Go on and see for yourself.

speaker: Alm
text: All right, then...

speaker: Cavalier
text: Please proceed up these steps. A visitor is waiting for you up on the balcony.

speaker: Mycen
text: It’s good to see you, boy.

speaker: Alm
text: Grandfather?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Mycen
text: Heh. I have my reasons. Look how far you’ve come, Alm. You’re a man grown now. You’ve been through quite a bit since leaving the village, haven’t you?

speaker: Alm
text: I suppose. But Grandfather... I’m sorry I never said good-bye or thanked you for all you did for me. I still feel guilty about that. But I think I made the right choice. I’m the commander of the Deliverance now. And together, we’ve already liberated the Southern Outpost AND this castle. So you see—

speaker: Mycen
text: I didn’t come here to pick apart your actions, Alm. I came here to ask you a single question: Are you ready?

speaker: Alm
text: Am I...ready?

speaker: Mycen
text: Indeed. For once you march on Rigel, you place yourself in the hands of destiny. You won’t be able to stop the events that unfold. No one will wish you well. Many will even try to stop you; unexpected tragedy is sure to follow. That is the price of what you are about to undertake.

speaker: Mycen
text: So I ask again: Are you ready to take the lives of others into your hands? Are you ready to shoulder all of their burdens? Their desires? And are you ready to fight and bleed until Zofia and all of Valentia is saved?

speaker: Alm
text: I am. I know I may be in over my head, and I still have much to learn. But when I say I will fight for my kingdom, I will fight for my kingdom. No one will stop me. Nothing will break me. I’ll see it through to the very end.

speaker: Mycen
text: ...Very well. I’ve seen that look before. Must run in the blood...

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? What do you mean?

speaker: Mycen
text: You’ll understand in time, boy.

speaker: Alm
text: Say, that reminds me... This old man downstairs was saying some strange things. He told me—

speaker: Alm
text: Huh? What’s that noise?

speaker: Mycen
text: Well, well... The people have gathered to get a look at their new hero. You should go greet them.

speaker: Alm
text: Whoa...

speaker: Mycen
text: Burn this memory into your heart, boy. These are the people whose burdens you will carry the rest of the way. Remember what lies upon your shoulders.

speaker: Soldier
text: I bear ill tidings, Emperor. The rebel army has taken back Zofia Castle!

speaker: Rudolf
text: ...... And what of Berkut?

speaker: Soldier
text: Sire, Lord Berkut withdrew and rejoined with the main force.

speaker: Jedah
text: Pathetic... Pathetic! A Rigelian Knight, the emperor’s sworn defender, scurrying away like a rat? My arcanists would never have painted so sorry a picture...

speaker: Massena
text: Hold your tongue, Master Jedah.

speaker: Jedah
text: Why should I? I merely speak the truth.

speaker: Rudolf
text: You said the leader of this “Deliverance” is named Alm, correct?

speaker: Soldier
text: Yes, Emperor. He assumed command after Sir Clive of the Knights of Zofia stepped down.

speaker: Rudolf
text: Did he now...

speaker: Alm
text: Rudolf! DIEEE!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm!

speaker: Alm
text: You took...everything!  Everything that I ever loved! You took Zofia! You took my friends! And now...Celica too!

speaker: Celica
text: Please, stop! What’s going on? Can’t you see me?! Stop this! I’m begging you, please!

speaker: Celica
text: NOOOOOOOOO!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm...

speaker: Boey
text: Hey, why are they clanging that infernal bell?

speaker: Mae
text: Apparently, the king’s passed away... That’s what Nomah said, at least.

speaker: Boey
text: The king? But isn't that... He was Celica's...

speaker: Genny
text: Oh dear. I hope she's dealing with this okay...

speaker: Nomah
text: You're certain I can't dissuade you from going, little one?

speaker: Celica
text: I must, Nomah. It’s been years since crops last grew on Zofian soil. Our barren fields have fallen victim to Terrors, the Rigelians have invaded... I fear some ill must have befallen the Earth Mother, Mila. I can’t help but feel this is all related. I know it.

speaker: Nomah
text: Hmm... Perhaps it is, at that. I’ll not deny that the kingdom of Zofia faces her darkest hour in some time. More sick and hungry come to the priory’s door each day seeking aid...

speaker: Celica
text: The key to everything lies with Mila. I shall travel to her temple and learn what’s become of her.

speaker: Nomah
text: Yes, but little one... You know well the reason Mycen placed you in my care. With the king's passing, you are the last living member of the Zofian royal line. There are many who would seek to use you. Or even end you. That threat is greater now than ever. Yet you would still leave, knowing that?

speaker: Celica
text: I must. Even if my decision betrays the care you and Mycen have shown me. You’ve done so much to keep me safe, and it breaks my heart to pain you. But what calls me to do this goes beyond my heart. I can only ask your forgiveness, Nomah.

speaker: Nomah
text: Keep your cries of forgiveness, little one. I’ll not give what isn’t required. If this is your mind, I won’t object. Follow the path before you. Trust in it as I in you.

speaker: Celica
text: Thank you, Nomah.

speaker: Nomah
text: Heh. Of course. But you must take care—the blight in Zofia is worse even than you know. You’ve uncommon talent as a warrior priestess, but carelessness is fatal. Ah, and you mustn’t forget Mila's Turnwheel.

speaker: Celica
text: I wear it always. You know that.

speaker: Nomah
text: See that you do. I’m certain it will prove helpful on your journey.

speaker: Celica
text: Thank you, Nomah. For everything. Well then, I think I’ll be on my way.

speaker: Nomah
text: Mm? You’re leaving this very instant? Surely you can stay until the bell’s last peal? It rings to mourn your father’s passing, as you know.

speaker: Celica
text: I’ll never think of that man as my father. Now if you’ll excuse me....

speaker: Nomah
text: Little one...

speaker: Cleric
text: Lately, Novis sees boat after boat filled stern to bow with hungry refugees. But alas for them, this island’s no better off than anywhere else. We’re even poorer than most, what with pirates seizing inbound supply ships... We’ll soon have naught to eat but what fish the waves see fit to provide. These are dark times we face...

speaker: Sage
text: When Rigel broke the Divine Accord, this plague of Terrors fell upon us. But surely their own lands must be suffering the same fate. What could have driven them to invade Zofia at such a price? I would dearly love to know what’s going through Emperor Rudolf’s mind...

speaker: Nomah
text: May you walk always in the light of Mila’s blessing, little one.

speaker: Mae
text: Celica! I heard the news! You’re going to the Temple of Mila, right? If so, then I'm going too. You can't say no!

speaker: Celica
text: Heh. Thanks, Mae. To be honest, I’d welcome the help.

speaker: Boey
text: Good, because I’m coming too. I’m not letting the two of you off on your own.

speaker: Mae
text: Letting us? Heh, you say that like you think you can keep us safe.

speaker: Boey
text: I do! And I can! I’ll be more help than you, at least.

speaker: Mae
text: Uh, rude? AND wrong! I can conjure lightning, Boey. Big, hurty lightning. What’ve you got, fire? Maybe I’ll call you if I want to roast marshmallows.

speaker: Celica
text: Let’s just say you’d both be a great help and leave it at that, shall we? I know I’ll be counting on you both. This isn’t going to be an easy journey. Still, I'm glad I'll have such good company.

speaker: Genny
text: Celica? Can I...go with you?

speaker: Genny
text: What? No? Awww... I was really hoping I could help you out...

speaker: Genny
text: Did you need something? Wait, can I go with you now?!

speaker: Cleric
text: Er, pardon me. ...Excuse me? Might I trouble you to show me Mila's Turnwheel for a moment?

speaker: Cleric
text: Ah! Of course! It is just as I thought. Ancient as it is, it's little wonder some of the cogs are missing. While it appears to still function, it has lost some of its true capability. I suspect the counterpart to your Turnwheel is in the same condition. I can't imagine its bearer is more gentle with it than you, Celica. If you were able to find the missing cogs, I could attempt a repair. A restored Turnwheel would be able to turn back even more time. You’re curious where the cogs might be, yes? Yes, of course. Sadly, I couldn’t say. That’s the trouble with ancient artifacts! They’re always scattering their bits at various locations around the world.

speaker: Cleric
text: Ah, of course. Forgive me for presuming.

speaker: Cleric
text: Mila's Turnwheel is incomplete in its current state, its power diminished. If you could recover all of the missing cogs, it could be restored. Surely the ability to turn back more time in battle would be most welcome!

speaker: Cleric
text: My word! My stars and garters! It seems all the cogs have been restored to Mila's Turnwheel! You should now be able to use it to its fullest, most potential-y potential. What's more, I can rest easy knowing that the artifact is now whole. Thank you for repairing this treasure. Allow me to give you this in recognition of your fine efforts.

speaker: Cleric
text: Thank you for restoring Mila’s Turnwheel to its former glory.

speaker: Languid Hermit
text: Such poor, damnable souls... ...Me? Why, I speak of the revenants that haunt Novis Cemetery, of course. They were once good people of the island, all buried with love and care. But now the world’s rotting, and they’ve risen as Terrors to prey on the living. If you've a beating heart inside you, give them the rest they deserve. Last I looked, at least twenty of the poor souls stalked the area.

speaker: Languid Hermit
text: Please grant peace to the revenants. They’ve suffered enough. If you could free just twenty from their curse, it would be a mercy.

speaker: Languid Hermit
text: Ah, I can see you’ve laid twenty revenants to rest. It is a kindness. You have my thanks. And you’ve set my own mind to peace as well. I’ve not much, but you deserve a reward for your service.

speaker: Celica
text: Ships leaving the port will get us to the mainland. We should head there now. Though that DOES mean we’ll have to pass through the cemetery on our way. Rumor has it there have been Terrors appearing there as of late. Let’s be ready for anything.

speaker: Boey
text: Milady, this graveyard we’re passing through... Er, why are we, again?

speaker: Celica
text: Because it’s the only way to port.

speaker: Boey
text: Yes, but there’s been talk of Terrors around here as of late...

speaker: Celica
text: So there has. Best keep our wits about us then, hmm?

speaker: Boey
text: But milady, I... I’ll face down thieves or rogues any day, but Terrors? Terrors are...different.

speaker: Mae
text: Oh, Boey. How can you be so scared of spooks and spirits at your age?

speaker: Boey
text: Shove off, would you? A man can’t help what gives him fright!

speaker: Celica
text: Ha, ha.

speaker: Boey
text: Oh, not you too, milady? You wound me...

speaker: Celica
text: I'm sorry, Boey. I was just remembering my brother.

speaker: Boey
text: Brother? I didn’t realize you had one.

speaker: Celica
text: Yes, though by different mothers. He was a sweet thing, but meek. Frightened to death of ghosts. Then he became one, alas. And much too young... Were he alive, you two would have been quite alike, I’m sure.

speaker: Boey
text: Milady, I...

speaker: Mae
text: Way to go, Boey. Your whining’s gone and dredged up a bunch of sad memories for Celica.

speaker: Boey
text: What? Why is this MY fault?!

speaker: Mae
text: Uhh, because it's ALWAYS your fault! Now suck it up and get ready to fry some foes—Terrors or otherwise!

speaker: Celica
text: Terrain bears no influence on magic. I remember Sir Mycen saying so. Listen close, friends: do not be shy about when and where you attack! Even if our foes cower in the woods, our spells will find their mark!

speaker: Celica
text: Um, excuse me, but—

speaker: Old Timer
text: Ah, lady priestess! Welcome. Something I can help you with today?

speaker: Celica
text: I need to book passage to Zofia Harbor.

speaker: Old Timer
text: Hrm... I’m afraid that’s a difficult wish to grant, even for you, priestess. This patch of sea is teeming with pirates of late. It’s just too dangerous.

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, that’s no good...

speaker: Old Timer
text: That being said...if milady were to do something about those pirates... well, that’d be a different matter altogether now, wouldn’t it?

speaker: Celica
text: You want me to...fight pirates?

speaker: Old Timer
text: They’ve grown bolder by the day, so they have. And yet, His Highness hasn’t seen fit to send so much as a single man... This sea’s our love and livelihood. We can’t live cut off from her. Ah, what’s happened to Zofia?

speaker: Celica
text: Hmm...

speaker: Old Timer
text: Forgive me, milady, but I can’t get you across the sea so long as pirates sail it. I know I ask much of you, priestess, but if you would lend us your strength...

speaker: Boey
text: Hmm... What are we supposed to do now?

speaker: Mae
text: I can’t believe that old timer tossed his pirate problem right at our feet! Do we LOOK like the type to fight pirates? We’re delicate little blossoms!

speaker: Boey
text: Speak for yourself!

speaker: Celica
text: Regardless, the man is right. We’ll not get anywhere until ships are free to sail again.

speaker: Boey
text: What do you propose, milady?

speaker: Celica
text: Let’s gather what help we can find. The sea is only the start. Zofia is at war, and ravaged by Terrors besides. We’ll not make it very far traveling alone. We need allies. Strong ones.

speaker: Boey
text: Yes, and mad enough to set sail into pirate-infested waters with us... I’m sure they’ll just be lining up to take the job.

speaker: Old Timer
text: No ships can sail so long as pirates stalk these waters. If you feel the danger’s too great alone, perhaps you might court additional aid?

speaker: Saber
text: You lost, little lass? This ain’t a place for children.

speaker: Celica
text: You’re Saber, yes?

speaker: Saber
text: Yep. Who’re you, girl?

speaker: Celica
text: My name is Celica. The people here speak quite highly of your skill with a blade. I’d like to enlist your services as a protector...

speaker: Saber
text: Guard duty, eh? You headed somewhere, or is this a local deal?

speaker: Celica
text: We seek the Temple of Mila.

speaker: Saber
text: That’s awfully far... And I suppose you’ve already heard about our little pirate problem?

speaker: Celica
text: It’s the reason I seek your aid, in fact. Unless you think a few mere pirates are too much for you to handle?

speaker: Saber
text: Oh, that’s real cute. Believe me, lass, I ain’t worried about a couple sea rats. All I’m worried about is if you can pay. I don’t work charity cases. Especially when I’m risking my own neck.

speaker: Celica
text: I’m afraid I haven’t much money, but I do have this.

speaker: Saber
text: A dagger. *whistle* Well, ain’t you fancy?

speaker: Celica
text: Will this be sufficient for your services?

speaker: Saber
text: You mean will I risk life and limb for a single dagger? Ordinarily, no. BUT...since I like your moxie, I’m gonna go ahead and give you a break. You got a deal. I’ll get you to your temple.

speaker: Celica
text: Wonderful! You have my thanks, Saber. Mae! Boey! Did you hear that? He’s going to come with us!

speaker: Saber
text: Heh. This job’s got easy money written all over it. What kind of fool hands over treasure like this without batting an eye? She really must be daddy’s spoiled little lass...

speaker: Old Timer
text: Ah, lady priestess. You’ve returned.

speaker: Celica
text: I have! And this gentleman, Saber, has agreed to aid us. Now may we ask you to set sail?

speaker: Old Timer
text: Well, then, I’d be honored to do my part, milady. Come aboard. We’ll depart as soon as you’re ready.

speaker: Man
text: Good day, milady. Are you thinking of leaving for Zofia, perchance? If so, I fear you may be in for some disappointment. Ships aren’t sailing, or so I’m told. Too many pirates about. Still, probably best you went to the docks and asked the captain yourself.

speaker: Woman
text: He may smell like a tavern floor, but that Saber’s a skilled sellsword. If you ever find yourself in need of steel, you could do far worse than him. Though if that steel needs a history fit for retelling in polite company, well... He’s strong, though, I’ll give him that. And I suppose...passably handsome.

speaker: Young Woman
text: There’s a shrine on a small island up ahead, you know. Its vault holds an otherworldly sword, or so the stories go. Many have died for such stories, though, so consider this fair warning. See, turns out that islet is home to a terrible necrodragon. Eat you in a single bite, it will! What if the fear don’t kill you first. Augh, just the thought of it is enough to turn my hair to white!

speaker: Young Man
text: Heading out to sea, milady? Be careful out there amongst the waves. A vile man named Barth has named himself pirate king of these waters. He sits in his island hold to the east and commits what barbary he pleases. Just the other day, a man who’d had his whole family slain set out for revenge. Like as not, he’ll meet the same fate. At least he’ll be reunited with his kin...

speaker: Man
text: Chancellor Desaix has taken up the throne at Zofia Castle. The villain thinks slaying a king makes you next in line... He’s a right tyrant! Sir Clive of the Order of Zofian Knights has gathered an army to run him off, but from what we hear in these parts, fighting’s been hard and progress slow.

speaker: Tavernkeep
text: For a while there, I was obsessed with making my own tinctures. I’d take any herbs and botanicals I could find and mash ’em up. Of all my creations, the best was something I called “medicinal syrup.” If you had three mana herbs on you, I could whip up a batch right now.

speaker: Tavernkeep
text: Ah, I see you’re well stocked. I’ll have your syrup ready to go in no time flat.

speaker: Tavernkeep
text: Well, I’ll be here if the craving strikes. You just let me know.

speaker: Tavernkeep
text: Hey, c’mon! You don’t even HAVE three mana herbs! Track down three of those bad boys and then come talk to me.

speaker: Tavernkeep
text: If you had three mana herbs, I could whip you up some medicinal syrup.

speaker: Mae
text: What’s wrong, Celica? Feelin’ blue?

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, it’s nothing. It’s just that the last time I was on a ship was when I came to the island.

speaker: Mae
text: Hey, that’s right! Boey and I used to take little trips every now and again, but never with you. Shame we never got to travel as a group. Woulda been way more fun?

speaker: Boey
text: Are you completely daft, Mae? Celica came here in hiding, remember? She can’t just announce herself by hopping aboard a pleasure cruise.

speaker: Mae
text: Uh, I know that much, Boey! Of course I do! I’m just saying I’m happy we’re getting the chance NOW. Isn’t that right, Celica?

speaker: Boey
text: Please stop talking before you dig a grave so deep we all go tumbling in...

speaker: Celica
text: Ha ha. It’s fine, Boey. Really. And I’m happy to be travelling with you as well, Mae. Though I’m also anxious... What could have happened to Mila? Will we even make it to the temple to find out? And...

speaker: Mae
text: Aaaaand?

speaker: Celica
text: I’m sorry. Best I keep this one to myself.

speaker: Mae
text: Whaaat?! Oh, that’s just mean!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm... Where are you right now? And what are you doing? Are you still living in that village with grandpapa? ...No. I can tell. You’ve left your home behind, haven’t you? I want to see you so badly. There’s so much I need to ask. Perhaps Mila will cause our paths to cross on this journey...

speaker: Jedah
text: Are you in pain, my lord Duma? The sight tears at my heart... But you needn’t endure it much longer. I’ve had report that the girl has left the island. I will deliver her to you without fail. She of the fated children... Bearer of the Brand...

speaker: Pirate
text: Yar! Not a step further, ye scurvy dogs!

speaker: Old Timer
text: Eagh! P-p-pirates!

speaker: Pirate
text: These waters belong to Barth the Pirate King, as yer surely aware! That means ye needs pay a toll... All yer goods and women’ll do nicely!

speaker: Celica
text: An interesting offer...but I fear we must nevertheless decline. The sea belongs to no one man—she’s a gift to every citizen of Zofia.

speaker: Pirate
text: Yar, who be the mouthy wench?!

speaker: Saber
text: Enough with the chit-chat. Reason and logic are wasted on sea dogs like him. Let’s just get to business already. That’s what you hired me for, ain’t it?

speaker: Celica
text: Fair enough. Let’s go, everyone!

speaker: Old Timer
text: Look there. Do you see that small island to the east? That’s where Barth’s keep stands. He’s the pirate king of these waters. Unfortunately this current means we’ll have to sail right past it. It’ll be trouble if we’re seen, so let’s unfurl the sails and be quick about it.

speaker: Celica
text: Hold a moment. If we were to deal with this "Barth", would this stretch of ocean be safer?

speaker: Old Timer
text: Well, yes, undoubtedly—but no sane person picks a fight with a pirate king!

speaker: Saber
text: Whoa there, lass. I signed up for a nice, easy escort job, not to storm some pirate hold.

speaker: Celica
text: Mmm... I see. ...Very well then. I shall lead the charge myself. You need only worry about keeping me safe.

speaker: Saber
text: Now just a—

speaker: Celica
text: The people of that island are suffering under the tyranny of those pirates. I can’t stand by knowing starving innocents are being routinely plundered.

speaker: Saber
text: Oh, for the love of... Look, I ain’t sure why I have to remind you of this, but you’re on a mission. And you can’t finish it if you keep pokin’ your nose where it don’t belong.

speaker: Celica
text: I have no intention of wasting time on idle philanthropy, Saber. But there are no guarantees I’ll ever return from this journey. I would at least like to ensure peace to those who have been so kind to me. Is that so unreasonable?

speaker: Saber
text: Hrm... Fine. It’s your neck—go ahead and risk it on whatever fool thing ya like.

speaker: Celica
text: Thank you, Saber.

speaker: Barth
text: By the mighty parrot of Shanty Pete! What be that racket? Yar har ho! Looks like more little mice be squeakin’ into me keep!

speaker: Celica
text: Are you the one they call Barth? I order you to halt your piracy and leave these waters at once!

speaker: Barth
text: Gar har har! I’ll do no such thing, ye shrill woman! No one enters the lair of the Pirate King and starts squawkin’ orders but me!

speaker: Saber
text: You see, lass? What’d I tell you about trying to reason with sea dogs?

speaker: Barth
text: Yar, bold words from a fool man. Well, I’ll put yer steel to the test! Have at ’em, boys! Take the man’s guts for garters, but leave the wench alive. I’ll not have a single scratch on her... Ruins the sale price, it do! Yar har ho!

speaker: Saber
text: See what I mean?

speaker: Celica
text: Redemption is a lost cause for a man like you, Barth. Your reign as pirate king ends here!

speaker: Valbar
text: Hmm...? What’s with the sudden shift in position?

speaker: Leon
text: Well, I’ll be. Looks like another band has joined the fray.

speaker: Valbar
text: Heh. Must be our lucky day. Splitting their forces in two should make Barth that much easier to defeat.

speaker: Kamui
text: You know why I like you, Valbar? Because you’re such an optimist. From where I’m standing, our odds look somewhere between grim and dire.

speaker: Leon
text: What, you mean because we’re horribly outnumbered?

speaker: Valbar
text: You two better stop gabbing like hens and start fighting like you want to live. Now, if we can take Barth out of the picture, his goons should scatter... So you know what to do, right, boys? Ignore the runts and take aim for Barth!

speaker: Celica
text: I heard talk in port about a man seeking revenge on Barth for killing his family... Perhaps this is his crew? Let’s advance with caution and try to aid their cause.

speaker: Barth
text: Yar, I’ve keelhauled bigger mice’n you in me spit!

speaker: Barth
text: Yar? Yaaaaaar... I was supposed to be... the king o’ the seas...

speaker: Celica
text: Whew... It looks like those men are all okay.

speaker: Valbar
text: Oh ho! Look who the cat dragged in! I’m Valbar, by the way. You really saved my bacon back there. And since that dastard Barth is dead, my family can finally rest... *sniffle* ...Er, right. Sorry. Got a little emotional there for a second. So hey, is there anything I can do to thank you? I’ll be honest—I’m not good at much besides crackin’ skulls. But if you NEED skulls cracked, I’m your man! What do you say?

speaker: Valbar
text: Well, that’s no fun. But hey, come see me if you change your mind.

speaker: Valbar
text: Hey, you’re back! Decide you have room for me after all? Find a skull or three that needs bustin’?

speaker: Leon
text: I’m sorry, what did you need? ...Ah yes. Apologies, but I’m not going anywhere without my dear Valbar. Go talk to him if you’re looking for recruits.

speaker: Leon
text: You’re going off with them, old friend? Well, they’d better make room, because I go where you go! No complaints about that, right? Everybody on the same page? ...Great.

speaker: Leon
text: Ugh! Now you’re just being petty. Your beauty is going to make you a tyrant someday if you aren’t careful. Honestly, I don’t even have the words.

speaker: Leon
text: Oh. It’s you again. Decided you need me after all?

speaker: Kamui
text: Sorry, but I’ve got a contract with Valbar. If you want to negotiate with me, you need to go through him first.

speaker: Kamui
text: You joining up with this lot, Valbar? Interesting... Well, it’s your call—I don’t have a preference either way. Oh, but let me ask you one question: Do you have Seraphim magic? If not, then you’d best stay clear of the Seabound Shrine. Necrodragons are the one thing I absolutely refuse to tangle with.

speaker: Kamui
text: Yeah? All right. I guess we part ways here, then. Good luck.

speaker: Kamui
text: Hmm? What is it? Now you want me to come with you?

speaker: Leon
text: *sob* Valbar... How could you go and leave me all alone like this? How do I go on without you? This is on your heads! All of you! And I’m coming with you to make sure he didn’t die in vain.

speaker: Leon
text: Selfish dastards! Try thinking of someone else for once! Enough. Just go. ...GO already!

speaker: Kamui
text: I can’t believe that damn fool Valbar is dead. What happens now? Not to be crass, but we had a contract, and now there’s no way to collect.. ...Say, any chance you lot want to hire me on?

speaker: Kamui
text: Yeah, I figured it was a stretch. I guess this is goodbye, then. Best of luck.

speaker: Valbar
text: Wait, you two are comin’?

speaker: Leon
text: Well, obviously. I go where you go—that’s the deal. And I don’t care who doesn’t like it.

speaker: Kamui
text: And I just go wherever the money flows like wine!

speaker: Valbar
text: You jokers are a couple of real class acts. You ever stop to think that maybe you’re being rude to the priestess?! She’s on a holy mission to... Er, a mission of... It’s important, okay?!

speaker: Celica
text: It’s all right, Valbar—they’re welcome to come along if they like. It’s an honor and a pleasure to have such capable company. They’ve both proven their skill, and can be rather amusing to boot. So I thank you one and all for brightening our journey.

speaker: Valbar
text: Aw shucks, milady... We should be the ones thanking YOU!

speaker: Leon
text: My my, that was some praise... I thought I’d give at least 50 percent... but now you get all of it!

speaker: Kamui
text: You know me. I’ll give you as much as you pay me for.

speaker: Valbar
text: Did you jokers hear ANYTHING I just said?

speaker: Celica
text: Hee hee!

speaker: Young Man
text: We’re sailors from Rigel, we is. We owes you our freedom! Zofian pirate scum ride the sea like they owns it, but what’s our emperor do? Not a damn thing! Guess his precious war’s all he cares about. Just what kinda man’s he become, anyway?

speaker: Old Timer
text: As a boy, Rigel’s Emperor Rudolf was as fine a crown prince as you could desire. But since ascending to the throne... Well, something has certainly changed. Still, I continue to place my faith in him, as must we all.

speaker: Man
text: You’re going to the Seabound Shrine, eh, priestess? Oh, I’ve heard tale of a wondrous treasure that sleeps there... but while I like a bit of coin as much as the next, I’d urge you to reconsider. For a necrodragon filled with deadly purpose is said to haunt that place! Steel won’t even tickle its hide. They say it scoffs at all but Seraphim magic.

speaker: Celica
text: There’s only...one of them? What’s going on here?

speaker: Cantor
text: *laugh* So you’re the girl, eh? Serving you up on a platter will earn me a swift promotion within the faith. Now that I’ve washed this place clean of pirate vermin, you will come with me.

speaker: Boey
text: Are you out of your mind, old man? We’re in a hurry here, and you’re in our way. So would you kindly get out of it?

speaker: Cantor
text: Impudent child... Such a glib tongue will earn you nothing but pain.

speaker: Boey
text: Heh. Do you honestly plan to take us on all by yourself?

speaker: Celica
text: Wait a second—is he? Oh no... Watch out, everyone! He’s a cantor! He means to summon Terrors to fight for him!

speaker: Boey
text: He means to summon... Wait, WHAT?!

speaker: Boey
text: *sigh* It’s over... Thank the Mother. Milady, what was that all about? That creep was talking about...serving you up or some such...?

speaker: Celica
text: I don’t know, Boey. But he was different from the others who have come after me. And I fear he won’t be the last...so we’d best be extra careful moving forward.

speaker: Boey
text: Really? Here? We have to come HERE, milady? Have you not heard of the unspeakable beast that haunts this place?

speaker: Celica
text: We may find something of use here, Boey. Besides, the whole of Novis was terrified. We can’t very well do nothing.

speaker: Saber
text: Oh, I’m pretty sure we can. I’ve told you before, lass—you need to stop dumping extra work on my— ...Hmm?

speaker: Boey
text: NuuuoooooaaAAAAAAAAAGH! It’s HERE!

speaker: Kamui
text: Whoa, whoa, whoa—hey, Priestess! Did you forget our little chat about staying clear of the Seabound Shrine? Because this is not staying clear! This is the exact OPPOSITE of staying clear!

speaker: Celica
text: I’m sorry, did we discuss that? I must’ve been preoccupied... What if there’s something of use here? Surely you would want to— Ooooh, I remember now. You’re scared of necrodragons, aren’t you, Kamui? How careless of me. It completely slipped my mind!

speaker: Kamui
text: Slipped your mind... That’s it. I’m waiting on the boat.

speaker: Celica
text: Er, actually...

speaker: Kamui
text: GyaaaeeeeeeeEEEEEEEK! It’s HERE!

speaker: Celica
text: Goodness. What a horrifying creature. But I have the Seraphim spell in my quiver now. May its light guide your lost soul on to slumber eternal!

speaker: Celica
text: The damp, chilly air of the cave bears the scent of the ocean. There’s no sign of anyone coming through here; scared off by the Necrodragon, I imagine.

speaker: Feeble Man
text: I-is that... Yes! You there! Please! F-food... Anything... I beg of ya!

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: ...Ahhhh! Many thanks. Now I’m finally startin’ to feel human again. I’m a fisherman. All of Zofia Harbor knows of me, so they do. But ten days ago, I ran into a fearsome storm that washed me ashore here. “Thank Mila, I’m saved!” I thought. ...Then the necrodragon showed up. I ran in here and hid, but m’food stores ran out and... Well, you see. ...Eh? The necrodragon is dead? And by yer hand?! Well, that’s marvelous news! I can go home now! Here, lemme see if... This is all I have, but please take it.

speaker: Feeble Man
text: ...What? Really? I’ve real questions... about yer...moral compass...friend...

speaker: Feeble Man
text: Sorry, but I was thinkin’ something... a bit more... Ya know... Meaty. A bit meatier. More...meat-like. ...Look, ya gots any meat?

speaker: Skilled Angler
text: Oh, didja know about this place? They say this shrine’s also the tomb of a priestess what protected this region. Tales say she was given a grand burial along with her trusty blade. Can’t say I saw anything like that here, though, and I walked around a fair bit. Did feel a breeze coming through by the well in the back, though. If you were thinkin’ to explore, I’d tell ya to start there. Well, I’m off to patch m’boat and sail her back to Zofia. Safe travels, one’n all!

speaker: Python
text: Huh? What, you lot selling something? Maybe pottage spoons or holy relics? Well, sorry to say, but we ain’t buying. Nobody’s home, see? Well, nobody ‘cept for one hardworking guard. ...Handsome too, might I add.

speaker: Python
text: ...What is it? If you’ve no business here, shove off. A fellow can’t nap when he’s crowded.

speaker: Forsyth
text: Greetings, travellers. We don’t tend to get many visitors out this way. Know that you stand in the sacred halls of the Deliverance! Er, however, it seems everyone has taken leave of the sacred halls for the moment. As such, it falls upon I to hold down the fort! ...Er, or the halls. As it were.

speaker: Forsyth
text: If it’s our leader you seek, you should make your way to Zofia Castle.

speaker: Celica
text: Wait a second... Silque? Is that you?

speaker: Silque
text: Ah! Sister Celica! Fate is indeed strange, that it would have us meet in this place.

speaker: Celica
text: We haven’t heard from you since you left the priory on Novis. We were all worried sick.

speaker: Silque
text: That was never my intent. Forgive me. But I aim to play my part here, no matter the cost. And I see I’m not the only sister to have flown the nest. Set a course by your own star, Celica, and never stray from it. May you walk always in the light of Mila’s blessing.

speaker: Silque
text: May you walk always in the light of Mila’s blessing.

speaker: Celica
text: Ram Village... How I’ve missed this place. I wonder how everyone’s doing?

speaker: Celica
text: Mycen? Grandpapa, it’s me! ...Hmm, not here. I wonder where he’s gone.

speaker: Woman
text: Celica? Is that you, dear? Well, isn’t this a delight?! What a lovely woman you’ve become. Last I recall, you were just a sprout!

speaker: Old Timer
text: Ho, Celica! How long has it been? The village may look the same, but it’s a different place these days. The young ones have all up and left, what with the war. I just pray they all return to us...

speaker: Kliff
text: Celica? Celica, is that you? How long has it been?! I can’t believe you came back to the village! Alm and the others are gone, I’m afraid. It’s...a long story. Oh, and Sir Mycen vanished around the same time. *sigh* Ram Village was never all that exciting, but now it’s unbearably dull. So where are you off to, mmm? Somewhere grand, no doubt. Say, why don’t you let me come along? I bet we could both use the company.

speaker: Kliff
text: Fine, whatever. I wasn’t that interested anyway. I’ll just stay here and...uh...till the land.

speaker: Kliff
text: Huh? Now you want me to come with you after all? Make up your mind!

speaker: Faye
text: ...Huh? Oh, Celica! You’re back! Gosh, how long has it been? I’ve missed you so much! Alm left Ram. Did you know that? Just up and LEFT! I’m so desperately lonely... Anyway, I thought about going after him just to teach him a lesson, but I didn’t. I’d probably get killed by some foul beast out there on my own, you know? Hey, wait... Are you on a journey or a quest or whatever? Then maybe I could go with you!

speaker: Faye
text: R- really? Oh. I suppose it was foolish of me to ask something like that. But listen, if you see Alm, tell him... Well, just tell him he has a home here and always will.

speaker: Faye
text: Did you change your mind? Can I come with you?

speaker: Soldier
text: Three huzzahs for Zofia’s liberators, and three huzzahs for Alm! Truly, he is the hero Zofia has been waiting for. And he’s every bit the champion General Mycen was! Make no mistake, the Rigelian Empire’s as fearsome a foe as they come, but with Alm leading our forces, we needn’t fear any man!

speaker: Mercenary
text: Everyone’s laughing and cheering, but my gut’s one big knot. Only a fool’d think the Rigelian Empire would back down without a fight. Emperor Rudolf’s order of knights are scary enough... but what about that Duma priest Jedah and his horde of arcanists? How are normal folk s’posed to fight against men who conjure Terrors?

speaker: Woman
text: Are you headed for the Temple of Mila, lady priestess? Oh, I do wish you’d reconsider. That whole area’s crawling with thieves working in the employ of Grieth. The very ground itself is rotten! Hunks of cliffside slough off near every day. You might easily find yourself with no way back...so be careful, okay?

speaker: Young Woman
text: Sure, Desaix and those Rigelian thugs turned tail and ran, but our crops still aren’t growing and we’ve no shortage of Terrors ... What do you suppose could’ve happened to Mila? Some men have gone to the temple to investigate, but none have returned. I say we’ve bigger problems than fighting a war, but no one asks me...

speaker: Celica
text: ...Grandpapa?! What are you doing here?

speaker: Mycen
text: It’s been so very long, Celica.

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, Grandpapa! I’d half resigned myself to never seeing you again.

speaker: Mycen
text: As had I. And yet here you are, grown into a beautiful young woman. Though I fear we lack the time for a leisurely reunion. Surely you left the island with some purpose in mind, yes?

speaker: Celica
text: I did. I’m going to the Temple of Mila. All that’s transpiring in Zofia now is tied to the Earth Mother— I can feel it in my very marrow. There’s more to be done than simply fighting the foes laid before us. I must learn Mila’s will in all of this. I also intend to pray that she intercedes on behalf of her people. That she might save us all.

speaker: Mycen
text: I see. Just as Alm has chosen his path, it would seem you have chosen yours.

speaker: Celica
text: Alm?! I’d suspected as much, but your being here confirms it... He’s leading the Deliverance, isn’t he?

speaker: Mycen
text: Why don’t you go upstairs and see for yourself? I expect that’s where you’ll find what you’ve been searching for.

speaker: Celica
text: It’s really you!

speaker: Alm
text: Wha—?!

speaker: Alm
text: Wait a sec... Celica? Is that really you, Celica?!

speaker: Celica
text: Alm... I’m so glad to see you... I have dreamt about this day for seven years— At last... I’ve finally found you!

speaker: Alm
text: You have. I've missed you too... so much.

speaker: Alm
text: ...Wow, that’s quite the story. I’m trying to picture you swashbuckling pirates, and... Yeah, just...wow.

speaker: Celica
text: I didn’t mean to swashbuckle anyone. It just sort of...happened. But forget all that for the moment. Alm, you aren’t REALLY planning to fight the Rigelian Empire, are you?

speaker: Alm
text: Listen, it’s not... it’s not something I chose. They were the ones who attacked us.

speaker: Celica
text: But there must be a way to resolve things other than bloodshed, no?

speaker: Alm
text: That’s a pretty thought, Celica, but... I’m not sure it’s true. If it were, no one would be risking life and limb on the battlefield.

speaker: Celica
text: Is it really so naive? Zofians and Rigelians are both people of Valentia, are we not? I know we can reach some kind of accord if we just try. Besides that, I... I just can’t imagine Emperor Rudolf is the monster some claim him to be.

speaker: Alm
text: It doesn’t matter what sort of man he is. The Rigelian Empire chose to cross Zofia’s border—that’s a fact. We aim to drive back the invaders. Nothing more.

speaker: Celica
text: But why do YOU have to lead this rebellion? Mycen’s grandson or no, you’re neither knight nor noble. So why make yourself a target like this?

speaker: Alm
text: Nrgh... If I didn’t know any better, I’d swear I was speaking to a blue blood. My station doesn’t matter, Celica. I’m here because I was called. I have a duty to perform, and I’ll perform it. No more, and no less.

speaker: Celica
text: Oh, Alm...

speaker: Alm
text: Do you think I WANTED this fight? This all started because Lima IV went and angered the empire. If you wish to point fingers, point them at the ruler who failed his people. It’s his fault we’re in this mess.

speaker: Celica
text: That’s not... Well, so what if it is? Maybe you should go become king if it’s such a damnably easy job!

speaker: Alm
text: What? Celica, that’s not—

speaker: Celica
text: You’re awfully free with accusations for a boy with no idea what royalty entails! And now that you’re a “hero,” I imagine the throne is next on the list, is that it?!

speaker: Alm
text: No, it’s not like that at all, Celica! I just want to keep Zofia SAFE! Besides, there’s an heir; a princess of the royal family may have survived. If she turned up and fixed all this, I’d happily return to Ram. You could...come with me, you know? It’d be like old times.

speaker: Celica
text: Come on! There’s no secret princess! The Zofian royal family is dead!

speaker: Alm
text: But how can you be—

speaker: Celica
text: Enough! Just...enough. Go fight your war if it makes you happy! I’m going to the Temple of Mila. ...Good-bye, Alm. You... you stubborn JERK!

speaker: Alm
text: Celica... You’re one to talk about stubbornness, geez... Ah, damn it all. I didn’t even get the chance to ask her about the village... About why she had to leave. Oh, Celica... I had so much I wanted to say to you. How did it end up like this?

speaker: Alm
text: Good. You’re all here. Let’s be on our way.

speaker: Tobin
text: Uhm... Are you sure about this, Alm?

speaker: Alm
text: Am I sure about what?

speaker: Tobin
text: Oh, please. About Celica! You finally see her after gods-know how long, and you end up in a spat? Hey, don’t give me that look—we all know she took off in a right huff. You two used to be inseparable. What happened?

speaker: Alm
text: ...That was a long time ago, Tobin. A lot’s happened—to both of us.

speaker: Tobin
text: Hmm... Well, I’m no expert, but I think a normal person would just apologize. I’m sure she hasn’t gotten too far yet, what with those skinny legs and all...

speaker: Gray
text: Seriously, Tobin? Y-you’re passing out relationship advice now? Give it a rest—it’s not like every fight has a right side and a wrong side.

speaker: Tobin
text: Get over it, Gray. I’m well aware of that! It’s just... Well, this could be the last time Alm and Celica see each other. You’d think they’d wanna part on a...less-sour note.

speaker: Alm
text: It’s all right, Tobin. I appreciate what you’re saying. But this is something for me and Celica to work out on our own. Besides, I’m the leader of the Deliverance now. It wouldn’t be right to keep everyone waiting on my own private business.

speaker: Tobin
text: Alm...

speaker: Celica
text: *sigh*

speaker: Mae
text: Celica! Hey, Celica!

speaker: Celica
text: ...Hmm? I’m sorry, Mae. I was lost in thought. Did you need something?

speaker: Mae
text: Me? Naw, I’m fine like always. But what about YOU?! That guy leading the Deliverance is a friend of yours, right? I know we’re in a rush, but surely we had time for you to say good-bye!

speaker: Celica
text: It’s fine. That isn’t necessary.

speaker: Mae
text: But Celi—

speaker: Celica
text: Mae, I need to reach the Temple of Mila as soon as possible. I know the Mother will reveal a path to save Zofia that doesn’t involve violence.

speaker: Mae
text: I dunno about this, Boey... Celica’s acting all weird. I wonder what happened?

speaker: Boey
text: Well, can you blame her? I’m sure she’s more than a little conflicted. If the Deliverance defeats Desaix and drives the empire back, what next? Zofia will need a ruler, and who better than a boy who cast off tyranny’s yoke?

speaker: Mae
text: What?! But Celica’s the rightful heir!

speaker: Boey
text: Yeah, but she can’t exactly just go and announce that to everyone. If she did, she’d be made to lead the Deliverance effort herself. Believe me, that’s the last thing Celica wants right now.

speaker: Mae
text: I hate it when you make sense. Boey. But that just means we have to haul tail to the Temple of Mila! The Earth Mother will know what to do. She’ll take care of everything!

speaker: Boey
text: I pray it’s truly so simple.

speaker: Celica
text: Once we cross this mountain, we’ll finally reach the coast. It’s a hard climb, but I know we’ll make it.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Hold.

speaker: Celica
text: Hmm? Who’s there?

speaker: Celica
text: You’re the one from before! I’m glad our paths have crossed again. I’d hoped for a chance to properly thank you for helping us.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: I’ve no use for thanks. I come bearing a warning: proceed no further here.

speaker: Celica
text: What? I must know a reason for this warning.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: The terrain ahead is loose and prone to failure. Additionally, there are still forces in play who would see you harmed. If you must attain the Temple of Mila, strike west through the mountains.

speaker: Celica
text: West? But that’s where Alm...

speaker: Masked Knight
text: You have been warned.

speaker: Celica
text: Wait, please!

speaker: Mae
text: And he’s gone... AGAIN. I seriously wanna know who this creepy mask guy is and why he’s following us!

speaker: Celica
text: As do I, Mae. But regardless, this makes twice he’s aided us.

speaker: Boey
text: And with that dire warning ringing in our ears, what is your plan, milady? Do we follow Mr. Mask’s advice and take the western route? That would be quite a detour...

speaker: Saber
text: Do we have any cause to trust this masked fellow in the first place? Sure, he helped us out before, but that’s no guarantee of pure motive.

speaker: Mae
text: And what was that bit about, [imitating the Masked Knight] “forces in play who would see you harmed"? [normal voice] Is he saying MORE people are going to turn up and try to kidnap Celica?!

speaker: Celica
text: Hmm... No. We continue on as planned. I'm not dismissing what he said, but our purpose cannot brook delay. If we are attacked, I have faith we can prevail. Besides, even the cleverest trap will betray some sign to a watchful eye, so as long as we continue to be vigilant, we’ll be all right.

speaker: Arcanist
text: Hmph. And here she is at last. Do not mistake me for the base fools who came before. My power was bestowed upon me by Jedah himself. Now go, crush the girl and the pitiful insects accompanying her!

speaker: Saber
text: Waugh! Earthquake?!

speaker: Mae
text: Gah! I c-can’t even stand!

speaker: Saber
text: Look out! The cliff is crumbling!

speaker: Boey
text: Oh, you have to be joking! As if anything else could have gone wrong on this blasted adventure!

speaker: Celica
text: Everyone, be careful!

speaker: Boey
text: Celica?! No! Don’t come any closer!

speaker: Boey
text: MILADY!!!

speaker: Mae
text: Celica, are you all right?!

speaker: Celica
text: (hurt grunt) ...Huh?

speaker: Celica
text: Why did I suspect I’d see you again?

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Are you unhurt?

speaker: Celica
text: It appears I am...thanks to you. I owe you an apology. You warned me this would happen, and yet I—

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Do not apologize, but stop allowing petty emotion to cloud your judgment. Your choices steer the fates of more than just yourself.

speaker: Celica
text: ...You’re right. I can offer no rebuttal.

speaker: Masked Knight
text: Still, there’s little sense in turning back when you’re almost through. The Zofian coast is just ahead. The road beyond should offer safe passage.

speaker: Celica
text: How can you be certain?

speaker: Masked Knight
text: My prey were kind enough to use magic potent enough to reveal their location.

speaker: Celica
text: Gone again, as sudden as ever. I wish he would at least offer his name.

speaker: Mae
text: Yeah, talk about your shady characters! Still, I s’pose he seems like a decent- enough guy.

speaker: Saber
text: Yeah, well, Mr. Mask seems to enjoy our company. I wager we’ll see him again. And you’re sure you’ve got no guess as to who he might be?

speaker: Celica
text: None. I’ve no allies left in this world, save the ones I travel with now.

speaker: Saber
text: Oof... Didn’t mean to sour the mood. Forget I asked.

speaker: Celica
text: It’s all right... But back to the matter at hand, the road is well and truly blocked now. I don’t think we’ll be heading back that way any time soon.

speaker: Boey
text: Then it’s a lucky thing we’ve no need to head that direction.

speaker: Celica
text: Now we couldn’t go to aid Alm even if we wanted to...

speaker: Boey
text: Milady?

speaker: Celica
text: It’s nothing. We’ve spent enough time here. Let’s press on.

speaker: Alm
text: Whoa, what’s that sound?

speaker: Clive
text: The ground is unstable around here. There must have been another rock slide. Some distance off, from the sound of it. We’ve no worry of harm to our men.

speaker: Alm
text: That’s good, but---

speaker: Mercenary
text: A report, sir. A cliff has given way along the eastern ridge. The route to the Zofian coast is blocked.

speaker: Alm
text: The eastern ridge? That’s the direction Celica was heading. Oh, Celica, please be all right.

speaker: Peddler
text: S’cuse me, sir! You’re Alm, yes? I’m a traveling peddler of sorts. Bit’o this and a scrap’a that. Occasionally, I even do deliveries! ...Here. This is from a lady of the cloth. “Mila's Turnwheel,” she called it. Looks mighty fancy, so it does! That’s all I know, so you’ll have to figure out the rest on your lonesome. And with that...another job well done! Safe travels now, eh?
